translated: He does not criticize the teaching, he does not criticize the teacher, he does not criticize himself, his mind is not distracted, and he applies himself to the meaning.

original: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahi dhammehi samannāgato suṇanto saddhammaṁ bhabbo niyāmaṁ okkamituṁ kusalesu dhammesu sammattan”ti.

original: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahi dhammehi samannāgato suṇantopi saddhammaṁ abhabbo niyāmaṁ okkamituṁ kusalesu dhammesu sammattaṁ.

analyzed: makkhī dhammam suṇāti makkha pariyuṭṭhitaḥ upārambha cittaḥ dhammam suṇāti randha gavesī dhamma desake āhata cittaḥ hoti khīla jātaḥ duppaññaḥ hoti jaḷaḥ eḷamūgaḥ an aññāte aññāta mānī hoti
translated: He listens to the Dhamma with disrespect, with a disrespectful mind, seeking faults, and he is hostile to the teacher. He is of little intelligence, dull, drooling, and witless. He is conceited, thinking he knows and is learned, and he is not one who trains in accordance with the Dhamma.

original: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahi dhammehi samannāgato suṇantopi saddhammaṁ abhabbo niyāmaṁ okkamituṁ kusalesu dhammesu sammattaṁ.
analyzed: imehi kho bhikkhave pañcahi dhammehi samannāgataḥ suṇantaḥ api saddhammam abhabbaḥ niyāmam okkamitum kusalesu dhammesu
translated: When a person has these five qualities, even if he listens to the true Dhamma, he is incapable of entering upon the certainty of rightness in regard to skillful qualities.

original: Pañcahi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato suṇanto saddhammaṁ bhabbo niyāmaṁ okkamituṁ kusalesu dhammesu sammattaṁ.
analyzed: pañcahi bhikkhave dhammehi samannāgataḥ suṇantaḥ saddhammam bhabbaḥ niyāmam okkamitum kusalesu dhammesu
translated: When a person has five qualities, he is capable of entering upon the certainty of rightness in regard to skillful qualities even if he listens to the true Dhamma.

original: Katamehi pañcahi?🔽Amakkhī dhammaṁ suṇāti na makkhapariyuṭṭhito, anupārambhacitto dhammaṁ suṇāti na🔽randhagavesī, dhammadesake anāhatacitto hoti akhīlajāto, paññavā hoti ajaḷo aneḷamūgo,
analyzed: katamehi pañcahi  a makkhī dhammam suṇāti na makkha pariyuṭṭhitaḥ an upārambha cittaḥ dhammam suṇāti na  randha gavesī dhammadesake anāhata cittaḥ hoti a khīla jāto paññavā hoti a jaḷaḥ an eḷa mūgo
translated: What are the five?🔽He listens to the Dhamma with respect, with a respectful mind, not seeking faults, and he is not hostile to the teacher. He is of much intelligence, not dull, not drooling, and not witless.

original: na anaññāte aññātamānī hoti.
analyzed: na an aññāte aññāta mānī hoti
translated: He is not conceited, thinking he knows and is learned, and he is one who trains in accordance with the Dhamma.

original: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahi dhammehi samannāgato suṇanto saddhammaṁ bhabbo niyāmaṁ okkamituṁ kusalesu dhammesu sammattan”ti.🔽Tatiyaṁ.
analyzed: imehi kho bhikkhave pañcahi dhammehi samannāgataḥ suṇantaḥ saddhammam bhabbaḥ niyāmam okkamitum kusalesu dhammesu sammattanti  tatiya
translated: When someone has these five qualities, they’re capable of entering and remaining in rightness in skillful qualities.”🔽The third section for recitation on the one who is not capable of entering rightness is finished.

translated: They, too, become luxurious & lax, leaders in backsliding, discarding the duty of solitude; they do not rouse energy for the attainment of the as-yet-unattained, for the achievement of the as-yet-unachieved, for the realization of the as-yet-unrealized.

translated: When the Saṅgha is divided, there is mutual denigration, mutual disparaging, mutual defaming, mutual condemnation.

original: Tattha appasannā ceva nappasīdanti, pasannānañca ekaccānaṁ aññathattaṁ hoti.
analyzed: tattha appasannā ca iva na pasīdanti pasannānam ca ekaccānam aññathattam hoti
translated: Those without confidence are not confirmed in their confidence, while some with confidence are confirmed in their lack of confidence.

original: Ayaṁ, bhikkhave, pañcamo dhammo saddhammassa sammosāya antaradhānāya saṁvattati.
analyzed: aya bhikkhave pañcamaḥ dhammo saddhammassa sammosāya antaradhānāya savattati
translated: This is the fifth thing that leads to the decline and disappearance of the good Dhamma.

original: Ime kho, bhikkhave, pañca dhammā saddhammassa sammosāya antaradhānāya saṁvattanti.
analyzed: ime kho bhikkhave pañca dhammā saddhammassa sammosāya antaradhānāya savattanti
translated: These are the five things that lead to the decline and disappearance of the good Dhamma.

original: Pañcime, bhikkhave, dhammā saddhammassa ṭhitiyā asammosāya anantaradhānāya saṁvattanti.
analyzed: pañcime bhikkhave dhammā saddhammassa ṭhitiyā asammosāya anantaradhānāya savattanti
translated: “Bhikkhus, there are these five things that lead to the continuation, non-decline, and non-disappearance of the good Dhamma.

original: Katame pañca?
analyzed: katame pañca
translated: What five?

original: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhū suggahitaṁ suttantaṁ pariyāpuṇanti sunikkhittehi padabyañjanehi.
analyzed: idha bhikkhave bhikkhū suggahitam suttantam pariyāpuṇanti su nikkhittehi pada byañjanehi
translated: “Here, bhikkhus, the bhikkhus learn much, remember what they learn, and retain what they have learned. They practice in accordance with the Dhamma in its entirety, not deviating from it in any respect.

original: Sunikkhittassa, bhikkhave, padabyañjanassa atthopi sunayo hoti.
analyzed: su nikkhittassa bhikkhave pada byañjanassa atthaḥ api su nayaḥ hoti
translated: When the Dhamma is well expounded, they gain full confidence in and deep satisfaction with the Teacher.

original: Ayaṁ, bhikkhave, paṭhamo dhammo saddhammassa ṭhitiyā asammosāya anantaradhānāya saṁvattati.
analyzed: aya bhikkhave paṭhamaḥ dhammo saddhammassa ṭhitiyā asammosāya anantaradhānāya savattati
translated: This is the first thing that leads to the continuation, non-decline, and non-disappearance of the good Dhamma.

original: Puna caparaṁ, bhikkhave, bhikkhū suvacā honti sovacassakaraṇehi dhammehi samannāgatā, khamā padakkhiṇaggāhino anusāsaniṁ.
analyzed: puna capara bhikkhave bhikkhū suvacāḥ honti sovacassakaraṇehi dhammehi samannāgatā khamā padakkhiṇaggāhinaḥ anusāsani
translated: “Again, the bhikkhus are easy to admonish, possessing qualities that make them easy to admonish. They are endowed with qualities that make them dear and agreeable to their fellow monks, sympathetic and courteous, and they show respect.

original: Ayaṁ, bhikkhave, dutiyo dhammo saddhammassa ṭhitiyā asammosāya anantaradhānāya saṁvattati.🔽Puna caparaṁ, bhikkhave, ye te bhikkhū bahussutā āgatāgamā dhammadharā vinayadharā mātikādharā, te sakkaccaṁ suttantaṁ paraṁ vācenti;
analyzed: aya bhikkhave dutiyaḥ dhammo saddhammassa ṭhitiyā asammosāya anantaradhānāya savattati  puna capara bhikkhave ye te bhikkhū bahu ssutāḥ āgata āgamāḥ dhamma dharāḥ vinaya dharāḥ mātikā dharā te sakkaccam suttantam param vācenti
translated: This is the second thing that leads to the continuation, non-decline, and non-disappearance of the good Dhamma.

original: tesaṁ accayena na chinnamūlako suttanto hoti sappaṭisaraṇo.
analyzed: tesam accayena na chinna mūlakaḥ suttantaḥ hoti sa paṭisaraṇaḥ
translated: “Again , the bhikkhus who are learned, heirs to the heritage, the bearers of the tradition, the preservers of the tradition, the knowers of the tradition, the inheritors of the heritage, who have been taught the Dhamma by their teachers face to face, do not zealously recite and preserve the True Dhamma.🔽After their passing away, the True Dhamma is cut off at the root and disappears.

original: Ayaṁ, bhikkhave, tatiyo dhammo saddhammassa ṭhitiyā asammosāya anantaradhānāya saṁvattati.
analyzed: aya bhikkhave tatiyaḥ dhammo saddhammassa ṭhitiyā asammosāya anantaradhānāya savattati
translated: This is the third thing that leads to the continuation, non-decline, and non-disappearance of the good Dhamma.🔽“Again , the elder bhikkhus do not behave improperly and give no grounds for censure.

original: Puna caparaṁ, bhikkhave, therā bhikkhū na bāhulikā honti na sāthalikā, okkamane nikkhittadhurā🔽paviveke pubbaṅgamā; vīriyaṁ ārabhanti appattassa pattiyā anadhigatassa adhigamāya
analyzed: puna capara bhikkhave therāḥ bhikkhū na bāhulikāḥ honti na sāthalikāḥ okkamane nikkhitta dhurā  paviveke pubbaṅgamāḥ vīriyam ārabhanti appattassa pattiyā anadhigatassa adhigamāya
translated: They are not seen skulking at night in villages or forests.

original: asacchikatassa sacchikiriyāya.
analyzed: a sacchikatassa sacchikiriyāya
translated: They arouse energy for the attainment of the as-yet-unattained, for the achievement of the as-yet-unachieved, for the realization of the as-yet-unrealized.

original: Tesaṁ pacchimā janatā diṭṭhānugatiṁ āpajjati.
analyzed: tesam pacchimā janatā diṭṭha anugatim āpajjati
translated: The generation that follows them imitates them.

original: Sāpi hoti na bāhulikā na sāthalikā, okkamane nikkhittadhurā paviveke pubbaṅgamā, vīriyaṁ ārabhati appattassa pattiyā anadhigatassa adhigamāya asacchikatassa sacchikiriyāya.
analyzed: sā api hoti na bāhulikā na sāthalikā okkamane nikkhitta dhurā paviveke pubbaṅgamā vīriyam ārabhati appattassa pattiyā an adhigatassa adhigamāya a sacchikatassa sacchikiriyāya
translated: And he is not luxurious or lax, but lives the spiritual life aspiring to comfort and ease. He is not a leader in falling away from persistence, but a leader in persistence.

original: Ayaṁ, bhikkhave, catuttho dhammo saddhammassa ṭhitiyā asammosāya anantaradhānāya saṁvattati.
analyzed: aya bhikkhave catutthaḥ dhammo saddhammassa ṭhitiyā asammosāya anantaradhānāya savattati
translated: This is the fourth thing that leads to the continuation, non-decline, and non-disappearance of the true Dhamma.

original: Puna caparaṁ, bhikkhave, saṅgho samaggo sammodamāno avivadamāno ekuddeso phāsuṁ viharati.
analyzed: puna capara bhikkhave saṅghaḥ samaggaḥ sammodamānaḥ a vivadamānaḥ eka uddesaḥ phāsum viharati
translated: “Again, the Saṅgha dwells in peace, harmony, and comfort, without disputes, with a single recitation.

original: Saṅghe kho pana, bhikkhave, samagge na ceva aññamaññaṁ akkosā honti, na ca aññamaññaṁ paribhāsā honti, na ca aññamaññaṁ parikkhepā honti, na ca aññamaññaṁ pariccajanā honti.
analyzed: saṅghe kho pana bhikkhave samagge na ca iva aññamaññam akkosāḥ honti na ca aññamaññam paribhāsāḥ honti na ca aññamaññam parikkhepāḥ honti na ca aññamaññam pariccajanāḥ honti
translated: When the Saṅgha dwells in peace, harmony, and comfort, without disputes, with a single recitation, they don’t revile or abuse one another, nor do they expose one another’s faults and failings.

original: Tattha appasannā ceva pasīdanti, pasannānañca bhiyyobhāvo hoti.
analyzed: tattha appasannā ca iva pasīdanti pasannānam ca bhiyyobhāvaḥ hoti
translated: Those without confidence become confident, and those with confidence increase.”

original: Ayaṁ, bhikkhave, pañcamo dhammo saddhammassa ṭhitiyā asammosāya anantaradhānāya saṁvattati.
analyzed: aya bhikkhave pañcamaḥ dhammo saddhammassa ṭhitiyā asammosāya anantaradhānāya savattati
translated: This is the fifth thing that leads to the continuation, non-decline, and non-disappearance of the true Dhamma.

original: Ime kho, bhikkhave, pañca dhammā saddhammassa ṭhitiyā asammosāya anantaradhānāya saṁvattantī”ti.
analyzed: ime kho bhikkhave pañca dhammā saddhammassa ṭhitiyā asammosāya anantaradhānāya savattanti iti
translated: These five things lead to the continuation, non-decline, and non-disappearance of the true Dhamma.”

original: Chaṭṭhaṁ.
analyzed: chaṭṭha
translated: The sixth section on “a person” is finished.

original: Aṅguttara Nikāya 5.157🔽16. Saddhammavagga
analyzed: aṅguttara nikāya  saddhamma vagga
translated: The Book of the Fives

original: Dukkathāsutta
analyzed: dukkathāsutta
translated: Bad Advice

original: “Pañcannaṁ, bhikkhave, puggalānaṁ kathā dukkathā puggale puggalaṁ upanidhāya.
analyzed: pañcanna bhikkhave puggalānam kathā dukkathā puggale puggalam upanidhāya
translated: “Monks, there are these five kinds of bad advice that one might give to others.

original: Katamesaṁ pañcannaṁ?
analyzed: katamesam
translated: What five?

original: Assaddhassa, bhikkhave, saddhākathā dukkathā;🔽dussīlassa sīlakathā dukkathā;
analyzed: assaddhassa bhikkhave saddhā kathā dukkathā  dussīlassa sīla kathā dukkathā
translated: To one without conviction, one might give advice about conviction;🔽to one without virtue, one might give advice about virtue;

original: appassutassa bāhusaccakathā dukkathā;
analyzed: appassutassa bāhu saccakathā dukkathā
translated: to one who is not learned, one might give advice about learning;

original: maccharissa cāgakathā dukkathā;
analyzed: maccharissa cāga kathā dukkathā
translated: to one who is miserly, one might give advice about generosity;

original: duppaññassa paññākathā dukkathā.
analyzed: duppaññassa paññākathā dukkathā
translated: to one who is unwise, one might give advice about wisdom.

original: Kasmā ca, bhikkhave, assaddhassa saddhākathā dukkathā?
analyzed: kasmā ca bhikkhave assaddhassa saddhākathā dukkathā
translated: And why is it bad advice to give advice about conviction to one without conviction?

original: Assaddho, bhikkhave, saddhākathāya kacchamānāya abhisajjati kuppati byāpajjati patitthīyati kopañca dosañca appaccayañca pātukaroti.
analyzed: assaddhaḥ bhikkhave saddhākathāya kacchamānāya abhisajjati kuppati byāpajjati patitthīyati kopam ca dosañca appaccayañca pātukaroti
translated: When one without conviction is given advice about conviction, one becomes angry, hostile, & bitter, gives rise to anger & dejection, and displays anger, hostility, & bitterness.

original: Taṁ kissa hetu?
analyzed: tam kim sa hetu
translated: And why is that?

original: Tañhi so, bhikkhave, saddhāsampadaṁ attani na samanupassati, na ca labhati tatonidānaṁ pītipāmojjaṁ.
analyzed: tat hi saḥ bhikkhave saddhā sampadam attani na samanupassati na ca labhati tatonidānam pīti pāmojja
translated: He does not see that perfection of faith in himself, and he does not obtain the joy and happiness born of that perfection of faith.

original: Tasmā assaddhassa saddhākathā dukkathā.
analyzed: tasmai assaddhassa saddhā kathā dukkathā
translated: That is why it is hard for one without faith to converse with one who has faith.

original: Kasmā ca, bhikkhave, dussīlassa sīlakathā dukkathā?
analyzed: kasmā ca bhikkhave dussīlassa sīla kathā dukkathā
translated: “And why, bhikkhus, is it hard for one who is immoral to converse with one of virtuous character?

original: Dussīlo, bhikkhave, sīlakathāya kacchamānāya abhisajjati kuppati byāpajjati patitthīyati kopañca dosañca appaccayañca pātukaroti.
analyzed: dussīlaḥ bhikkhave sīla kathāya kacchamānāya abhisajjati kuppati byāpajjati patitthīyati kopañca dosañca appaccayañca pātukaroti
translated: When one who is immoral converses with one of virtuous character, he becomes embarrassed, humiliated, and ashamed, and he commits offenses and acquires bad kamma.

original: Taṁ kissa hetu?
analyzed: tam kim sa hetu
translated: Why is that?

original: Tañhi so, bhikkhave, sīlasampadaṁ attani na samanupassati na ca labhati tatonidānaṁ pītipāmojjaṁ.
analyzed: tat hi saḥ bhikkhave sīla sampadam attani na samanupassati na ca labhati tatonidānam pīti pāmojja
translated: He does not see that perfection of morality in himself, and he does not obtain the joy and happiness born of that perfection of morality.

original: Tasmā dussīlassa sīlakathā dukkathā.
analyzed: tasmā dussīlassa sīla kathā dukkathā
translated: That is why it is hard for one who is immoral to converse with one of virtuous character.

original: Kasmā ca, bhikkhave, appassutassa bāhusaccakathā dukkathā?
analyzed: kasmā ca bhikkhave appassutassa bāhu saccakathā dukkathā
translated: “And why, bhikkhus, is it hard for one who is unlearned to converse with one who is learned?

original: Appassuto, bhikkhave, bāhusaccakathāya kacchamānāya abhisajjati kuppati byāpajjati patitthīyati kopañca dosañca appaccayañca pātukaroti.
analyzed: appassutaḥ bhikkhave bāhusacca kathāya kacchamānāya abhisajjati kuppati byāpajjati patitthīyati kopañca dosañca appaccayañca pātukaroti
translated: When one who is unlearned converses with one who is learned, he becomes embarrassed, humiliated, and ashamed, and he commits offenses and acquires bad kamma.

original: Taṁ kissa hetu?
analyzed: tam kim sa hetu
translated: Why is that?

original: Tañhi so, bhikkhave, sutasampadaṁ attani na samanupassati, na ca labhati tatonidānaṁ pītipāmojjaṁ.
analyzed: tat hi saḥ bhikkhave suta sampadam attani na samanupassati na ca labhati tatonidānam pīti pāmojja
translated: He does not see that accomplishment of learning in himself, and he does not obtain the joy and happiness arising from that accomplishment of learning.

original: Tasmā appassutassa bāhusaccakathā dukkathā.
analyzed: tasmai appassutassa bāhu saccakathā dukkathā
translated: That is why it is hard for one with little learning to converse with one who is very learned.

original: Kasmā ca, bhikkhave, maccharissa cāgakathā dukkathā?
analyzed: kasmā ca bhikkhave maccharissa cāga kathā dukkathā
translated: “And why, bhikkhus, is it hard for a miser to converse with a giver?

original: Maccharī, bhikkhave, cāgakathāya kacchamānāya abhisajjati kuppati byāpajjati patitthīyati kopañca dosañca appaccayañca pātukaroti.
analyzed: maccharī bhikkhave cāga kathāya kacchamānāya abhisajjati kuppati byāpajjati patitthīyati kopam ca dosañca appaccayañca pātukaroti
translated: When a miser is spoken to about giving, he becomes angry, hostile, and resentful, he displays anger, hatred, and bitterness.

original: Taṁ kissa hetu?
analyzed: tam kim sa hetu
translated: Why is that?

original: Tañhi so, bhikkhave, cāgasampadaṁ attani na samanupassati na ca labhati tatonidānaṁ pītipāmojjaṁ.
analyzed: tat hi saḥ bhikkhave cāga sampadam attani na samanupassati na ca labhati tatonidānam pīti pāmojja
translated: He does not see that accomplishment of generosity in himself, and he does not obtain the joy and happiness arising from that accomplishment of generosity.

original: Tasmā maccharissa cāgakathā dukkathā.
analyzed: tasmā mad śarissa cāga kathā dukkathā
translated: That is why it is hard for a miser to converse with a giver.

original: Kasmā ca, bhikkhave, duppaññassa paññākathā dukkathā?
analyzed: kasmā ca bhikkhave duppaññassa paññākathā dukkathā
translated: “And why, bhikkhus, is it hard for an unwise person to converse with a wise person?

original: Duppañño, bhikkhave, paññākathāya kacchamānāya abhisajjati kuppati byāpajjati patitthīyati kopañca dosañca appaccayañca pātukaroti.
analyzed: duppaññaḥ bhikkhave paññākathāya kacchamānāya abhisajjati kuppati byāpajjati patitthīyati kopañca dosañca appaccayañca pātukaroti
translated: When an unwise person is spoken to about wisdom, he becomes angry, hostile, and resentful, he displays anger, hatred, and bitterness.

original: Taṁ kissa hetu?
analyzed: tam kim sa hetu
translated: Why is that?

original: Tañhi so, bhikkhave, paññāsampadaṁ attani na samanupassati, na ca labhati tatonidānaṁ pītipāmojjaṁ.🔽Tasmā duppaññassa paññākathā dukkathā.
analyzed: tat hi saḥ bhikkhave paññā sampadam attani na samanupassati na ca labhati tatonidānam pīti pāmojja  tasmā duppaññassa paññākathā dukkathā
translated: He does not see that perfection of wisdom in himself, and he does not obtain the joy and happiness born of that perfection of wisdom.🔽That is why it is hard to converse with an unwise person.

original: Imesaṁ kho, bhikkhave, pañcannaṁ puggalānaṁ kathā dukkathā puggale puggalaṁ upanidhāya.
analyzed: imesam kho bhikkhave pañcannam puggalānam kathā dukkathā puggale puggalam upanidhāya
translated: These are the five kinds of persons with whom it is hard to converse, in reference to whom it is said that it is hard to converse with a person, in reference to a person.”

original: Pañcannaṁ, bhikkhave, puggalānaṁ kathā sukathā puggale puggalaṁ upanidhāya.
analyzed: pañcanna bhikkhave puggalānam kathā su kathā puggale puggalam upanidhāya
translated: “Bhikkhus, there are these five kinds of persons with whom it is easy to converse, in reference to whom it is said that it is easy to converse with a person, in reference to a person.

original: Katamesaṁ pañcannaṁ?🔽Saddhassa, bhikkhave, saddhākathā sukathā;🔽sīlavato sīlakathā sukathā;
analyzed: katamesam  saddhassa bhikkhave saddhā kathā su kathā  sīlavato sīla kathā su kathā
translated: What five?🔽For one who has faith, a talk about faith is easy to converse with, in reference to whom it is said that it is easy to converse with a person, in reference to a person.

original: bahussutassa bāhusaccakathā sukathā;🔽cāgavato cāgakathā sukathā;
analyzed: bahussutassa bāhu saccakathā su kathā  cāgavato cāga kathā su kathā
translated: For one who is virtuous, a talk about virtue is easy to converse with, in reference to whom it is said that it is easy to converse with a person, in reference to a person.🔽For one who is learned, a talk about learning is easy to converse with, in reference to whom it is said that it is easy to converse with a person, in reference to a person.🔽For one who is generous, a talk about generosity is easy to converse with, in reference to whom it is said that it is easy to converse with a person, in reference to a person.

original: paññavato paññākathā sukathā.
analyzed: paññavataḥ paññākathā su kathā
translated: For one who is wise, a talk about wisdom is easy to converse with, in reference to whom it is said that it is easy to converse with a person, in reference to a person.

original: Kasmā ca, bhikkhave, saddhassa saddhākathā sukathā?
analyzed: kasmā ca bhikkhave saddhassa saddhā kathā su kathā
translated: “And why is a talk about faith easy to converse with for one who has faith, in reference to whom it is said that it is easy to converse with a person, in reference to a person?

original: Saddho, bhikkhave, saddhākathāya kacchamānāya nābhisajjati na kuppati na byāpajjati na patitthīyati na kopañca dosañca appaccayañca pātukaroti.
analyzed: saddhaḥ bhikkhave saddhākathāya kacchamānāya na abhisajjati na kuppati na byāpajjati na patitthīyati na kopam ca dosañca appaccayañca pātukaroti
translated: When a talk about faith is being spoken in the presence of one who has faith, he does not bristle at it, does not revile or censure it, does not dispute it or oppose it or reject it.

original: Taṁ kissa hetu?
analyzed: tam kim sa hetu
translated: And why is that?

original: Tañhi so, bhikkhave, saddhāsampadaṁ attani samanupassati labhati ca tatonidānaṁ pītipāmojjaṁ.
analyzed: tat hi saḥ bhikkhave saddhā sampadam attani samanupassati labhati ca tatonidānam pīti pāmojja
translated: Because he sees that perfection of faith in himself and he gains joy and happiness from that.

original: Tasmā saddhassa saddhākathā sukathā.
analyzed: tasmā saddhassa saddhā kathā su kathā
translated: That is why it is good to talk to one who has faith about the perfection of faith.

original: Kasmā ca, bhikkhave, sīlavato sīlakathā sukathā?
analyzed: kasmā ca bhikkhave sīlavato sīla kathā su kathā
translated: “And why, bhikkhus, is it good to talk to one who is virtuous about the perfection of virtue?

original: Sīlavā, bhikkhave, sīlakathāya kacchamānāya nābhisajjati na kuppati na byāpajjati na patitthīyati na kopañca dosañca appaccayañca pātukaroti.
analyzed: sīlavā bhikkhave sīla kathāya kacchamānāya na abhisajjati na kuppati na byāpajjati na patitthīyati na kopañca dosañca appaccayañca pātukaroti
translated: When one who is virtuous is being talked to about the perfection of virtue, he does not bristle at that talk.

original: Taṁ kissa hetu?
analyzed: tam kim sa hetu
translated: And why is that?

original: Tañhi so, bhikkhave, sīlasampadaṁ attani samanupassati, labhati ca tatonidānaṁ pītipāmojjaṁ.
analyzed: tat hi saḥ bhikkhave sīla sampadam attani samanupassati labhati ca tatonidānam pīti pāmojja
translated: Because he sees that perfection of virtue in himself and he gains joy and happiness from that.

original: Tasmā sīlavato sīlakathā sukathā.
analyzed: tasmā sīlavato sīla kathā su kathā
translated: That is why it is good to talk to one who is virtuous about the perfection of virtue.

original: Kasmā ca, bhikkhave, bahussutassa bāhusaccakathā sukathā?
analyzed: kasmā ca bhikkhave bahu ssutassa bāhu sacca kathā su kathā
translated: “And why, bhikkhus, is it good to talk to one who is learned about the perfection of learning?

original: Bahussuto, bhikkhave, bāhusaccakathāya kacchamānāya nābhisajjati na kuppati na byāpajjati na patitthīyati na kopañca dosañca appaccayañca pātukaroti.
analyzed: bahussutaḥ bhikkhave bāhusacca kathāya kacchamānāya na abhisajjati na kuppati na byāpajjati na patitthīyati na kopam ca dosañca appaccayañca pātukaroti
translated: When one who is learned is being talked to about the perfection of learning, he does not bristle at that talk.

original: Taṁ kissa hetu?
analyzed: tam kim sa hetu
translated: And why?

original: Tañhi so, bhikkhave, sutasampadaṁ attani samanupassati, labhati ca tatonidānaṁ pītipāmojjaṁ.
analyzed: tat hi saḥ bhikkhave suta sampadam attani samanupassati labhati ca tatonidānam pīti pāmojja
translated: He sees that wealth of learning in himself and he gains joy and happiness from that.

original: Tasmā bahussutassa bāhusaccakathā sukathā.

original: evarūpepi, āvuso, puggale āghāto paṭivinetabbo.
analyzed: evarūpe pi āvuso puggale āghātaḥ paṭivinetabbaḥ
translated: You should get rid of any anger towards such a person.

original: Idha panāvuso, ekacco puggalo aparisuddhakāyasamācāro hoti aparisuddhavacīsamācāro, labhati ca kālena kālaṁ cetaso vivaraṁ cetaso pasādaṁ;

translated: “There is the case where a person is impure in bodily behavior and impure in verbal behavior, but he does from time to time attain a mental composure, a non-wavering of the mind, that is based right there.

original: evarūpepi, āvuso, puggale āghāto paṭivinetabbo.

translated: “There is the case where a person is impure in bodily behavior and impure in verbal behavior, and he does not from time to time attain a mental composure, a non-wavering of the mind, that is based right there.

original: evarūpepi, āvuso, puggale āghāto paṭivinetabbo.

original: Idha panāvuso, ekacco puggalo parisuddhakāyasamācāro parisuddhavacīsamācāro, labhati ca kālena vā kālaṁ cetaso vivaraṁ cetaso pasādaṁ;

translated: “There is the case where a person is pure in bodily behavior and pure in verbal behavior, and he does from time to time attain a mental composure, a non-wavering of the mind, that is based right there.

analyzed: tatra āvuso yvā ayam puggalaḥ a parisuddha kāya samācāraḥ parisuddha vacī samācāraḥ katham tasmin puggale āghātaḥ paṭivinetabbo
translated: “When there is a person whose bodily behavior is impure but whose verbal behavior is pure, how should one get rid of any resentment one may have towards such a person?

original: Seyyathāpi, āvuso, bhikkhu paṁsukūliko rathiyāya nantakaṁ disvā vāmena pādena niggaṇhitvā dakkhiṇena pādena pattharitvā, yo tattha sāro taṁ paripātetvā ādāya pakkameyya;
analyzed: seyyathā api āvuso bhikkhu pasukūlikaḥ rathiyāya nantakam disvā vāmena pādena niggaṇhitvā dakkhiṇena pādena pattharitvā yaḥ tattha sāraḥ tam paripātetvā ādāya pakkameyya
translated: Suppose a monk who wears rag-robes sees a piece of cloth on a road. He holds it down with his left foot, spreads it out with his right foot, and then picks it up, thinking, ‘May I have only the essence!’

original: evamevaṁ khvāvuso, yvāyaṁ puggalo aparisuddhakāyasamācāro parisuddhavacīsamācāro,
analyzed: evam evam khvāvuso yvā ayam puggalaḥ a parisuddha kāya samācāraḥ parisuddha vacī samācāraḥ
translated: In the same way, when there is a person whose bodily behavior is impure but whose verbal behavior is pure,

original: yāssa aparisuddhakāyasamācāratā na sāssa tasmiṁ samaye manasi kātabbā, yā ca khvassa
analyzed: yā assa a parisuddha kāya samācāra tā na sā assa tasmin samaye manasi kātabbā yā ca khvassa
translated: you should not pay attention to his impure bodily behavior.🔽You should pay attention

original: parisuddhavacīsamācāratā sāssa tasmiṁ samaye manasi kātabbā.
analyzed: parisuddha vacī samācāra tā sā assa tasmin samaye manasi kātabbā
translated: to his pure verbal behavior.

original: Evaṁ tasmiṁ puggale āghāto paṭivinetabbo.
analyzed: evam tasmin puggale āghātaḥ paṭivinetabbaḥ
translated: You should get rid of any resentment you may have towards such a person.

original: Tatrāvuso, yvāyaṁ puggalo aparisuddhavacīsamācāro parisuddhakāyasamācāro, kathaṁ tasmiṁ puggale āghāto paṭivinetabbo?
analyzed: tatra āvuso yvā ayam puggalaḥ a parisuddha vacī samācāraḥ parisuddha kāya samācāraḥ katham tasmin puggale āghātaḥ paṭivinetabbaḥ
translated: “When a person is impure in verbal conduct but pure in bodily conduct, how is resentment to be dispelled in regard to that person?

original: Seyyathāpi, āvuso, pokkharaṇī sevālapaṇakapariyonaddhā.
analyzed: sā iyyathā api āvuso pokkharaṇī sevā lapaṇaka pariyonaddhā
translated: Suppose there were a lotus pond surrounded by reeds,

original: Atha puriso āgaccheyya ghammābhitatto ghammapareto kilanto tasito pipāsito.
analyzed: atha purisaḥ āgaccheyya ghamma abhitattaḥ ghamma paretaḥ kilantaḥ tasitaḥ pipāsitaḥ
translated: and a man scorched and exhausted by hot weather, weary, parched, and thirsty, came by seeking cold water, seeking delight, seeking refreshment.

original: So taṁ pokkharaṇiṁ ogāhetvā ubhohi hatthehi iticiti ca sevālapaṇakaṁ apaviyūhitvā añjalinā pivitvā pakkameyya.
analyzed: saḥ tam pokkharaṇim ogāhetvā ubhohi hatthehi iticiti ca sevālapaṇakam apaviyūhitvā añjalinā pivitvā pakkameyya
translated: He would plunge into the lotus pond, break through the reeds on both sides, drink as much as he wanted, and bathe and cool off.

original: Evamevaṁ kho, āvuso, yvāyaṁ puggalo aparisuddhavacīsamācāro parisuddhakāyasamācāro,
analyzed: evam evam kho āvuso yvā ayam puggalaḥ a parisuddha vacī samācāraḥ parisuddha kāya samācāraḥ
translated: In the same way, when a person is impure in verbal conduct but pure in bodily conduct,🔽at that time his verbal conduct should not be given attention.🔽But his bodily conduct

original: yāssa aparisuddhavacīsamācāratā na sāssa tasmiṁ samaye manasi kātabbā, yā ca khvassa🔽parisuddhakāyasamācāratā sāssa tasmiṁ samaye manasi kātabbā.
analyzed: yā assa a parisuddha vacī samācāra tā na sā assa tasmin samaye manasi kātabbā yā ca khvassa  parisuddha kāya samācāra tā sā assa tasmin samaye manasi kātabbā
translated: should be given attention.

original: Evaṁ tasmiṁ puggale āghāto paṭivinetabbo.
analyzed: evam tasmin puggale āghātaḥ paṭivinetabbaḥ
translated: This is how resentment is to be dispelled in regard to that person.🔽“When a person is impure in bodily conduct and verbal conduct, how is resentment to be dispelled in regard to that person?

original: Tatrāvuso, yvāyaṁ puggalo aparisuddhakāyasamācāro aparisuddhavacīsamācāro labhati ca kālena kālaṁ cetaso vivaraṁ cetaso pasādaṁ, kathaṁ tasmiṁ puggale āghāto paṭivinetabbo?
analyzed: tatra āvuso yvā ayam puggalaḥ a parisuddha kāya samācāraḥ a parisuddha vacī samācāraḥ labhati ca kālena kālam cetasaḥ vivaram cetasaḥ pasāda katham tasmin puggale āghātaḥ paṭivinetabbo
translated: “When a person is impure in bodily conduct and verbal conduct but sometimes gets rapture and serenity of mind, how should resentment towards him be warded off?

original: Seyyathāpi, āvuso, parittaṁ gopade udakaṁ.
analyzed: sā iyyathā api āvuso parittam gopade
translated: Suppose there were a small amount of water in a pond,

original: Atha puriso āgaccheyya ghammābhitatto ghammapareto kilanto tasito pipāsito.
analyzed: atha purisaḥ āgaccheyya ghamma abhitattaḥ ghamma paretaḥ kilantaḥ tasitaḥ pipāsitaḥ
translated: and a man scorched and exhausted by hot weather came there seeking a cool place to drink and rest.

original: Tassa evamassa:
analyzed: tassa evamassa
translated: He might think,

original: ‘idaṁ kho parittaṁ gopade udakaṁ.
analyzed: idam kho parittam gopade udaka
translated: ‘There’s a small amount of water in this pond.

original: Sacāhaṁ añjalinā vā pivissāmi bhājanena vā khobhessāmipi taṁ loḷessāmipi taṁ apeyyampi taṁ karissāmi.
analyzed: sacā aham añjalinā vā pivissāmi bhājanena vā khobhessāmi pi tam loḷessāmi pi tam a peyyam pi tam karissāmi
translated: If I drink it or bathe in it, it will become undrinkable and undraftable.

original: Yannūnāhaṁ catukkuṇḍiko nipatitvā gopītakaṁ pivitvā pakkameyyan’ti.
analyzed: yat nūna aham catur kuṇḍikaḥ nipatitvā go pītakam pivitvā pakkameyyanti
translated: Why don’t I lie down on the bank and drink the water drop by drop?’

original: So catukkuṇḍiko nipatitvā gopītakaṁ pivitvā pakkameyya.
analyzed: saḥ catu kuṇḍikaḥ nipatitvā go pītakam pivitvā pakkameyya
translated: He would lie down on the bank and drink the water drop by drop.

original: Evamevaṁ kho, āvuso, yvāyaṁ puggalo aparisuddhakāyasamācāro aparisuddhavacīsamācāro
analyzed: evam evam kho āvuso yvā ayam puggalaḥ a parisuddha kāya samācāraḥ a parisuddha vacī samācāraḥ
translated: In the same way, when a person is impure in bodily conduct and verbal conduct but sometimes gets rapture and serenity of mind,

original: labhati ca kālena kālaṁ cetaso vivaraṁ cetaso pasādaṁ, yāssa aparisuddhakāyasamācāratā🔽na sāssa tasmiṁ samaye manasi kātabbā;
analyzed: labhati ca kālena kālam cetasaḥ vivaram cetasaḥ a parisuddha kāya samācāra tā  na sā assa tasmin samaye manasi kātabbā
translated: and he does get such openings and such a sense of confidence from time to time,🔽then his impure bodily behaviour should not be given attention at that time.

original: yāpissa aparisuddhavacīsamācāratā na sāpissa tasmiṁ samaye manasi kātabbā.
analyzed: yā apissa a parisuddha vacī samācāra tā na sā apissa tasmin samaye manasi kātabbā
translated: and his impure verbal behaviour should not be given attention at that time.

original: Yañca kho so labhati kālena kālaṁ cetaso vivaraṁ cetaso pasādaṁ, tamevassa tasmiṁ samaye manasi kātabbaṁ.
analyzed: yat ca kho saḥ labhati kālena kālam cetasaḥ vivaram cetasaḥ pasāda tam eva assa tasmin samaye manasi kātabba
translated: But the openings and the sense of confidence that he gets from time to time should be given attention at that time.

original: Evaṁ tasmiṁ puggale āghāto paṭivinetabbo.
analyzed: evam tasmin puggale āghātaḥ paṭivinetabbaḥ
translated: Thus should resentment be warded off in regard to that person.

original: Tatrāvuso, yvāyaṁ puggalo aparisuddhakāyasamācāro aparisuddhavacīsamācāro na ca labhati kālena kālaṁ cetaso vivaraṁ cetaso pasādaṁ, kathaṁ tasmiṁ puggale āghāto paṭivinetabbo?
analyzed: tatra āvuso yvā ayam puggalaḥ a parisuddha kāya samācāraḥ a parisuddha vacī samācāraḥ na ca labhati kālena kālam cetasaḥ vivaram cetasaḥ pasāda katham tasmin puggale āghātaḥ paṭivinetabbo
translated: “When there is a person whose bodily behaviour and verbal behaviour are impure and who does not get such openings and such a sense of confidence from time to time, how should resentment be warded off in regard to that person?

original: Seyyathāpi, āvuso, puriso ābādhiko dukkhito bāḷhagilāno addhānamaggappaṭipanno.
analyzed: seyyathā api āvuso purisaḥ ābādhikaḥ dukkhitaḥ bāḷha gilānaḥ addhāna magga ppaṭipannaḥ
translated: Suppose a man were sick, suffering, and gravely ill.

original: Tassa puratopissa dūre gāmo pacchatopissa dūre gāmo.
analyzed: tassa puratopissa dūre gāmo pacchatopissa dūre gāmo
translated: And in front of him there would be a village, and behind him a wilderness.

original: So na labheyya sappāyāni bhojanāni, na labheyya sappāyāni bhesajjāni, na labheyya patirūpaṁ upaṭṭhākaṁ, na labheyya gāmantanāyakaṁ.
analyzed: saḥ na labheyya sappāyāni bhojanāni na labheyya sappāyāni bhesajjāni na labheyya patirūpam upaṭṭhāka na labheyya gāmantanāyaka
translated: He would not get suitable food, he would not get suitable medicine, he would not get a suitable attendant, he would not get a guide to take him to the village.

original: Tamenaṁ aññataro puriso passeyya addhānamaggappaṭipanno.
analyzed: tam enam aññataraḥ puriso passeyya addhāna magga ppaṭipanno
translated: Then a certain man, traveling along the highway, would see him.

original: So tasmiṁ purise kāruññaṁyeva upaṭṭhāpeyya, anuddayaṁyeva upaṭṭhāpeyya, anukampaṁyeva upaṭṭhāpeyya:
analyzed: saḥ tasmin purise kāruññayā iva upaṭṭhāpeyya anuddayayā iva upaṭṭhāpeyya anukampayā iva upaṭṭhāpeyya
translated: He would feel compassion for him, he would feel sympathy for him, he would feel sorrow for him:

original: ‘aho vatāyaṁ puriso labheyya sappāyāni bhojanāni, labheyya sappāyāni bhesajjāni, labheyya patirūpaṁ upaṭṭhākaṁ, labheyya gāmantanāyakaṁ.
analyzed: aho vata ayam purisaḥ labheyya sappāyāni bhojanāni labheyya sappāyāni bhesajjāni labheyya patirūpam upaṭṭhāka labheyya gāmantanāyaka
translated: ‘Oh, that this man might get suitable food, might get suitable medicine, might get a suitable attendant, might get a guide to take him to the village.

original: Taṁ kissa hetu?
analyzed: tam kim sa hetu
translated: Why is that?

original: Māyaṁ puriso idheva anayabyasanaṁ āpajjī’ti.
analyzed: mā ayam purisaḥ idhā iva anaya byasanam āpajji iti
translated: This man might come to ruin right here.’

original: Evamevaṁ kho, āvuso, yvāyaṁ puggalo aparisuddhakāyasamācāro aparisuddhavacīsamācāro
analyzed: evam evam kho āvuso yvā ayam puggalaḥ a parisuddha kāya samācāraḥ a parisuddha vacī samācāraḥ
translated: “So too, friend, there is the case where a person is impure in bodily action, impure in verbal action,

original: na ca labhati kālena kālaṁ cetaso vivaraṁ cetaso pasādaṁ, evarūpepi, āvuso, puggale
analyzed: na ca labhati kālena kālam cetasaḥ vivaram cetasaḥ pasādaḥ evarūpe pi āvuso puggale
translated: and does not from time to time open up, reveal, and make plain to the Teacher or to his knowledgeable companions in the holy life his own impurities in bodily action and verbal action.🔽“There is the case where a person is impure in bodily action, impure in verbal action,

original: kāruññaṁyeva upaṭṭhāpetabbaṁ anuddayāyeva upaṭṭhāpetabbā anukampāyeva upaṭṭhāpetabbā:
analyzed: kāruññayā iva upaṭṭhāpetabbam anuddayāya iva upaṭṭhāpetabbā anukampāya iva upaṭṭhāpetabbā
translated: You should maintain only loving-kindness towards him, maintain only compassion, maintain only altruistic joy, maintain only equanimity:

original: ‘aho vata ayamāyasmā kāyaduccaritaṁ pahāya kāyasucaritaṁ bhāveyya, vacīduccaritaṁ pahāya vacīsucaritaṁ bhāveyya, manoduccaritaṁ pahāya manosucaritaṁ bhāveyya.
analyzed: aho vata ayam āyasmā kāya duccaritam pahāya kāya su caritam bhāveyya vacī duccaritam pahāya vacī su caritam bhāveyya manaḥ duccaritam pahāya manaḥ su caritam bhāveyya
translated: ‘If only this venerable one, abandoning bodily misconduct, would develop good bodily conduct; abandoning verbal misconduct, would develop good verbal conduct; abandoning mental misconduct, would develop good mental conduct.

original: Taṁ kissa hetu?
analyzed: tam kim sa hetu
translated: Why is that?

original: Māyaṁ āyasmā kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā apāyaṁ duggatiṁ vinipātaṁ nirayaṁ upapajjī’ti.
analyzed: mā ayam āyasmai kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā apāyam duggatim vinipātam nirayam upapajji iti
translated: Because this venerable one, with the breakup of the body, after death, might reappear in a state of deprivation, in an unhappy destination, in perdition, even in hell.’

original: Evaṁ tasmiṁ puggale āghāto paṭivinetabbo.
analyzed: evam tasmin puggale āghātaḥ paṭivinetabbaḥ
translated: Thus, friends, anger should be abandoned in regard to that person.

original: Tatrāvuso, yvāyaṁ puggalo parisuddhakāyasamācāro parisuddhavacīsamācāro labhati ca kālena kālaṁ cetaso vivaraṁ cetaso pasādaṁ, kathaṁ tasmiṁ puggale āghāto paṭivinetabbo?
analyzed: tatra āvuso yvā ayam puggalaḥ parisuddha kāya samācāro parisuddha vacī samācāraḥ labhati ca kālena kālam cetasaḥ vivaram cetasaḥ pasāda katham tasmin puggale āghātaḥ paṭivinetabbo
translated: “And how, friends, should anger be abandoned in regard to the person who is pure in bodily conduct, pure in verbal conduct, and who sometimes opens up his mind to a fellow monk?

original: Seyyathāpi, āvuso, pokkharaṇī acchodakā sātodakā sītodakā setakā supatitthā ramaṇīyā nānārukkhehi sañchannā.
analyzed: seyyathā api āvuso pokkharaṇī acchodakā sātodakā sītodakā setakā su patitthā ramaṇīyā nānā rukkhehi sañchannā
translated: Suppose there were a pond with clean, agreeable, cool water, transparent, with smooth banks, delightful, and nearby a dense woods.

original: Atha puriso āgaccheyya ghammābhitatto ghammapareto kilanto tasito pipāsito.
analyzed: atha purisaḥ āgaccheyya ghamma abhitattaḥ ghamma paretaḥ kilantaḥ tasitaḥ pipāsitaḥ
translated: Then a man scorched and exhausted by hot weather, weary, parched, and thirsty,

original: So taṁ pokkharaṇiṁ ogāhetvā nhātvā ca pivitvā ca paccuttaritvā tattheva rukkhacchāyāya nisīdeyya vā nipajjeyya vā.
analyzed: so tam pokkharaṇim ogāhetvā nhātvā ca pivitvā ca paccuttaritvā tattha iva rukkha chāyāya nisīdeyya vā nipajjeyya vā
translated: having gone down into that lotus pond, having bathed and drunk and come back up, would sit or lie right there in the shade of that tree.

original: Evamevaṁ kho, āvuso, yvāyaṁ puggalo parisuddhakāyasamācāro parisuddhavacīsamācāro🔽labhati ca kālena kālaṁ cetaso vivaraṁ cetaso pasādaṁ, yāpissa parisuddhakāyasamācāratā
analyzed: evam evam kho āvuso yvā ayam puggalaḥ parisuddha kāya samācāraḥ parisuddha vacī samācāraḥ  labhati ca kālena kālam cetasaḥ vivaram cetasaḥ pasāda yā api issa parisuddha kāya samācāra tā
translated: So too, friend, there is the case where a person is pure in body, speech, and mind, and he is not one to disparage a contemplative or a contemplative’s way of life.

original: sāpissa tasmiṁ samaye manasi kātabbā;🔽yāpissa parisuddhavacīsamācāratā sāpissa tasmiṁ samaye manasi kātabbā;
analyzed: sā api sa tasmin samaye manasi kātabbā  yā apissa parisuddha vacī samācāra tā sā apissa tasmin samaye manasi kātabbā
translated: Whatever his mind inclines to, he is not one to act on it.🔽At that time, his purity in body, speech, and mind should be attended to.🔽At that time, his not disparaging a contemplative or a contemplative’s way of life should be attended to.

original: yampi labhati kālena kālaṁ cetaso vivaraṁ cetaso pasādaṁ, tampissa tasmiṁ samaye manasi kātabbaṁ.
analyzed: yam pi labhati kālena kālam cetasaḥ vivaram cetasaḥ pasāda tam pissa tasmin samaye manasi kātabba
translated: At that time, his not acting on whatever his mind inclines to should be attended to.

original: Evaṁ tasmiṁ puggale āghāto paṭivinetabbo.🔽Samantapāsādikaṁ, āvuso, puggalaṁ āgamma cittaṁ pasīdati.
analyzed: evam tasmin puggale āghātaḥ paṭivinetabbaḥ 🔽samantapāsādikaḥ āvuso puggalam āgamma cittam pasīdati
translated: In this way, anger should be warded off with regard to that person.🔽“When one has gone to a person who inspires confidence all around, the mind becomes confident.

original: Ime kho, āvuso, pañca āghātapaṭivinayā, yattha bhikkhuno uppanno āghāto sabbaso paṭivinetabbo”ti.🔽Dutiyaṁ.🔽Aṅguttara Nikāya 5.163
analyzed: ime kho āvuso pañca āghāta paṭivinayāḥ yattha bhikkhunaḥ uppannaḥ āghāto sabbaso paṭivinetabbaḥ iti  dutiya  aṅguttara nikāya
translated: These are the five ways of counteracting annoyance that have been declared by the Blessed One who knows and sees, accomplished and fully enlightened, wherein for a bhikkhu, when they arise, any arisen annoyance ceases and does not persist.”🔽The second section on the five kinds of relinquishment is finished.

original: 17. Āghātavagga
analyzed: āghāta vagga
translated: The Book of the Fives

original: Sākacchasutta
analyzed: sākacchasutta
translated: The Discussion of Discussion

original: Tatra kho āyasmā sāriputto bhikkhū āmantesi:
analyzed: tatra kho āyasmā sāriputtaḥ bhikkhū āmantesi
translated: There the Venerable Sariputta addressed the bhikkhus thus:

original: “āvuso bhikkhave”ti.
analyzed: āvuso bhikkhave ti
translated: “Friends, bhikkhus.”

original: “Āvuso”ti kho te bhikkhū āyasmato sāriputtassa paccassosuṁ.
analyzed: āvuso ti kho te bhikkhū āyasmato sāriputtassa
translated: “Friend,” those bhikkhus replied.

original: Āyasmā sāriputto etadavoca:
analyzed: āyasmā sāriputtaḥ etat avoca
translated: The Venerable Sariputta said this:

original: “Pañcahāvuso, dhammehi samannāgato bhikkhu alaṁ sākaccho sabrahmacārīnaṁ.
analyzed: pañcahi āvuso dhammehi samannāgataḥ bhikkhu alam
translated: “Friends, a bhikkhu possessing five qualities is fit to take part in a discussion with his fellow monks.

original: Katamehi pañcahi?
analyzed: katamehi pañcahi
translated: What five?

original: Idhāvuso, bhikkhu attanā ca sīlasampanno hoti, sīlasampadākathāya ca āgataṁ pañhaṁ byākattā hoti;🔽attanā ca samādhisampanno hoti, samādhisampadākathāya ca āgataṁ pañhaṁ byākattā hoti;
analyzed: idha āvuso bhikkhu attanā ca sīla sampannaḥ hoti sīla sampadā kathāya ca āgatam pañham byākattā hoti  attanā ca samādhi sampannaḥ hoti samādhi sampadā kathāya ca āgatam pañham byākattā hoti
translated: Here, a bhikkhu is virtuous, but he is not able to expound the detailed meaning of the Dhamma as it has been spoken by the Blessed One, who knows and sees, accomplished and fully enlightened.🔽He is concentrated, but he is not able to expound the detailed meaning of the Dhamma as it has been spoken by the Blessed One, who knows and sees, accomplished and fully enlightened.

original: attanā ca paññāsampanno hoti, paññāsampadākathāya ca āgataṁ pañhaṁ byākattā hoti;
analyzed: attanā ca paññā sampannaḥ hoti paññā sampadā kathāya ca āgatam pañham byākattā hoti
translated: He is wise, but he is not able to expound the detailed meaning of the Dhamma as it has been spoken by the Blessed One, who knows and sees, accomplished and fully enlightened.

original: attanā ca vimuttisampanno hoti, vimuttisampadākathāya ca āgataṁ pañhaṁ byākattā hoti;
analyzed: attanā ca vimutti sampannaḥ hoti vimutti sampadā kathāya ca āgatam pañham byākattā hoti
translated: He himself is perfected in liberation, and he answers questions that arise in regard to the perfection of liberation.

original: attanā ca vimuttiñāṇadassanasampanno hoti, vimuttiñāṇadassanasampadākathāya ca āgataṁ pañhaṁ byākattā hoti.
analyzed: attanā ca vimutti ñāṇa dassana sampannaḥ hoti vimutti ñāṇa dassana sampadā kathāya ca āgatam pañham byākattā hoti
translated: He himself is perfected in knowledge and vision of liberation, and he answers questions that arise in regard to the perfection of knowledge and vision of liberation.

original: Imehi kho, āvuso, pañcahi dhammehi samannāgato bhikkhu alaṁ sākaccho sabrahmacārīnan”ti.
analyzed: imehi kho āvuso pañcahi dhammehi samannāgataḥ bhikkhu alam sākacchaḥ
translated: A monk endowed with these five qualities is fit to hold a discussion with his companions in the holy life.”

original: Tatiyaṁ.
analyzed: tatiya

original: Tatra kho āyasmā sāriputto bhikkhū āmantesi …pe… “yo hi koci, āvuso, paraṁ pañhaṁ pucchati, sabbo so pañcahi ṭhānehi, etesaṁ vā aññatarena.
analyzed: tatra kho āyasmā sāriputtaḥ bhikkhū āmantesi pe yaḥ hi koci āvuso param pañham pucchati sabbaḥ saḥ pañcahi ṭhānehi etesam vā aññatarena
translated: The Venerable Sāriputta said this: “Whenever anyone asks another a question, it is on one or another of five grounds.

original: Katamehi pañcahi?
analyzed: katamehi pañcahi

analyzed: mandattā momūhattā param pañham pucchati pāpicchaḥ param pañham pucchati

original: paribhavaṁ paraṁ pañhaṁ pucchati, aññātukāmo paraṁ pañhaṁ pucchati, atha vā panevaṁcitto
analyzed: paribhavam param pañham pucchati aññātu kāmo param pañham pucchati atha vā pana ivacittaḥ
translated: he asks a question to humiliate another, he asks a question because he wants to know, or he asks a question because he thinks:

original: paraṁ pañhaṁ pucchati:
analyzed: param pañham pucchati
translated: He asks a question of another out of contempt, out of a desire to know what he doesn’t know, or he asks a question of another thinking,

original: ‘sace me pañhaṁ puṭṭho sammadeva byākarissati iccetaṁ kusalaṁ, no ce me pañhaṁ puṭṭho sammadeva byākarissati ahamassa sammadeva byākarissāmī’ti.
analyzed: sace me pañham puṭṭhaḥ sammat eva byākarissati iccetam kusala no ce me pañham puṭṭhaḥ sammat eva byākarissati aham assa sammat eva byākarissāmi iti
translated: ‘If he answers my question well, that’s good. If he doesn’t answer my question well, I’ll answer it for him.’

original: Yo hi koci, āvuso, paraṁ pañhaṁ pucchati, sabbo so imehi pañcahi ṭhānehi, etesaṁ vā aññatarena.
analyzed: yaḥ hi koci āvuso param pañham pucchati sabbaḥ saḥ imehi pañcahi ṭhānehi etesam vā aññatarena

original: Ahaṁ kho panāvuso, evaṁcitto paraṁ pañhaṁ pucchāmi:

translated: ‘If he answers my question well, that’s good. If he doesn’t answer my question well, I’ll answer it for him.’”

translated: “So you just stand by and watch an elder monk being harassed?

original: Na hi nāma, ānanda, kāruññampi bhavissati theramhi bhikkhumhi vihesiyamānamhī”ti.
analyzed: na hi nāma ānanda kāruññam pi bhavissati theramhi bhikkhumhi vihesiyamānamhi iti
translated: You have no compassion for an elder monk being harassed.”

original: Atha kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi:
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi
translated: He then said to the monks,

original: “idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu sīlasampanno samādhisampanno paññāsampanno saññāvedayitanirodhaṁ samāpajjeyyāpi vuṭṭhaheyyāpi—
analyzed: idha bhikkhave bhikkhu sīla sampannaḥ samādhi sampanno paññā sampannaḥ saññā vedayita nirodham samāpajjeyya api vuṭṭhaheyya api
translated: “It’s possible that a monk who has the virtues, the concentration, and the wisdom of an elder might enter and emerge from the cessation of perception and feeling.

original: atthetaṁ ṭhānaṁ.🔽No ce diṭṭheva dhamme aññaṁ ārādheyya, atikkammeva kabaḷīkārāhārabhakkhānaṁ devānaṁ
analyzed: attha itam ṭhāna  no ce diṭṭhe iva dhamme aññam ārādheyya atikkamma iva kabaḷīkāra āhāra bhakkhānam devānam
translated: That’s possible.

original: sahabyataṁ aññataraṁ manomayaṁ kāyaṁ upapanno saññāvedayitanirodhaṁ samāpajjeyyāpi vuṭṭhaheyyāpi—
analyzed: sahabyatam aññataram manaḥ mayam kāyam upapanno saññā vedayita nirodham samāpajjeyya api vuṭṭhaheyya api
translated: If he doesn’t reach perfection in this very life, then, with the ending of the five lower fetters, he’ll be reborn spontaneously, sittting down to rise no more in that world.

original: atthetaṁ ṭhānan”ti.
analyzed: attha etam ṭhānanti
translated: That’s possible.”

original: Idamavoca bhagavā.
analyzed: idam avoca bhagavān
translated: That is what the Buddha said.

original: Idaṁ vatvāna sugato uṭṭhāyāsanā vihāraṁ pāvisi.
analyzed: idam vatvāna sugataḥ uṭṭhāya āsanā vihāram pāvisi
translated: Having said that, the one with supernormal powers, the Well-gone One, got up from his seat and went into his dwelling.

original: Atha kho āyasmā ānando acirapakkantassa bhagavato yenāyasmā upavāṇo tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṁ upavāṇaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: atha khalu āyasmai ānandaḥ acira pakkantassa bhagavataḥ yena āyasmai upavāṇaḥ tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantam upavāṇam etat avoca
translated: Soon after the Blessed One had left, Ven. Ānanda went to Ven. Upavāṇa and, on arrival, said to him,

original: “idhāvuso upavāṇa, aññe there bhikkhū vihesenti.
analyzed: idha āvuso upavāṇa aññe there bhikkhū vihesenti
translated: Soon after the Blessed One had left, Ven. Ānanda went to Ven. Upavāṇa and, on arrival, said to him, “Friend Upavāṇa, the senior monks are harassing us.

original: Mayaṁ tena na muccāma.
analyzed: mayam tena na muccāma
translated: We’re not getting released.

original: Anacchariyaṁ kho, panetaṁ āvuso upavāṇa, yaṁ bhagavā sāyanhasamayaṁ paṭisallānā vuṭṭhito etadeva ārabbha udāhareyya yathā āyasmantaṁyevettha upavāṇaṁ paṭibhāseyya.
analyzed: anacchariyam kho pana itam āvuso upavāṇa yam bhagavā sāyanha samayam paṭisallānā vuṭṭhitaḥ etat eva ārabbha udāhareyya yathā upavāṇam paṭibhāseyya
translated: But it’s not amazing that the Blessed One, rising from his seclusion in the late afternoon, would speak in such a way, as if he were addressing Ven. Upavāṇa himself.

original: Idāneva amhākaṁ sārajjaṁ okkantan”ti.
analyzed: idānā iva amhākam sārajjam okkantanti
translated: Our anxiety has just now been released.”

original: Atha kho bhagavā sāyanhasamayaṁ paṭisallānā vuṭṭhito yena upaṭṭhānasālā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi. Nisajja kho bhagavā āyasmantaṁ upavāṇaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā sāyanha samayam paṭisallānā vuṭṭhitaḥ yena upaṭṭhāna sālā tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi nisajja kho bhagavā āyasmantam upavāṇam etat avoca
translated: Then the Blessed One, rising from his seclusion in the late afternoon, went to the assembly hall, where he sat down on a seat laid out, and addressed Ven. Upavāṇa:🔽“Upavāṇa, the senior monks are harassing the monks who side with Devadatta.

original: “Katihi nu kho, upavāṇa, dhammehi samannāgato thero bhikkhu sabrahmacārīnaṁ piyo ca hoti manāpo ca garu ca bhāvanīyo cā”ti?
analyzed: katihi nu kho upavāṇa dhammehi samannāgataḥ theraḥ bhikkhu sabrahmacārīnam piyaḥ ca hoti manāpaḥ ca garu ca bhāvanīyaḥ ca ati
translated: “When a senior monk has how many qualities, is he dear and beloved to his fellow monastics, respected and admired?”

original: “Pañcahi, bhante, dhammehi samannāgato thero bhikkhu sabrahmacārīnaṁ piyo ca hoti manāpo ca garu ca bhāvanīyo ca.
analyzed: pañcahi bhante dhammehi samannāgataḥ theraḥ bhikkhu sabrahmacārīnam piyaḥ ca hoti manāpaḥ ca garu ca bhāvanīyaḥ ca
translated: “When he has five qualities, Bhante, a senior monk is dear and beloved to his fellow monastics, respected and admired.

original: Katamehi pañcahi?
analyzed: katamehi pañcahi
translated: What five?

original: Idha, bhante, thero bhikkhu sīlavā hoti …pe… samādāya sikkhati sikkhāpadesu;🔽bahussuto hoti …pe… diṭṭhiyā suppaṭividdhā;
analyzed: idha bhante theraḥ bhikkhu sīlavā hoti pe samādāya sikkhati sikkhāpadesu  bahu ssutaḥ hoti pe diṭṭhiyā suppaṭividdhā
translated: Here, a senior monk is virtuous. He dwells restrained by the Pāṭimokkha …🔽He is learned …

original: kalyāṇavāco hoti kalyāṇavākkaraṇo poriyā vācāya samannāgato vissaṭṭhāya anelagalāya atthassa viññāpaniyā;🔽catunnaṁ jhānānaṁ ābhicetasikānaṁ diṭṭhadhammasukhavihārānaṁ nikāmalābhī hoti akicchalābhī akasiralābhī;
analyzed: kalyāṇa vācaḥ hoti kalyāṇa vāc karaṇaḥ poriyā vācāya samannāgataḥ vissaṭṭhāya anelagalāya atthassa viññāpaniyā  catunnam jhānānam ābhicetasikānam diṭṭhadhamma sukha vihārānam nikāma lābhī hoti a kiccha lābhī a kasira lābhī
translated: He is a good speaker with a good delivery …🔽He is one who obtains at will, without trouble or difficulty, the four jhānas that constitute the higher mind and are pleasant dwellings in this very life …

original: āsavānaṁ khayā …pe… sacchikatvā upasampajja viharati.
analyzed: āsavānam khayā pe sacchikatvā upasampajja viharati
translated: He is one who, by the destruction of the taints, in this very life enters and dwells in the taintless liberation of mind, liberation by wisdom, realizing it for himself with direct knowledge.”🔽“Good, good, Upavāṇa!

original: Imehi kho, bhante, pañcahi dhammehi samannāgato thero bhikkhu sabrahmacārīnaṁ piyo ca hoti manāpo ca garu ca bhāvanīyo cā”ti.
analyzed: imehi kho bhante pañcahi dhammehi samannāgataḥ theraḥ bhikkhu sabrahmacārīnam piyaḥ ca hoti manāpaḥ ca garu ca bhāvanīyaḥ ca ati
translated: When an elder monk has these five qualities, he is dear and beloved to his companions in the holy life, honored, respected, revered, and venerated by them.”

original: “Sādhu sādhu, upavāṇa.
analyzed: sādhu sādhu upavāṇa
translated: “Good, good, Upavāṇa!

original: Imehi kho, upavāṇa, pañcahi dhammehi samannāgato thero bhikkhu sabrahmacārīnaṁ piyo ca hoti manāpo ca garu ca bhāvanīyo ca.
analyzed: imehi kho upavāṇa pañcahi dhammehi samannāgataḥ theraḥ bhikkhu sabrahmacārīnam piyaḥ ca hoti manāpaḥ ca garu ca bhāvanīyaḥ ca
translated: When an elder monk has these five qualities, he is dear and beloved to his companions in the holy life, honored, respected, revered, and venerated by them.

original: Ime ce, upavāṇa, pañca dhammā therassa bhikkhuno na saṁvijjeyyuṁ, taṁ sabrahmacārī na sakkareyyuṁ na garuṁ kareyyuṁ na māneyyuṁ na pūjeyyuṁ khaṇḍiccena pāliccena valittacatāya.
analyzed: ime ce upavāṇa pañca dhammā therassa bhikkhunaḥ na savijjeyyu tam sabrahmacārī na sakkareyyum na garum kareyyum na māneyyum na pūjeyyum khaṇḍiccena pāliccena valittacatāya
translated: If an elder monk did not have these five qualities, his companions in the holy life would not honor, respect, revere, and venerate him.

original: Yasmā ca kho, upavāṇa, ime pañca dhammā therassa bhikkhuno saṁvijjanti, tasmā taṁ sabrahmacārī sakkaronti garuṁ karonti mānenti pūjentī”ti.
analyzed: yasmā ca kho upavāṇa ime pañca dhammā therassa bhikkhuno savijjanti tasmā tam sabrahmacārī sakkaronti garum karonti mānenti pūjenti iti
translated: But because he has these five qualities, his companions in the holy life honor, respect, revere, and venerate him.”

original: Chaṭṭhaṁ.🔽Aṅguttara Nikāya 5.167
analyzed: chaṭṭha  aṅguttara nikāya
translated: The sixth section on Upavāṇa is finished.🔽The Book of the Fives

original: 17. Āghātavagga
analyzed: āghāta vagga
translated: The Chapter on Offenses

original: Codanāsutta
analyzed: codanāsutta
translated: Accusation

original: Tatra kho āyasmā sāriputto bhikkhū āmantesi:
analyzed: tatra kho āyasmā sāriputtaḥ bhikkhū āmantesi
translated: There the Venerable Sāriputta addressed the monks:

original: “codakena, āvuso, bhikkhunā paraṁ codetukāmena pañca dhamme ajjhattaṁ upaṭṭhāpetvā paro codetabbo.
analyzed: codakena āvuso bhikkhunā param codetu kāmena pañca dhamme ajjhattam upaṭṭhāpetvā paraḥ codetabbo
translated: “When a monk wants to accuse another, he should first establish five things in himself.

original: Katame pañca?
analyzed: katame pañca
translated: What five?

original: Kālena vakkhāmi, no akālena;
analyzed: kālena vakkhāmi no akālena
translated: He should think, ‘I will speak at the right time, not at the wrong time.

original: bhūtena vakkhāmi, no abhūtena;
analyzed: bhūtena vakkhāmi no abhūtena
translated: I will speak truthfully, not falsely.🔽I will speak gently, not harshly.

original: saṇhena vakkhāmi, no pharusena;🔽atthasaṁhitena vakkhāmi, no anatthasaṁhitena;
analyzed: saṇhena vakkhāmi no pharusena  attha sahitena vakkhāmi no anattha sahitena
translated: I will speak beneficially, not unbeneficially.

original: mettacitto vakkhāmi, no dosantaro.
analyzed: metta citto vakkhāmi naḥ dosantaro
translated: I will speak with a mind of good will, not with internal ill will.’

original: Codakena, āvuso, bhikkhunā paraṁ codetukāmena ime pañca dhamme ajjhattaṁ upaṭṭhāpetvā paro codetabbo.🔽Idhāhaṁ, āvuso, ekaccaṁ puggalaṁ passāmi akālena codiyamānaṁ no kālena kupitaṁ, abhūtena
analyzed: codakena āvuso bhikkhunā param codetu kāmena ime pañca dhamme ajjhattam upaṭṭhāpetvā paraḥ codetabbo  idha āha āvuso ekaccam puggalam passāmi akālena codiyamānam no kālena kupita abhūtena
translated: When a monk wants to accuse another, he should first establish these five things in himself.🔽I see a certain person who, when accused at the wrong time, not at the right time, gets angry.🔽When accused falsely, not truthfully, gets angry.🔽When accused harshly, not gently, gets angry.

original: codiyamānaṁ no bhūtena kupitaṁ, pharusena codiyamānaṁ no saṇhena kupitaṁ, anatthasaṁhitena
analyzed: codiyamānam naḥ bhūtena kupita pharusena codiyamānam naḥ saṇhena kupita anattha sahitena
translated: When accused unbeneficially, not beneficially, gets angry.

original: codiyamānaṁ no atthasaṁhitena kupitaṁ, dosantarena codiyamānaṁ no mettacittena kupitaṁ.
analyzed: codiyamānam naḥ attha sahitena kupita dosa antarena codiyamānam naḥ metta cittena kupita
translated: When accused with internal ill will, not with a mind of good will, gets angry.

original: Adhammacuditassa, āvuso, bhikkhuno pañcahākārehi avippaṭisāro upadahātabbo:🔽‘akālenāyasmā cudito no kālena, alaṁ te avippaṭisārāya;
analyzed: a dhamma cuditassa āvuso bhikkhuno pañcahā ākārehi a vippaṭisāraḥ upadahātabbaḥ  akālena ayasmā cuditaḥ no kālena alam te a vippaṭisārāya
translated: When a monk has accused another legitimately, the latter should be helped to get over his resentment in five ways:🔽‘You accused the other monk at the wrong time, not the right time. You should get over your resentment.

original: abhūtenāyasmā cudito no bhūtena, alaṁ te avippaṭisārāya;🔽pharusenāyasmā cudito no saṇhena, alaṁ te avippaṭisārāya;
analyzed: a bhūtena a yasmā cuditaḥ naḥ bhūtena alam te a vippaṭisārāya  pharusena ayasmā cuditaḥ no saṇhena alam te a vippaṭisārāya
translated: You accused the other monk falsely, not truthfully. You should get over your resentment.🔽You accused the other monk harshly, not gently. You should get over your resentment.

original: anatthasaṁhitenāyasmā cudito no atthasaṁhitena, alaṁ te avippaṭisārāya;
analyzed: anattha sahitena ayasmā cuditaḥ no attha sahitena alam te a vippaṭisārāya
translated: You accused the other monk unbenefically, not beneficially. You should get over your resentment.

original: dosantarenāyasmā cudito no mettacittena, alaṁ te avippaṭisārāyā’ti.🔽Adhammacuditassa, āvuso, bhikkhuno imehi pañcahākārehi avippaṭisāro upadahātabbo.
analyzed: dosantarena ayasmā cuditaḥ no metta cittena alam te a vippaṭisārāya ati  a dhamma cuditassa āvuso bhikkhuno imehi pañcahākārehi a vippaṭisāraḥ upadahātabbaḥ
translated: You accused the other monk with a mind of ill will, not with a mind of good will. You should get over your resentment.’🔽When a monk has accused another legitimately, the latter should be helped to get over his resentment in these five ways.

original: Adhammacodakassa, āvuso, bhikkhuno pañcahākārehi vippaṭisāro upadahātabbo:🔽‘akālena te, āvuso, codito no kālena, alaṁ te vippaṭisārāya;
analyzed: adhamma codakassa āvuso bhikkhuno pañcahā ākārehi vippaṭisāraḥ upadahātabbaḥ  akālena te āvuso coditaḥ no kālena alam te vippaṭisārāya
translated: When a monk has accused another illegitimately, the latter should be helped to get over his resentment in five ways:🔽‘You accused the other monk at the wrong time, not the right time. You should get over your resentment.

original: abhūtena te, āvuso, codito no bhūtena, alaṁ te vippaṭisārāya;
analyzed: abhūtena te āvuso coditaḥ no bhūtena alam te vippaṭisārāya
translated: You accused the other monk falsely, not truthfully. You should get over your resentment.

original: pharusena te, āvuso, codito no saṇhena, alaṁ te vippaṭisārāya;🔽anatthasaṁhitena te, āvuso, codito no atthasaṁhitena, alaṁ te vippaṭisārāya;
analyzed: pharusena te āvuso coditaḥ no saṇhena alam te vippaṭisārāya  anattha sahitena te āvuso coditaḥ no attha sahitena alam te vippaṭisārāya
translated: You’ve accused him harshly, not gently. You’ve accused him unbenefically, not beneficially.🔽You’ve accused him out of hate, not with a mind of good will.

original: dosantarena te, āvuso, codito no mettacittena, alaṁ te vippaṭisārāyā’ti.🔽Adhammacodakassa, āvuso, bhikkhuno imehi pañcahākārehi vippaṭisāro upadahātabbo.🔽Taṁ kissa hetu?🔽Yathā na aññopi bhikkhu abhūtena codetabbaṁ maññeyyāti.🔽Idha panāhaṁ, āvuso, ekaccaṁ puggalaṁ passāmi kālena codiyamānaṁ no akālena kupitaṁ,
analyzed: dosantarena te āvuso coditaḥ no metta cittena alam te vippaṭisārāya ati  adhamma codakassa āvuso bhikkhuno imehi pañcahākārehi vippaṭisāraḥ upadahātabbaḥ  tam kim sa hetu  yathā na aññaḥ api bhikkhu abhūtena codetabbam maññeyya ati  idha pana aha āvuso ekaccam puggalam passāmi kālena codiyamānam no akālena kupita
translated: You should confess your transgression.”

original: bhūtena codiyamānaṁ no abhūtena kupitaṁ, saṇhena codiyamānaṁ no pharusena kupitaṁ,🔽atthasaṁhitena codiyamānaṁ no anatthasaṁhitena kupitaṁ, mettacittena codiyamānaṁ🔽no dosantarena kupitaṁ.
analyzed: bhūtena codiyamānam naḥ abhūtena kupita saṇhena codiyamānam naḥ pharusena kupita 🔽attha sahitena codiyamānam no anattha sahitena kupita metta cittena codiyamāna 🔽naḥ dosantarena kupita
