original: Dhammacuditassa, āvuso, bhikkhuno pañcahākārehi vippaṭisāro upadahātabbo:
analyzed: dhamma cuditassa āvuso bhikkhuno pañcahā ākārehi vippaṭisāraḥ upadahātabbaḥ
translated: When a monk has been legitimately accused, his remorse should be assuaged in five ways:

original: ‘kālenāyasmā cudito no akālena, alaṁ te vippaṭisārāya;🔽bhūtenāyasmā cudito no abhūtena, alaṁ te vippaṭisārāya;🔽saṇhenāyasmā cudito no pharusena, alaṁ te vippaṭisārāya;
analyzed: kālena ayasmā cuditaḥ no akālena alam te vippaṭisārāya  bhūtena ayasmā cuditaḥ no abhūtena alam te vippaṭisārāya  saṇhena ayasmā cuditaḥ no pharusena alam te vippaṭisārāya
translated: ‘You were accused at the right time, not at the wrong time. There’s no need for remorse.🔽You were accused truthfully, not falsely. There’s no need for remorse.🔽You were accused gently, not harshly. There’s no need for remorse.

original: atthasaṁhitenāyasmā cudito no anatthasaṁhitena, alaṁ te vippaṭisārāya;
analyzed: attha sahitena ayasmā cuditaḥ no anattha sahitena alam te vippaṭisārāya
translated: You were accused in a beneficial way, not in a harmful way. There’s no need for remorse.

original: mettacittenāyasmā cudito no dosantarena, alaṁ te vippaṭisārāyā’ti.
analyzed: cuditaḥ no dosantarena alam te vippaṭisārāya ati
translated: You were accused with a mind of good will, not with internal ill will. There’s no need for remorse.’

original: Dhammacuditassa, āvuso, bhikkhuno imehi pañcahākārehi vippaṭisāro upadahātabbo.
analyzed: dhamma cuditassa āvuso bhikkhuno imehi pañcahākārehi vippaṭisāraḥ upadahātabbaḥ
translated: When a monk has been legitimately accused, his remorse should be assuaged in these five ways.

original: Dhammacodakassa, āvuso, bhikkhuno pañcahākārehi avippaṭisāro upadahātabbo:🔽‘kālena te, āvuso, codito no akālena, alaṁ te avippaṭisārāya;
analyzed: dhamma codakassa āvuso bhikkhuno pañcahā ākārehi a vippaṭisāraḥ upadahātabbaḥ  kālena te āvuso coditaḥ no akālena alam te a vippaṭisārāya
translated: When a monk has legitimately accused another, his lack of remorse should be assuaged in five ways:🔽‘You accused him at the right time, not at the wrong time. There’s no need for lack of remorse.

original: bhūtena te, āvuso, codito no abhūtena, alaṁ te avippaṭisārāya;
analyzed: bhūtena te āvuso coditaḥ no abhūtena alam te a vippaṭisārāya
translated: You accused him truthfully, not falsely. There’s no need for lack of remorse.

original: saṇhena te, āvuso, codito no pharusena, alaṁ te avippaṭisārāya;🔽atthasaṁhitena te, āvuso, codito no anatthasaṁhitena, alaṁ te avippaṭisārāya;
analyzed: saṇhena te āvuso coditaḥ no pharusena alam te a vippaṭisārāya  attha sahitena te āvuso coditaḥ no anattha sahitena alam te a vippaṭisārāya
translated: You accused him gently, not harshly. You’ve nothing to regret on that account.🔽You accused him constructively, not destructively. You’ve nothing to regret on that account.

original: mettacittena te, āvuso, codito no dosantarena, alaṁ te avippaṭisārāyā’ti.
analyzed: mettacittena te āvuso coditaḥ no dosantarena alam te a vippaṭisārāya ati
translated: You accused him with a mind of good will, not with internal ill will. You’ve nothing to regret on that account.’

original: Dhammacodakassa, āvuso, bhikkhuno imehi pañcahākārehi avippaṭisāro upadahātabbo.
analyzed: dhamma codakassa āvuso bhikkhuno imehi pañcahākārehi a vippaṭisāraḥ upadahātabbaḥ
translated: In this way, a monk who has accused another should be made to see that he has nothing to regret on five grounds.

original: Taṁ kissa hetu?
analyzed: tam kim sa hetu
translated: And why is that?

original: Yathā aññopi bhikkhu bhūtena coditabbaṁ maññeyyāti.
analyzed: yathā aññaḥ api bhikkhu bhūtena coditabbam maññeyya ati
translated: So that other monks might think that they should accuse only if they are sure of four things.

original: Cuditena, āvuso, puggalena dvīsu dhammesu patiṭṭhātabbaṁ—
analyzed: cuditena āvuso puggalena dvīsu dhammesu
translated: When accused, a person should be established in two things:

original: sacce ca, akuppe ca.
analyzed: sacce ca a kuppe ca
translated: truth and composure.

original: Mañcepi, āvuso, pare codeyyuṁ kālena vā akālena vā bhūtena vā abhūtena vā saṇhena
analyzed: āvuso pare codeyyum kālena vā akālena vā bhūtena vā abhūtena vā
translated: Even if others accuse me, whether the time is right or not, whether what is said is true or not, whether it is gentle or harsh,

original: vā pharusena vā atthasaṁhitena vā anatthasaṁhitena vā mettacittā vā dosantarā vā,
analyzed: vā pharusena vā attha sahitena vā anattha sahitena vā metta cittā vā dosantarā vā
translated: whether it is constructive or destructive, whether it is said with a mind of good will or with internal ill will,

original: ahampi dvīsuyeva dhammesu patiṭṭhaheyyaṁ—
analyzed: aham pi dvīsu yā iva dhammesu patiṭṭhaheyya
translated: I will be established in two things:

original: sacce ca, akuppe ca.
analyzed: sacce ca a kuppe ca
translated: truth and composure.

original: Sace jāneyyaṁ:
analyzed: sace jāneyya
translated: If I know that

original: ‘attheso mayi dhammo’ti, ‘atthī’ti naṁ vadeyyaṁ:
analyzed: attha iso mayi dhammo ti atthi iti nam vadeyya
translated: ‘This quality is in me,’ I would say, ‘it is.’

original: ‘saṁvijjateso mayi dhammo’ti.
analyzed: savijjate saḥ mayi dhammaḥ ti
translated: ‘This quality is found in me.’

original: Sace jāneyyaṁ:
analyzed: sace jāneyya
translated: If I knew,

original: ‘nattheso mayi dhammo’ti, ‘natthī’ti naṁ vadeyyaṁ:
analyzed: nattha iso mayi dhammo ti natthi iti nam vadeyya
translated: ‘This quality is not in me,’ I would say, ‘it isn’t.’

original: ‘neso dhammo mayi saṁvijjatī’”ti.
analyzed: na iso dhammaḥ mayi savijjati iti
translated: ‘This quality is not found in me.’”

original: “Evampi kho te, sāriputta, vuccamānā atha ca panidhekacce moghapurisā na padakkhiṇaṁ gaṇhantī”ti.
analyzed: evam pi kho te sāriputta vuccamānāḥ atha ca panidhā ikacce mogha purisāḥ na padakkhiṇam gaṇhanti iti
translated: “Sāriputta, when you speak like this, some foolish people here will not accept it.”

original: “Ye te, bhante, puggalā assaddhā jīvikatthā na saddhā agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajitā
analyzed: ye te bhante puggalāḥ assaddhāḥ jīvikatthāḥ na saddhāḥ agārasmai anagāriyam pabbajitā
translated: “Sir, there are people who have gone forth from the lay life to homelessness, not out of faith in the Teacher, but because they need to make a living,

original: saṭhā māyāvino ketabino uddhatā unnaḷā capalā mukharā vikiṇṇavācā indriyesu aguttadvārā
analyzed: saṭhāḥ māyāvino ketabinaḥ uddhatāḥ unnaḷāḥ capalāḥ mukharāḥ vikiṇṇa vācāḥ indriyesu a gutta dvārāḥ
translated: who are fraudulent, deceitful, treacherous, haughty, scurrilous, loose-tongued, uncontrolled in their sense faculties,

original: bhojane amattaññuno jāgariyaṁ ananuyuttā sāmaññe anapekkhavanto sikkhāya na tibbagāravā🔽bāhulikā sāthalikā okkamane pubbaṅgamā paviveke nikkhittadhurā kusītā hīnavīriyā
analyzed: bhojane amattaññunaḥ jāgariyam an anuyuttā sāmaññe an apekkhavantaḥ sikkhāya na tibba gāravā  bāhulikā sāthalikā okkamane pubbaṅgamā paviveke nikkhitta dhurā kusītā hīna vīriyā
translated: over-indulgent in eating, not intent on wakefulness, unconcerned with the ascetic life, not greatly respectful of the training,🔽lax and careless, leaders in backsliding, falling away from the precepts, lazy, with little energy,

original: muṭṭhassatino asampajānā asamāhitā vibbhantacittā duppaññā eḷamūgā, te mayā evaṁ
analyzed: muṭṭha satinaḥ asampajānāḥ asamāhitāḥ vibbhanta cittāḥ duppaññāḥ eḷamūgāḥ te mayā eva
translated: forgetful, lacking in mindfulness, unconcentrated, with wandering minds, lacking wisdom, obtuse, dull.

original: vuccamānā na padakkhiṇaṁ gaṇhanti.
analyzed: vuccamānāḥ na padakkhiṇam gaṇhanti
translated: and they don’t accept what I say.

original: Ye pana te, bhante, kulaputtā saddhā agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajitā asaṭhā amāyāvino🔽aketabino anuddhatā anunnaḷā acapalā amukharā avikiṇṇavācā indriyesu guttadvārā bhojane🔽mattaññuno jāgariyaṁ anuyuttā sāmaññe apekkhavanto sikkhāya tibbagāravā na bāhulikā
analyzed: ye pana te bhante kula puttā saddhāḥ agārasma anagāriyam pabbajitāḥ a saṭhāḥ a māyāvino  a ketabinaḥ an uddhatāḥ an unnaḷāḥ a capalāḥ a mukharāḥ a vikiṇṇa vācāḥ indriyesu gutta dvārāḥ bhojane  mattaññunaḥ jāgariyam anuyuttā sāmaññe apekkhavantaḥ sikkhāya tibba gāravāḥ na bāhulikā
translated: But those who have gone forth from the lay life to homelessness out of faith, who are not deceitful or fraudulent,🔽not hypocrites or boastful, not greedy for sensual pleasures, not contemptuous, not arrogant,🔽not frivolous, not fond of sleep or delight in company, who are respectful towards training, not lax,

original: na sāthalikā okkamane nikkhittadhurā paviveke pubbaṅgamā āraddhavīriyā pahitattā🔽upaṭṭhitassatino sampajānā samāhitā ekaggacittā paññavanto aneḷamūgā, te mayā evaṁ
analyzed: na sāthalikāḥ okkamane nikkhitta dhurā paviveke pubbaṅgamāḥ āraddha vīriyāḥ pahita ttā  upaṭṭhita ssatinaḥ sampajānā samāhitā ekagga cittā paññavantaḥ an eḷamūgā te mayā eva
translated: not leaders in backsliding, who are energetic, resolute,

original: vuccamānā padakkhiṇaṁ gaṇhantī”ti.
analyzed: vuccamānā padakkhiṇam gaṇhanti iti
translated: mindful, alert, concentrated, unified, wise, not dull, they accept what I say.”

original: “Ye te, sāriputta, puggalā assaddhā jīvikatthā na saddhā agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajitā
analyzed: ye te sāriputta puggalāḥ assaddhāḥ jīvikatthāḥ na saddhāḥ agārasma anagāriyam pabbajitā
translated: “Sāriputta, there are those who have gone forth from the lay life to homelessness out of faith, but they are faithless, fraudulent,🔽hypocritical, boastful, greedy for sensual pleasures, contemptuous, arrogant,

original: saṭhā māyāvino ketabino uddhatā unnaḷā capalā mukharā vikiṇṇavācā indriyesu aguttadvārā
analyzed: saṭhāḥ māyāvino ketabinaḥ uddhatāḥ unnaḷāḥ capalāḥ mukharāḥ vikiṇṇa vācāḥ indriyesu a gutta dvārāḥ
translated: frivolous, fond of sleep, and delight in company.

original: bhojane amattaññuno jāgariyaṁ ananuyuttā sāmaññe anapekkhavanto sikkhāya na tibbagāravā
analyzed: bhojane amattaññunaḥ jāgariyam an anuyuttā sāmaññe an apekkhavantaḥ sikkhāya na tibba gāravā
translated: not content with little food, devoted to wakefulness, concerned with the ascetic practices, greatly respectful towards the training,

original: bāhulikā sāthalikā okkamane pubbaṅgamā paviveke nikkhittadhurā kusītā hīnavīriyā
analyzed: bāhulikā sāthalikā okkamane pubbaṅgamā paviveke nikkhitta dhurā kusītā hīna vīriyā
translated: not being luxurious or lax, leaders in going forth, not casting off the burden in solitude, being energetic, having established persistence,

original: muṭṭhassatino asampajānā asamāhitā vibbhantacittā duppaññā eḷamūgā, tiṭṭhantu te.
analyzed: muṭṭha ssatinaḥ asampajānāḥ asamāhitāḥ vibbhanta cittāḥ duppaññāḥ eḷamūgāḥ tiṭṭhantu te
translated: having established mindfulness, being clearly aware, being concentrated, having unified mind, being wise, not being dull, let alone them.

original: Ye pana te, sāriputta, kulaputtā saddhā agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajitā asaṭhā amāyāvino🔽aketabino anuddhatā anunnaḷā acapalā amukharā avikiṇṇavācā indriyesu guttadvārā bhojane🔽mattaññuno jāgariyaṁ anuyuttā sāmaññe apekkhavanto sikkhāya tibbagāravā na bāhulikā
analyzed: ye pana te sāriputta kula puttā saddhāḥ agārasmaā anagāriyam pabbajitāḥ asaṭhāḥ a māyāvino  a ketabinaḥ an uddhatāḥ an unnaḷāḥ a capalāḥ a mukharāḥ a vikiṇṇa vācāḥ indriyesu gutta dvārāḥ bhojane  mattaññunaḥ jāgariyam anuyuttā sāmaññe apekkhavantaḥ sikkhāya tibba gāravāḥ na bāhulikā
translated: But, Sāriputta, those clansmen who have faith, who have gone forth from the home life into homelessness not for fraud, not for pretence,🔽not for hypocrisy, not for gain, honour, or fame, but who have gone forth from the home life into homelessness for the sake of higher wealth,

original: na sāthalikā okkamane nikkhittadhurā paviveke pubbaṅgamā āraddhavīriyā pahitattā
analyzed: na sāthalikāḥ okkamane nikkhitta dhurā paviveke pubbaṅgamāḥ āraddha vīriyāḥ pahita ttā
translated: not being luxurious or lax, not casting off the burden in solitude, being energetic, having established persistence,

original: upaṭṭhitassatino sampajānā samāhitā ekaggacittā paññavanto aneḷamūgā, te tvaṁ, sāriputta, vadeyyāsi.
analyzed: upaṭṭhita ssatinaḥ sampajānā samāhitā ekagga cittā paññavantaḥ aneḷamūgā te tva sāriputta vadeyyāsi
translated: having established mindfulness, being clearly aware, being concentrated, having unified mind, being wise, not being dull, you should speak to them, Sāriputta.

original: Ovada, sāriputta, sabrahmacārī;
analyzed: ovada sāriputta sabrahmacārī
translated: ‘Sāriputta, instruct the monastics.

original: anusāsa, sāriputta, sabrahmacārī:
analyzed: anusāsa sāriputta sabrahmacārī
translated: Sāriputta, teach the monastics.

original: ‘asaddhammā vuṭṭhāpetvā saddhamme patiṭṭhāpessāmi sabrahmacārī’ti.🔽Evañhi te, sāriputta, sikkhitabban”ti.
analyzed: asat dhammā vuṭṭhāpetvā saddhamme patiṭṭhāpessāmi sabrahmacārī iti  evam hi te sāriputta sikkhitabbanti
translated: “I will make the monastics emerge from the unwholesome and establish them in the wholesome.”🔽That’s how you should train.’”

original: Sattamaṁ.🔽Aṅguttara Nikāya 5.168
analyzed: sattama  aṅguttara nikāya
translated: The seventh section on Sāriputta is finished.🔽The Book of the Sixes

original: 17. Āghātavagga
analyzed: āghāta vagga
translated: The Chapter on Offenses

original: Sīlasutta
analyzed: sīlasutta
translated: Morality

original: Tatra kho āyasmā sāriputto bhikkhū āmantesi:
analyzed: tatra kho āyasmā sāriputtaḥ bhikkhū āmantesi
translated: There the Venerable Sāriputta addressed the mendicants:

original: “dussīlassa, āvuso, sīlavipannassa hatūpaniso hoti sammāsamādhi;🔽sammāsamādhimhi asati sammāsamādhivipannassa hatūpanisaṁ hoti yathābhūtañāṇadassanaṁ;🔽yathābhūtañāṇadassane asati yathābhūtañāṇadassanavipannassa hatūpaniso hoti nibbidāvirāgo;
analyzed: dussīlassa āvuso sīla vipannassa hatu upanisaḥ hoti sammāsamādhi  sammāsamādhimhi asati sammāsamādhi vipannassa hatūpanisam hoti yathā bhūta ñāṇa dassana  yathābhūta ñāṇa dassane asati yathābhūta ñāṇa dassana vipannassa hatu upanisaḥ hoti nibbidā virāgo
translated: “A person who is immoral, deficient in morality, has destroyed a root condition for right immersion.🔽When there is no right immersion, a person who is deficient in right immersion has destroyed a root condition for true knowledge and vision.🔽When there is no true knowledge and vision, a person who is deficient in true knowledge and vision has destroyed a root condition for disenchantment and dispassion.

original: nibbidāvirāge asati nibbidāvirāgavipannassa hatūpanisaṁ hoti vimuttiñāṇadassanaṁ.
analyzed: nibbidā virāge asati nibbidā virāga vipannassa hatūpanisam hoti vimutti ñāṇa dassana
translated: When there is no disenchantment and dispassion, a person who is deficient in disenchantment and dispassion has destroyed a root condition for knowledge and vision of freedom.

original: Seyyathāpi, āvuso, rukkho sākhāpalāsavipanno.
analyzed: seyyathā api āvuso rukkhaḥ sākhā palāsa vipannaḥ
translated: It’s just as a tree that’s deficient in branches and foliage.

original: Tassa papaṭikāpi na pāripūriṁ gacchati, tacopi pheggupi sāropi na pāripūriṁ gacchati.🔽Evamevaṁ kho, āvuso, dussīlassa sīlavipannassa hatūpaniso hoti sammāsamādhi;
analyzed: tassa papaṭikā api na pāripūrim gacchati tacaḥ api pheggu api sāraḥ api na pāripūrim gacchati  evam evam kho āvuso dussīlassa sīla vipannassa hatu upanisaḥ hoti sammāsamādhi
translated: His bark does not reach fulfilment, his inner bark does not reach fulfilment, his trunk does not reach fulfilment, his heartwood does not reach fulfilment, and his top does not reach fulfilment.

original: sammāsamādhimhi asati sammāsamādhivipannassa hatūpanisaṁ hoti yathābhūtañāṇadassanaṁ;🔽yathābhūtañāṇadassane asati yathābhūtañāṇadassanavipannassa hatūpaniso hoti nibbidāvirāgo;
analyzed: sammāsamādhimhi asati sammāsamādhi vipannassa hatūpanisam hoti yathā bhūta ñāṇa dassana  yathābhūta ñāṇa dassane asati yathābhūta ñāṇa dassana vipannassa hatu upanisaḥ hoti nibbidā virāgo
translated: “So too, friends, for one who is unvirtuous, of deficient virtue, of poor virtue, of bad virtue, of corrupted virtue, wrong concentration is rooted out.🔽When there is wrong concentration, wrong knowledge and liberation are rooted out.

original: nibbidāvirāge asati nibbidāvirāgavipannassa hatūpanisaṁ hoti vimuttiñāṇadassanaṁ.
analyzed: nibbidā virāge asati nibbidā virāga vipannassa hatūpanisam hoti vimutti ñāṇa dassana
translated: When there is wrong knowledge and liberation, the penetration of various elements is rooted out.

original: Sīlavato, āvuso, sīlasampannassa upanisasampanno hoti sammāsamādhi;🔽sammāsamādhimhi sati sammāsamādhisampannassa upanisasampannaṁ hoti yathābhūtañāṇadassanaṁ;
analyzed: sīlavataḥ āvuso sīla sampannassa upanisa sampannaḥ hoti sammāsamādhi  sammāsamādhimhi sati sammāsamādhi sampannassa upanisa sampannam hoti yathā bhūta ñāṇa dassana
translated: “For one who is virtuous, of virtuous character, right concentration is well rooted.🔽When there is right concentration, right knowledge and liberation are well rooted.

original: yathābhūtañāṇadassane sati yathābhūtañāṇadassanasampannassa upanisasampanno hoti nibbidāvirāgo;
analyzed: yathābhūta ñāṇa dassane sati yathābhūta ñāṇa dassana sampannassa upanisa sampannaḥ hoti nibbidā virāgo
translated: When there is right knowledge and liberation, the penetration of various elements is well rooted.

original: nibbidāvirāge sati nibbidāvirāgasampannassa upanisasampannaṁ hoti vimuttiñāṇadassanaṁ.
analyzed: nibbidā virāge sati nibbidā virāga sampannassa upanisa sampannam hoti vimutti ñāṇa dassana
translated: When there is dispassion and fading away, then the knowledge and vision of liberation is successful.

original: Seyyathāpi, āvuso, rukkho, sākhāpalāsasampanno. Tassa papaṭikāpi pāripūriṁ gacchati, tacopi pheggupi sāropi pāripūriṁ gacchati.
analyzed: seyyathā api āvuso rukkhaḥ sākhā palāsa sampanno tassa papaṭikā api pāripūrim gacchati tacaḥ api pheggu api sāraḥ api pāripūrim gacchati
translated: “Suppose a tree was full of flowers and fruits. Its flowers and fruits would be successful.

original: Evamevaṁ kho, āvuso, sīlavato sīlasampannassa upanisasampanno hoti sammāsamādhi;🔽sammāsamādhimhi sati sammāsamādhisampannassa upanisasampannaṁ hoti yathābhūtañāṇadassanaṁ;
analyzed: evam evam kho āvuso sīlavataḥ sīla sampannassa upanisa sampannaḥ hoti sammāsamādhi  sammāsamādhimhi sati sammāsamādhi sampannassa upanisa sampannam hoti yathā bhūta ñāṇa dassana
translated: In the same way, when a person is virtuous, when they have the attainment of virtue, the attainment of right concentration is successful.🔽When there is right concentration, when one has the attainment of right concentration, the attainment of the knowledge and vision of things as they really are is successful.

original: yathābhūtañāṇadassane sati yathābhūtañāṇadassanasampannassa upanisasampanno hoti nibbidāvirāgo;
analyzed: yathābhūta ñāṇa dassane sati yathābhūta ñāṇa dassana sampannassa upanisa sampannaḥ hoti nibbidā virāgo
translated: When there is the knowledge and vision of things as they really are, when one has the attainment of the knowledge and vision of things as they really are, the attainment of dispassion and fading away is successful.

original: nibbidāvirāge sati nibbidāvirāgasampannassa upanisasampannaṁ hoti vimuttiñāṇadassanan”ti.
analyzed: nibbidā avirāge sati nibbidā virāga sampannassa upanisa sampannam hoti vimutti ñāṇa dassanam ti
translated: When there is dispassion and fading away, then the knowledge and vision of liberation is successful.”

original: Aṭṭhamaṁ.🔽Aṅguttara Nikāya 5.169🔽17. Āghātavagga
analyzed: aṭṭhama  aṅguttara nikāya  āghāta vagga
translated: The eighth.🔽The Book of the Elevens🔽The Chapter on Offenses

original: Khippanisantisutta
analyzed: khippa nisanti sutta
translated: Quickly Disappearing

original: Atha kho āyasmā ānando yenāyasmā sāriputto tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā āyasmatā sāriputtena saddhiṁ sammodi.
analyzed: atha kho āyasmai ānandaḥ yena āyasmā sāriputto tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā āyasmatā sāriputtena saddhim sammodi
translated: Then the venerable Ānanda approached the venerable Sāriputta and exchanged greetings with him.

original: Sammodanīyaṁ kathaṁ sāraṇīyaṁ vītisāretvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi. Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho āyasmā ānando āyasmantaṁ sāriputtaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: sammodanīyam katham sāraṇīyam vītisāretvā ekamantam nisīdi ekamantam nisinnaḥ kho āyasman ānandaḥ āyasmantam sāriputtam etat avoca
translated: When this courteous and amiable talk was finished, he sat down at one side and said to the venerable Sāriputta:

original: “Kittāvatā nu kho, āvuso sāriputta, bhikkhu khippanisanti ca hoti, kusalesu dhammesu suggahitaggāhī ca, bahuñca gaṇhāti, gahitañcassa nappamussatī”ti?
analyzed: kittāvatā nu kho āvuso sāriputta bhikkhu khippa nisanti ca hoti kusalesu dhammesu suggahita ggāhī ca bahuñca gaṇhāti gahitañca assa na ppamussati iti
translated: “In what way, friend Sāriputta, is a bhikkhu one of quick understanding, and in what way is he one who grasps the meaning according to the letter?”

original: “Āyasmā kho ānando bahussuto.
analyzed: āyasmā kho ānandaḥ bahussuto
translated: “The venerable Ānanda is learned,

original: Paṭibhātu āyasmantaṁyeva ānandan”ti.
analyzed: paṭibhātu āyasmantayā iva ānandanti
translated: Let the venerable Ānanda himself tell it.”

original: “Tenahāvuso sāriputta, suṇāhi, sādhukaṁ manasi karohi; bhāsissāmī”ti.
analyzed: tena ha āvuso sāriputta suṇāhi sādhukam manasi karohi bhāsissāmi iti
translated: “Then, friend Sāriputta, listen and attend closely to what I shall say.”

original: “Evamāvuso”ti kho āyasmā sāriputto āyasmato ānandassa paccassosi.
analyzed: evam āvuso ti kho āyasmā sāriputto āyasmataḥ ānandassa paccassosi
translated: “Yes, friend,” the venerable Sāriputta replied.

original: Āyasmā ānando etadavoca:
analyzed: āyasmai ānandaḥ etat avoca
translated: The venerable Ānanda said this:

original: “Idhāvuso sāriputta, bhikkhu atthakusalo ca hoti, dhammakusalo ca, byañjanakusalo ca, niruttikusalo ca, pubbāparakusalo ca.

analyzed: yathā passataḥ kho āvuso anantarā āsavānam khayaḥ hoti idam dassanānam agga  yathā suṇataḥ anantarā āsavānam khayaḥ hoti idam agga
translated: “When you see in such a way that your defilements come to an end, this is the best kind of seeing.🔽When you hear in such a way that your defilements come to an end, this is the best kind of hearing.

original: Yathā sukhitassa anantarā āsavānaṁ khayo hoti, idaṁ sukhānaṁ aggaṁ.
analyzed: yathā sukhitassa anantarā āsavānam khayaḥ hoti idam sukhānam agga

original: Ayamassa paṭhamo ābhicetasiko diṭṭhadhammasukhavihāro adhigato hoti avisuddhassa cittassa visuddhiyā apariyodātassa cittassa pariyodapanāya.

translated: This is the first abiding in bliss visible here and now that he has achieved by surmounting the preceding abiding in bliss.

original: Puna caparaṁ, sāriputta, ariyasāvako dhamme aveccappasādena samannāgato hoti:
analyzed: puna capara sāriputta ariya sāvakaḥ dhamme avecca ppasādena samannāgataḥ hoti
translated: “Again, Sāriputta, a noble disciple possesses unwavering confidence in the Dhamma:

original: ‘svākkhāto bhagavatā dhammo sandiṭṭhiko akāliko ehipassiko opaneyyiko paccattaṁ veditabbo viññūhī’ti.
analyzed: su ākkhātaḥ bhagavatā dhammaḥ sandiṭṭhikaḥ akālikaḥ ehipassikaḥ opaneyyikaḥ paccattam veditabbaḥ viññūhi iti
translated: ‘The Dhamma is well expounded by the Blessed One, directly visible, immediate, inviting one to come and see, applicable, to be personally experienced by the wise.’

original: Ayamassa dutiyo ābhicetasiko diṭṭhadhammasukhavihāro adhigato hoti avisuddhassa cittassa visuddhiyā apariyodātassa cittassa pariyodapanāya.
analyzed: ayam assa dutiyaḥ ābhicetasikaḥ diṭṭhadhamma sukha vihāraḥ adhigataḥ hoti a visuddhassa cittassa visuddhiyā a pariyodātassa cittassa pariyodapanāya
translated: This is the second abiding in bliss visible here and now that he has achieved by surmounting the preceding abiding in bliss.

original: Puna caparaṁ, sāriputta, ariyasāvako saṅghe aveccappasādena samannāgato hoti:
analyzed: puna capara sāriputta ariya sāvako saṅghe avecca ppasādena samannāgataḥ hoti
translated: “Again, Sāriputta, a noble disciple possesses unwavering confidence in the Saṅgha:

original: ‘suppaṭipanno bhagavato sāvakasaṅgho ujuppaṭipanno bhagavato sāvakasaṅgho ñāyappaṭipanno
analyzed: suppaṭipannaḥ bhagavataḥ sāvaka saṅghaḥ uju ppaṭipannaḥ bhagavataḥ sāvaka saṅghaḥ ñāya ppaṭipannaḥ
translated: ‘The Saṅgha of the Blessed One’s disciples is practising the good way, practising the straight way, practising the true way, practising the proper way; that is, the four pairs of persons, the eight types of individuals—this Saṅgha of the Blessed One’s disciples is worthy of gifts, worthy of hospitality, worthy of offerings, worthy of reverential salutation, the unsurpassed field of merit for the world.’

original: bhagavato sāvakasaṅgho sāmīcippaṭipanno bhagavato sāvakasaṅgho, yadidaṁ cattāri purisayugāni🔽aṭṭha purisapuggalā esa bhagavato sāvakasaṅgho āhuneyyo pāhuneyyo dakkhiṇeyyo añjalikaraṇīyo
analyzed: bhagavato sāvaka saṅgho sāmīcippaṭipannaḥ bhagavato sāvaka saṅghaḥ yat idam cattāri purisa yugāni  aṭṭha purisa puggalā esa bhagavato sāvaka saṅgho āhuneyyaḥ pāhuneyyaḥ dakkhiṇeyyaḥ añjali karaṇīyo
translated: The Fortunate One’s Saṅgha of disciples are in conformity with the Dhamma, the Fortunate One’s Saṅgha of disciples are in conformity with the Ājīva, the Fortunate One’s Saṅgha of disciples are in conformity with the practice, the Fortunate One’s Saṅgha of disciples are in conformity with the right way,🔽that is to say, the four pairs of persons, the eight individual persons, this Fortunate One’s Saṅgha of disciples is worthy of offerings, of hospitality, of gifts, and of reverential salutation,🔽they are the supreme field of merit for the world.

original: anuttaraṁ puññakkhettaṁ lokassā’ti.
analyzed: anuttaram puññakkhettam lokassa ati
translated: The Sangha of the Blessed One’s disciples is worthy of gifts, worthy of hospitality, worthy of offerings, worthy of reverential salutation, the unsurpassed field of merit for the world.

original: Ayamassa tatiyo ābhicetasiko diṭṭhadhammasukhavihāro adhigato hoti avisuddhassa cittassa visuddhiyā apariyodātassa cittassa pariyodapanāya.
analyzed: ayam assa tatiyaḥ ābhicetasikaḥ diṭṭhadhamma sukha vihāraḥ adhigataḥ hoti a visuddhassa cittassa visuddhiyā a pariyodātassa cittassa pariyodapanāya
translated: This is the third abiding of a person of integrity that he has achieved, a peaceful abiding, a sublime abiding, that is to say, the removal of desire and lust.

original: Puna caparaṁ, sāriputta, ariyasāvako ariyakantehi sīlehi samannāgato hoti akhaṇḍehi acchiddehi asabalehi akammāsehi bhujissehi viññuppasatthehi aparāmaṭṭhehi samādhisaṁvattanikehi.
analyzed: puna capara sāriputta ariya sāvakaḥ ariya kantehi sīlehi samannāgataḥ hoti akhaṇḍehi acchiddehi a sabalehi a kammāsehi bhujissehi viññu ppasatthehi a parāmaṭṭhehi samādhi savattanikehi
translated: “Again, Sariputta, a noble disciple recollects his own virtues: ‘My own virtues are unbroken, of little leakage, lovely, polished, perfected, unshakeable by any ascetic or brahmin or god or Māra or Brahmā or by anyone in the world.’

original: Ayamassa catuttho ābhicetasiko diṭṭhadhammasukhavihāro adhigato hoti avisuddhassa cittassa visuddhiyā apariyodātassa cittassa pariyodapanāya.
analyzed: ayam assa catutthaḥ ābhicetasikaḥ diṭṭhadhamma sukha vihāro adhigataḥ hoti a visuddhassa cittassa visuddhiyā a pariyodātassa cittassa pariyodapanāya
translated: This is the fourth abiding of a person of integrity that he has achieved, a peaceful abiding, a sublime abiding, that is to say, the removal of desire and lust.

original: Imesaṁ catunnaṁ ābhicetasikānaṁ diṭṭhadhammasukhavihārānaṁ nikāmalābhī hoti akicchalābhī akasiralābhī.
analyzed: imesam catunnam ābhicetasikānam diṭṭhadhamma sukha vihārānam nikāma lābhī hoti a kiccha lābhī a kasira lābhī
translated: and he attains them easily, without difficulty, without trouble.🔽Sāriputta, if you know of any white-clothed householder whose bodily,

original: Yaṁ kañci, sāriputta, jāneyyātha gihiṁ odātavasanaṁ—imesu pañcasu sikkhāpadesu saṁvutakammantaṁ,
analyzed: yam kañci sāriputta jāneyyātha gihim odāta vasana emesu pañcasu sikkhāpadesu
translated: verbal, and mental actions are restrained in these five ways,

original: imesañca catunnaṁ ābhicetasikānaṁ diṭṭhadhammasukhavihārānaṁ nikāmalābhiṁ akicchalābhiṁ
analyzed: imesam ca catunnam ābhicetasikānam diṭṭhadhamma sukha vihārānam nikāmalābhiṃ a kicchalābhiṃ
translated: and who attains these four pleasant visible dwellings in this very life easily, without difficulty, without trouble,

original: akasiralābhiṁ, so ākaṅkhamāno attanāva attānaṁ byākareyya:
analyzed: saḥ ākaṅkhamānaḥ attanā ava attānam byākareyya
translated: then such a one, if he so wishes, can declare of himself:

original: ‘khīṇanirayomhi khīṇatiracchānayoni khīṇapettivisayo khīṇāpāyaduggativinipāto, sotāpannohamasmi avinipātadhammo niyato sambodhiparāyaṇo’ti.
analyzed: khīṇa nirayaḥ mhi khīṇa tiracchāna yoni khīṇa petti visayaḥ khīṇa apāya duggati vinipāto so utāpannaḥ ham asmi a vinipāta dhammo niyataḥ sambodhi parāyaṇaḥ ti
translated: ‘I am finished with hell, the animal realm, and the sphere of afflicted spirits; finished with the plane of misery, the bad destination, the lower world. I am a stream-enterer, no longer subject to rebirth in the lower world, fixed in destiny, heading for enlightenment.’

original: Nirayesu bhayaṁ disvā,

original: Gavesīsutta🔽Ekaṁ samayaṁ bhagavā kosalesu cārikaṁ carati mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṁ.
analyzed: gavesīsutta  ekam samayam bhagavā kosalesu cārikam carati mahatā bhikkhu saṅghena saddhi
translated: The Seeker🔽On one occasion the Blessed One was wandering among the Kosalans together with a large Saṅgha of monks.

original: Addasā kho bhagavā addhānamaggappaṭipanno aññatarasmiṁ padese mahantaṁ sālavanaṁ;
analyzed: addasā kho bhagavā addhāna magga paṭipannaḥ aññatarasmin padese mahantam sālavana
translated: While traveling by a certain place, the Blessed One saw a large grove of sāla trees.

original: disvāna maggā okkamma yena taṁ sālavanaṁ tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā taṁ sālavanaṁ ajjhogāhetvā aññatarasmiṁ padese sitaṁ pātvākāsi.
analyzed: disvāna maggā okkamma yena tam sāla vanam tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā tam sāla vanam ajjhogāhetvā aññatarasmin padese sitam pātvā akāsi
translated: and he went to the Sālavana and entered the Sālavana. He went to a certain place in the Sālavana and sat down on a seat made ready.

original: Atha kho āyasmato ānandassa etadahosi:
analyzed: atha kho āyasmataḥ ānandassa etat ahosi
translated: Then it occurred to Ven. Ānanda:

original: “ko nu kho hetu ko paccayo bhagavato sitassa pātukammāya?
analyzed: kaḥ nu kho hetu kaḥ paccayaḥ bhagavato sitassa pātukammāya
translated: “What is the cause, what is the reason, why the Blessed One has smiled?

original: Na akāraṇena tathāgatā sitaṁ pātukarontī”ti.
analyzed: na akāraṇena tathāgatāḥ sitam pātukaronti iti
translated: Tathāgatas don’t smile for no reason.”

original: Atha kho āyasmā ānando bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: atha khalu āyasmai ānandaḥ bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: So he said to the Blessed One,

original: “ko nu kho, bhante, hetu ko paccayo bhagavato sitassa pātukammāya?
analyzed: kaḥ nu kho bhante hetu kaḥ paccayaḥ bhagavato sitassa pātukammāya
translated: “What is the cause, what is the reason, why the Blessed One has smiled?

original: Na akāraṇena tathāgatā sitaṁ pātukarontī”ti.
analyzed: na akāraṇena tathāgatāḥ sitam pātukaronti iti
translated: Tathāgatas don’t smile for no reason.”

original: “Bhūtapubbaṁ, ānanda, imasmiṁ padese nagaraṁ ahosi iddhañceva phītañca bahujanaṁ ākiṇṇamanussaṁ.
analyzed: bhūta pubbaḥ ānanda imasmin padese nagaram ahosi iddham ca iva phītam ca bahu janam ākiṇṇa manussa
translated: “Once, Ānanda, there was a city in this place that was prosperous, busy, and full of people.

original: Taṁ kho panānanda, nagaraṁ kassapo bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho upanissāya vihāsi.
analyzed: tam kho pana ānanda nagaram kassapaḥ bhagavā araham sammāsambuddhaḥ upanissāya vihāsi
translated: The Blessed One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha Kassapa stayed near that city.

original: Kassapassa kho panānanda, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa gavesī nāma upāsako ahosi sīlesu aparipūrakārī.
analyzed: kassapassa kho pana ānanda bhagavataḥ arahataḥ sammāsambuddhassa gavesī nāma upāsakaḥ ahosi sīlesu a paripūra kārī
translated: Kassapa had a lay follower called Gavesi who didn’t fulfill his precepts.

original: Gavesinā kho, ānanda, upāsakena pañcamattāni upāsakasatāni paṭidesitāni samādapitāni ahesuṁ sīlesu aparipūrakārino.
analyzed: gavesinā kho ānanda upāsakena pañcamattāni upāsaka satāni paṭidesitāni samādapitāni ahesum sīlesu a paripūra kārino
translated: Gavesi had instructed five hundred lay followers who didn’t fulfill their precepts.

original: Atha kho, ānanda, gavesissa upāsakassa etadahosi:
analyzed: atha kho ānanda gavesissa upāsakassa etat ahosi
translated: Then Gavesi thought,

original: ‘ahaṁ kho imesaṁ pañcannaṁ upāsakasatānaṁ bahūpakāro pubbaṅgamo samādapetā, ahañcamhi sīlesu aparipūrakārī, imāni ca pañca upāsakasatāni sīlesu aparipūrakārino.
analyzed: aham kho imesam pañcannam upāsaka satānam bahu upakāraḥ pubbaṅgamaḥ samādapetā aham ca amhi sīlesu a paripūra kārī imāni ca pañca upāsaka satāni sīlesu a paripūra kārino
translated: ‘I’ve been of great service to these five hundred lay followers. I’ve been their leader and instructor, but I don’t fulfill my precepts, and neither do they.

original: Iccetaṁ samasamaṁ, natthi kiñci atirekaṁ;
analyzed: samasama natthi kiñci
translated: So we’re equal in this respect. There’s nothing extra in me.

original: handāhaṁ atirekāyā’ti.
analyzed: handa aham atirekāya ati
translated: Well then, I’ll do more.’

original: Atha kho, ānanda, gavesī upāsako yena tāni pañca upāsakasatāni tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā tāni pañca upāsakasatāni etadavoca:
analyzed: atha khalu ānanda gavesī upāsakaḥ yena tāni pañca upāsaka satāni tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā tāni pañca upāsaka satāni etat avoca
translated: Then Gavesi went to those five hundred lay followers and said,

original: ‘ajjatagge maṁ āyasmanto sīlesu paripūrakāriṁ dhārethā’ti.
analyzed: ajjatagge mam āyasmantaḥ sīlesu paripūra kārim dhāretha ati
translated: ‘From today on, sirs, you should regard me as fulfilling my precepts.’

original: Atha kho, ānanda, tesaṁ pañcannaṁ upāsakasatānaṁ etadahosi:
analyzed: atha kho ānanda tesam pañcannam upāsaka satānam etat ahosi
translated: Then the five hundred lay followers thought,

original: ‘ayyo kho gavesī amhākaṁ bahūpakāro pubbaṅgamo samādapetā.
analyzed: ayyaḥ kho gavesī amhākam bahu upakāraḥ pubbaṅgamaḥ samādapetā
translated: ‘The lay follower Gavesī has been very helpful to us, encouraging us to take up the training.

original: Ayyo hi nāma gavesī sīlesu paripūrakārī bhavissati.
analyzed: ayyaḥ hi nāma gavesī sīlesu paripūra kārī bhavissati
translated: If he is perfecting his virtue,

original: Kimaṅgaṁ pana mayan’ti.
analyzed: kimaṅgam pana
translated: why shouldn’t we?’

original: Atha kho, ānanda, tāni pañca upāsakasatāni yena gavesī upāsako tenupasaṅkamiṁsu; upasaṅkamitvā gavesiṁ upāsakaṁ etadavocuṁ:
analyzed: atha khalu ānanda tāni pañca upāsaka satāni yena gavesī upāsakaḥ tena upasaṅkamisu upasaṅkamitvā gavesim upāsakam etat avocu
translated: Then they went to Gavesī and said,

original: ‘ajjatagge ayyo gavesī imānipi pañca upāsakasatāni sīlesu paripūrakārino dhāretū’ti.
analyzed: ajjatagge ayyaḥ gavesī imāni api pañca upāsaka satāni sīlesu paripūra kārinaḥ dhāretu uti
translated: ‘From today on, please consider us to be perfecting our virtue.’

analyzed: uttaruttari paṇīta paṇītam vā āyamamānāḥ anuttaram vimuttim sacchikarissāma ati

original: 19. Araññavagga
analyzed: araññavagga
translated: The Group of Discourses on the Forest

original: Āraññikasutta
analyzed: āraññika sutta
translated: In the Forest

original: “Pañcime, bhikkhave, āraññikā.
analyzed: pañcime bhikkhave āraññikā
translated: “Monks, there are these five people who live in the forest.

original: Katame pañca?🔽Mandattā momūhattā āraññiko hoti, pāpiccho icchāpakato āraññiko hoti, ummādā cittakkhepā🔽āraññiko hoti, vaṇṇitaṁ buddhehi buddhasāvakehīti āraññiko hoti, appicchataṁyeva🔽nissāya santuṭṭhiṁyeva nissāya sallekhaṁyeva nissāya pavivekaṁyeva nissāya idamatthitaṁyeva
analyzed: katame pañca  manda ttā momūha ttā āraññikaḥ hoti pāpicchaḥ icchā pakataḥ āraññikaḥ hoti ummādā citta kkhepā  āraññikaḥ hoti vaṇṇitam buddhehi buddha sāvakehi iti āraññikaḥ hoti appiccha tayā iva  nissāya santuṭṭhiyā iva nissāya sallekhayā iva nissāya pavivekayā iva nissāya idam atthitayā iva
translated: What five?

original: nissāya āraññiko hoti.
analyzed: nissāya āraññikaḥ hoti
translated: There is the person who lives in the forest out of foolishness & confusion. There is the person who lives in the forest with bad desires, overcome by desire. There is the person who lives in the forest because of insanity & derangement. There is the person who lives in the forest because it is praised by the Awakened Ones, the Buddhas, and their disciples. There is the person who lives in the forest depending on fewness of wishes, depending on contentment, depending on seclusion, depending on aloofness, depending on a mind well-released, depending on a mind well-liberated.

original: Ime kho, bhikkhave, pañca āraññikā.🔽Imesaṁ kho, bhikkhave, pañcannaṁ āraññikānaṁ yvāyaṁ āraññiko appicchataṁyeva nissāya
analyzed: ime kho bhikkhave pañca āraññikā  imesam kho bhikkhave pañcannam āraññikānam yvā ayam āraññikaḥ appiccha tayā iva nissāya
translated: These are the five people who live in the forest.🔽Of these five people who live in the forest, the person who lives in the forest depending on fewness of wishes,

original: santuṭṭhiṁyeva nissāya sallekhaṁyeva nissāya pavivekaṁyeva nissāya idamatthitaṁyeva
analyzed: santuṭṭhiyā iva nissāya sallekhayā iva nissāya pavivekayā iva nissāya idam atthitayā iva

analyzed: pubbe suda bhikkhave brāhmaṇā sāyam sāyamāsāya pāto pāta rāsāya bhikkham pariyesanti
translated: “In the past, brahmins went for alms in the evening for the evening meal and in the morning for the breakfast.

original: Etarahi, bhikkhave, brāhmaṇā yāvadatthaṁ udarāvadehakaṁ bhuñjitvā avasesaṁ ādāya pakkamanti.
analyzed: etarahi bhikkhave brāhmaṇāḥ yāvadattham udarāvadehakam bhuñjitvā avasesam ādāya pakkamanti
translated: But now, brahmins eat as much as they like to fill themselves up, and they take the leftovers away with them.

original: Etarahi, bhikkhave, sunakhā sāyaṁ sāyamāsāya pāto pātarāsāya bhikkhaṁ pariyesanti.
analyzed: etarahi bhikkhave sunakhā sāyam sāyamāsāya pāto pāta rāsāya bhikkham pariyesanti
translated: But dogs go for alms in the evening for the evening meal and in the morning for the breakfast.

original: Ayaṁ, bhikkhave, pañcamo porāṇo brāhmaṇadhammo etarahi sunakhesu sandissati, no brāhmaṇesu.
analyzed: bhikkhave pañcamaḥ porāṇaḥ brāhmaṇa dhammaḥ etarahi sunakhesu sandissati no brāhmaṇesu
translated: This is the fifth ancient practice of the brahmins that is now seen in dogs but not in brahmins.

original: Ime kho, bhikkhave, pañca porāṇā brāhmaṇadhammā etarahi sunakhesu sandissanti, no brāhmaṇesū”ti.🔽Paṭhamaṁ.
analyzed: ime kho bhikkhave pañca porāṇāḥ brāhmaṇa dhammāḥ etarahi sunakhesu sandissanti no brāhmaṇesu iti  paṭhama
translated: These are the five ancient practices of the brahmins that are now seen in dogs but not in brahmins.”🔽The first section for recitation on the brahmins is finished.

original: Aṅguttara Nikāya 5.192🔽20. Brāhmaṇavagga
analyzed: aṅguttara nikāya  brāhmaṇa vagga
translated: The Book of the Fives🔽The Group on Brahmins

original: Doṇabrāhmaṇasutta
analyzed: doṇabrāhmaṇasutta
translated: The Brahmin Doṇa

original: Atha kho doṇo brāhmaṇo yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavatā saddhiṁ sammodi.
analyzed: atha khalu doṇaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā bhagavatā saddhim sammodi
translated: He then went up to the Buddha and exchanged greetings with him.

original: Sammodanīyaṁ kathaṁ sāraṇīyaṁ vītisāretvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi. Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho doṇo brāhmaṇo bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:🔽“Sutaṁ metaṁ, bho gotama:
analyzed: sammodanīyam katham sāraṇīyam vītisāretvā ekamantam nisīdi ekamantam nisinnaḥ kho doṇaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ bhagavantam etat avoca  sutam mā ita bho gotama
translated: When this courteous and amiable talk was finished, he sat down to one side and said to the Buddha,

original: ‘na samaṇo gotamo brāhmaṇe jiṇṇe vuḍḍhe mahallake addhagate vayoanuppatte abhivādeti vā paccuṭṭheti vā āsanena vā nimantetī’ti.
analyzed: na samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ brāhmaṇe jiṇṇe vuḍḍhe mahallake addha gate vayaḥ anuppatte abhivādeti vā paccuṭṭheti vā āsanena vā nimanteti iti
translated: “Master Gotama, I have heard that you don’t bow down to brahmins, stand up for them, or offer them a seat.

original: Tayidaṁ, bho gotama, tatheva.
analyzed: tayida bho gotama tathā iva
translated: Is that so?

original: Na hi bhavaṁ gotamo brāhmaṇe jiṇṇe vuḍḍhe mahallake addhagate vayoanuppatte abhivādeti vā paccuṭṭheti vā āsanena vā nimanteti.
analyzed: na hi bhavam gotamaḥ brāhmaṇe jiṇṇe vuḍḍhe mahallake addha gate vayaḥ anuppatte abhivādeti vā paccuṭṭheti vā āsanena vā nimanteti
translated: You don’t bow down to brahmins, stand up for them, or offer them a seat.

original: Tayidaṁ, bho gotama, na sampannamevā”ti.
analyzed: bho gotama na sampannam eva ati
translated: That’s not right.”

original: “Tvampi no, doṇa, brāhmaṇo paṭijānāsī”ti?🔽“Yañhi taṁ, bho gotama, sammā vadamāno vadeyya:
analyzed: tvam pi naḥ doṇa brāhmaṇa paṭijānāsi iti  yat hi ta bho gotama sammā vadamānaḥ vadeyya
translated: “Do you claim to be a brahmin?”

original: ‘brāhmaṇo ubhato sujāto—
analyzed: brāhmaṇaḥ ubhatas su jātaḥ
translated: “If anyone should rightly be called a brahmin,🔽it’s me, since I’m well born on both my mother’s and father’s side,

original: mātito ca pitito ca, saṁsuddhagahaṇiko, yāva sattamā pitāmahayugā akkhitto anupakkuṭṭho
analyzed: mātitaḥ ca pititaḥ ca sa suddha gahaṇikaḥ yāva sattamā pitāmaha yugā akkhitto an upakkuṭṭhaḥ
translated: He is well-born on both his mother’s and his father’s side, of pure descent to the seventh generation, unbroken, of no lowly birth on either side.

original: jātivādena, ajjhāyako mantadharo, tiṇṇaṁ vedānaṁ pāragū sanighaṇḍukeṭubhānaṁ sākkharappabhedānaṁ
analyzed: jāti vādena ajjhāyakaḥ manta dharaḥ tiṇṇam vedānam pāragū sa nighaṇḍu keṭubhānam sa akkhara ppabhedānam
translated: He has memorized the hymns and teaches them, and has mastered the three Vedas together with their vocabularies, liturgy, phonology, and etymology, and the ancilary literature as a fifth.

original: itihāsapañcamānaṁ, padako veyyākaraṇo lokāyatamahāpurisalakkhaṇesu anavayo’ti, mameva
analyzed: padakaḥ veyyākaraṇaḥ mama eva
translated: He knows philology and grammar, and is well versed in cosmology and the marks of a great man.’

original: taṁ, bho gotama, sammā vadamāno vadeyya.🔽Ahañhi, bho gotama, brāhmaṇo ubhato sujāto—
analyzed: ta bho gotama sammā vadamānaḥ vadeyya  ahan hi bho gotama brāhmaṇaḥ ubhatas su jātaḥ
translated: If I were to say this, Master Gotama, I would be speaking of you.🔽For I am a brahmin who is well-born on both his mother’s and his father’s side,

original: mātito ca pitito ca, saṁsuddhagahaṇiko, yāva sattamā pitāmahayugā akkhitto anupakkuṭṭho
analyzed: mātitaḥ ca pititaḥ ca sa suddha gahaṇikaḥ yāva sattamā pitāmaha yugā akkhitto an upakkuṭṭhaḥ
translated: of pure descent to the seventh generation, unbroken, of no lowly birth on either side.

original: jātivādena, ajjhāyako mantadharo, tiṇṇaṁ vedānaṁ pāragū sanighaṇḍukeṭubhānaṁ sākkharappabhedānaṁ
analyzed: jāti vādena ajjhāyakaḥ manta dharaḥ tiṇṇam vedānam pāragū sa nighaṇḍu keṭubhānam sa akkhara ppabhedānam
translated: I have memorized the hymns and teach them, and have mastered the three Vedas together with their vocabularies, liturgy, phonology, and etymology, and the ancilary literature as a fifth.🔽I know philology and grammar, and am well versed in cosmology and the marks of a great man.”

original: itihāsapañcamānaṁ, padako veyyākaraṇo lokāyatamahāpurisalakkhaṇesu anavayo”ti.
analyzed: padakaḥ veyyākaraṇaḥ lokāyata mahāpurisa lakkhaṇesu
translated: and the Itihasa, the Pancasikha, the Padakatha, the Vyakaraṇa, the Lokāyata, and the Great Man’s Marks.”

original: “Ye kho te, doṇa, brāhmaṇānaṁ pubbakā isayo mantānaṁ kattāro mantānaṁ pavattāro,🔽yesamidaṁ etarahi brāhmaṇā porāṇaṁ mantapadaṁ gītaṁ pavuttaṁ samihitaṁ tadanugāyanti
analyzed: ye kho te doṇa brāhmaṇānam pubbakāḥ isayaḥ mantānam kattāraḥ mantānam pavattāraḥ  yesam idam etarahi brāhmaṇā porāṇam manta padam gītam pavuttam samihitam tat anugāyanti
translated: “Doṇa, there were ancient brahmin seers who were the founders of the mantras and creators of the mantras,🔽whose ancient verses, chanted and composed, the brahmins nowadays still chant and repeat, repeating what was spoken and singing what was sung.

original: tadanubhāsanti bhāsitamanubhāsanti sajjhāyitamanusajjhāyanti vācitamanuvācenti, seyyathidaṁ—aṭṭhako,
analyzed: tat anubhāsanti bhāsitam anubhāsanti sajjhāyitam anusajjhāyanti vācitam anuvācenti sā iyyathidam aṭṭhakaḥ
translated: They were Aṭṭhaka,

original: vāmako, vāmadevo, vessāmitto, yamadaggi, aṅgīraso, bhāradvājo, vāseṭṭho, kassapo, bhagu;
analyzed: vāmakaḥ vāmadevaḥ vessāmittaḥ yamadaggi aṅgīrasaḥ bhāradvājaḥ vāseṭṭhaḥ kassapaḥ bhagu
translated: Vāmaka, Vāmadeva, Vessāmitta, Yamadaggi, Aṅgīrasa, Bhāradvāja, Vāseṭṭha, Kassapa, and Bhagu.

original: tyāssume pañca brāhmaṇe paññāpenti—
analyzed: pañca brāhmaṇe paññāpenti
translated: They declared five kinds of brahmins:

original: brahmasamaṁ, devasamaṁ, mariyādaṁ, sambhinnamariyādaṁ, brāhmaṇacaṇḍālaṁyeva pañcamaṁ.
analyzed: brahma sama deva sama mariyāda sambhinnamariyāda brāhmaṇa caṇḍālayā iva pañcama
translated: those equal to Brahmā, those equal to the gods, those at the limit, those beyond the limit, and the fifth, the brahmin outcast.

original: Tesaṁ tvaṁ doṇa, katamo”ti?
analyzed: tesam tvam doṇa katamaḥ iti
translated: Which of these are you, Doṇa?”

original: “Na kho mayaṁ, bho gotama, pañca brāhmaṇe jānāma, atha kho mayaṁ brāhmaṇātveva jānāma.
analyzed: na kho maya bho gotama pañca brāhmaṇe jānāma atha kho mayam brāhmaṇāḥ tu eva jānāma
translated: “Master Gotama, we don’t know about these five kinds of brahmins. We just know that we’re brahmins.

original: Sādhu me bhavaṁ gotamo tathā dhammaṁ desetu yathā ahaṁ ime pañca brāhmaṇe jāneyyan”ti.
analyzed: sādhu me bhavam gotamaḥ tathā dhammam desetu yathā aham ime pañca brāhmaṇe jāneyyanti
translated: It would be good if Master Gotama would teach me the Dhamma so that I might know about these five kinds of brahmins.”

original: “Tena hi, brāhmaṇa, suṇohi, sādhukaṁ manasi karohi; bhāsissāmī”ti.
analyzed: tena hi brāhmaṇa suṇohi sādhukam manasi karohi bhāsissāmi iti
translated: “Well then, brahmin, listen and pay careful attention, I will speak.”

original: “Evaṁ, bho”ti kho doṇo brāhmaṇo bhagavato paccassosi.
analyzed: eva bhoti kho doṇaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ bhagavato paccassosi
translated: “Yes, sir,” Doṇa replied.

original: Bhagavā etadavoca:
analyzed: bhagavān etat avoca
translated: The Buddha said this:

original: “Kathañca, doṇa, brāhmaṇo brahmasamo hoti?🔽Idha, doṇa, brāhmaṇo ubhato sujāto hoti—
analyzed: kathañca doṇa brāhmaṇaḥ brahma samaḥ hoti  brāhmaṇaḥ ubhatas su jātaḥ hoti
translated: “And how, Doṇa, is a brahmin like Brahmā?

original: mātito ca pitito ca, saṁsuddhagahaṇiko, yāva sattamā pitāmahayugā akkhitto anupakkuṭṭho jātivādena.
analyzed: mātitaḥ ca pititaḥ ca sa suddha gahaṇikaḥ yāva sattamā pitāmaha yugā akkhittaḥ an upakkuṭṭhaḥ jāti vādena
translated: Here, Doṇa, a brahmin is well born on both his mother’s and his father’s side, of pure descent to the seventh generation, uncriticized and impeccable in regard to birth.

original: So aṭṭhacattālīsavassāni komārabrahmacariyaṁ carati mante adhīyamāno.
analyzed: so aṭṭhacattālīsa vassāni komāra brahmacariyam carati mante adhīyamānaḥ
translated: For forty-eight years he practices the conduct of a virgin, studying the mantras.

original: Aṭṭhacattālīsavassāni komārabrahmacariyaṁ caritvā mante adhīyitvā ācariyassa ācariyadhanaṁ pariyesati dhammeneva, no adhammena.
analyzed: aṭṭha cattālīsa vassāni komāra brahmacariyam caritvā mante adhīyitvā ācariyassa ācariya dhanam pariyesati dhammena iva no adhammena
translated: Having studied the mantras, he seeks the teacher’s fee, only righteously, not unrighteously.

original: Tattha ca, doṇa, ko dhammo?
analyzed: tattha ca doṇa ko dhammo
translated: And what is the righteous way there, Doṇa?

original: Neva kasiyā na vaṇijjāya na gorakkhena na issatthena na rājaporisena na sippaññatarena, kevalaṁ bhikkhācariyāya kapālaṁ anatimaññamāno.
analyzed: na iva kasiyā na vaṇijjāya na gorakkhena na issatthena na rājaporisena na sippaññatarena kevalam bhikkhā cariyāya kapālam an atimaññamānaḥ
translated: Not by farming, trade, raising cattle, archery, government service, or a craft, but only by going on alms round without despising the bowl.

original: So ācariyassa ācariyadhanaṁ niyyādetvā kesamassuṁ ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajati.🔽So evaṁ pabbajito samāno mettāsahagatena cetasā ekaṁ disaṁ pharitvā viharati, tathā🔽dutiyaṁ tathā tatiyaṁ tathā catutthaṁ, iti uddhamadho tiriyaṁ sabbadhi sabbattatāya
analyzed: saḥ ācariyassa ācariya dhanam niyyādetvā kesa massum ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā agārasma anagāriyam pabbajati  saḥ evam pabbajitaḥ samānaḥ mettā sahagatena cetasā ekam disam pharitvā viharati tathā  dutiyam tathā tatiyam tathā catutthaḥ iti uddham adhas tiriyam sabbadhi sabbattatāya
translated: He gives his teacher his teacher’s due and shaves off his hair and beard, puts on ocher robes, and goes forth from the home life into homelessness.

original: sabbāvantaṁ lokaṁ mettāsahagatena cetasā vipulena mahaggatena appamāṇena averena🔽abyāpajjena pharitvā viharati.🔽Karuṇā …pe…
analyzed: sabbāvantam lokam mettā sahagatena cetasā vipulena mahaggatena appamāṇena averena  a byāpajjena viharati  karuṇā pe
translated: Having gone forth, he abides pervading one quarter with a mind imbued with loving-kindness, likewise the second, likewise the third, likewise the fourth; so above, below, around, and everywhere, and to all as to himself, he abides pervading the all-encompassing world with a mind imbued with loving-kindness, abundant, exalted, immeasurable, without hostility and without ill will.🔽He abides pervading one quarter with a mind imbued with compassion…

original: muditā …🔽upekkhāsahagatena cetasā ekaṁ disaṁ pharitvā viharati, tathā dutiyaṁ tathā tatiyaṁ🔽tathā catutthaṁ, iti uddhamadho tiriyaṁ sabbadhi sabbattatāya sabbāvantaṁ lokaṁ upekkhāsahagatena
analyzed: muditā  upekkhā sahagatena cetasā ekam disam pharitvā viharati tathā dutiyam tathā tatiya  tathā catutthaḥ iti uddham adhas tiriyam sabbadhi sabbattatāya sabbāvantam lokam upekkhā sahagatena
translated: with a mind imbued with appreciative joy…

original: cetasā vipulena mahaggatena appamāṇena averena abyāpajjena pharitvā viharati.
analyzed: cetasā vipulena mahaggatena appamāṇena averena a byāpajjena pharitvā viharati
translated: with a mind imbued with equanimity, likewise the second, likewise the third, likewise the fourth; so above, below, around, and everywhere, and to all as to himself, he abides pervading the all-encompassing world with a mind imbued with equanimity, abundant, exalted, immeasurable, without hostility and without ill will.

original: So ime cattāro brahmavihāre bhāvetvā kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā sugatiṁ brahmalokaṁ upapajjati.
analyzed: saḥ ime cattāraḥ brahmavihāre bhāvetvā kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā sugatim brahma lokam upapajjati
translated: When his body breaks up, after death, he is reborn in the company of the Brahma-world gods.

original: Evaṁ kho, doṇa, brāhmaṇo brahmasamo hoti.
analyzed: evam kho doṇa brāhmaṇaḥ brahma samaḥ hoti
translated: That is how a brahmin is equal to Brahma.

original: Kathañca, doṇa, brāhmaṇo devasamo hoti?🔽Idha, doṇa, brāhmaṇo ubhato sujāto hoti—
analyzed: kathañca doṇa brāhmaṇaḥ deva samaḥ hoti  brāhmaṇaḥ ubhatas su jātaḥ hoti
translated: “And how is a brahmin equal to the gods?

original: mātito ca pitito ca, saṁsuddhagahaṇiko, yāva sattamā pitāmahayugā akkhitto anupakkuṭṭho jātivādena.
analyzed: mātitaḥ ca pititaḥ ca sa suddha gahaṇikaḥ yāva sattamā pitāmaha yugā akkhittaḥ an upakkuṭṭhaḥ jāti vādena
translated: Here, a brahmin is well-born on both sides, of pure maternal and paternal descent, unassailable and impeccable with respect to birth as far back as seven generations of ancestors on both the mother’s and the father’s side.

original: So aṭṭhacattālīsavassāni komārabrahmacariyaṁ carati mante adhīyamāno.
analyzed: so aṭṭhacattālīsa vassāni komāra brahmacariyam carati mante adhīyamānaḥ
translated: He lives the life of a celibate brahmacariya for fifty or sixty years.

original: Aṭṭhacattālīsavassāni komārabrahmacariyaṁ caritvā mante adhīyitvā ācariyassa ācariyadhanaṁ pariyesati dhammeneva, no adhammena.
analyzed: aṭṭha cattālīsa vassāni komāra brahmacariyam caritvā mante adhīyitvā ācariyassa ācariya dhanam pariyesati dhammena iva no adhammena
translated: After living the life of a celibate brahmacariya for fifty or sixty years, he seeks out a wife for his son and takes a wife for himself.

original: Tattha ca, doṇa, ko dhammo?
analyzed: tattha ca doṇa ko dhammo
translated: “And what is the right way in this case?

original: Neva kasiyā na vaṇijjāya na gorakkhena na issatthena na rājaporisena na sippaññatarena, kevalaṁ bhikkhācariyāya kapālaṁ anatimaññamāno.
analyzed: na iva kasiyā na vaṇijjāya na gorakkhena na issatthena na rājaporisena na sippaññatarena kevalam bhikkhā cariyāya kapālam an atimaññamānaḥ
translated: Not by farming, trade, raising cattle, archery, statecraft, or a profession, but only by going on alms round without slighting any house.

original: So ācariyassa ācariyadhanaṁ niyyādetvā dāraṁ pariyesati dhammeneva, no adhammena.
analyzed: saḥ ācariyassa ācariya dhanam niyyādetvā dāram pariyesati dhammena iva no adhammena
translated: He gives his teacher his teacher’s fee and then seeks a wife, but only through legitimate means, not illegitimate.

original: Tattha ca, doṇa, ko dhammo?
analyzed: tattha ca doṇa ko dhammo
translated: And what is legitimate there?

original: Neva kayena na vikkayena, brāhmaṇiṁyeva udakūpassaṭṭhaṁ.
analyzed: na iva kayena na vikkayena brāhmaṇiyā iva
translated: Not by body or by sale, but only a brahmin woman bathed and anointed.

original: So brāhmaṇiṁyeva gacchati, na khattiyiṁ na vessiṁ na suddiṁ na caṇḍāliṁ na nesādiṁ🔽na veniṁ na rathakāriṁ na pukkusiṁ gacchati, na gabbhiniṁ gacchati, na pāyamānaṁ
analyzed: saḥ brāhmaṇiyā iva gacchati na khattiyim na vessim na suddim na caṇḍālim na nesādi  na venim na rathakārim na pukkusim gacchati na gabbhinim gacchati na
translated: He goes only to a brahmin woman, not to a noble woman, an artisan woman, or a worker woman. He goes only to a brahmin woman, not to a prostitute.🔽He goes only to a woman who is not pregnant, not to a woman who is breastfeeding,

original: gacchati, na anutuniṁ gacchati.
analyzed: gacchati na anutunim gacchati
translated: not to a woman in pain, not to a woman who has not prepared a seat.

original: Kasmā ca, doṇa, brāhmaṇo na gabbhiniṁ gacchati?
analyzed: kasmā ca doṇa brāhmaṇaḥ na gabbhinim gacchati
translated: And why, Doṇa, does a brahmin not go to a woman who is pregnant?

original: Sace, doṇa, brāhmaṇo gabbhiniṁ gacchati, atimīḷhajo nāma so hoti māṇavako vā māṇavikā vā.
analyzed: sace doṇa brāhmaṇaḥ gabbhinim gacchati atimīḷhajaḥ nāma saḥ hoti māṇavakaḥ vā māṇavikā vā
translated: If a brahmin goes to a woman who is pregnant, the child born is called a bastard.

original: Tasmā, doṇa, brāhmaṇo na gabbhiniṁ gacchati.
analyzed: tasmai doṇa brāhmaṇaḥ na gabbhinim gacchati
translated: That’s why a brahmin doesn’t go to a woman who is pregnant.

original: Kasmā ca, doṇa, brāhmaṇo na pāyamānaṁ gacchati?
analyzed: kasmā ca brāhmaṇaḥ na pāyamānam gacchati
translated: And why, Doṇa, does a brahmin not go to a woman who is breastfeeding?

original: Sace, doṇa, brāhmaṇo pāyamānaṁ gacchati, asucipaṭipīḷito nāma so hoti māṇavako vā māṇavikā vā.
analyzed: sace brāhmaṇaḥ pāyamānam gacchati asucipaṭipīḍitaḥ nāma saḥ hoti māṇavakaḥ vā māṇavikā vā
translated: If a brahmin goes to a woman who is breastfeeding, the child born is called ‘oppressed by the breast’.

original: Tasmā, doṇa, brāhmaṇo na pāyamānaṁ gacchati.
analyzed: tasmai doṇa brāhmaṇaḥ na pāyamānam gacchati
translated: So the brahmin does not go to the next world while being milked.

original: Tassa sā hoti brāhmaṇī neva kāmatthā na davatthā na ratatthā, pajatthāva brāhmaṇassa brāhmaṇī hoti.
analyzed: tassa sā hoti brāhmaṇī na iva kāmatthā na davatthā na ratatthā pajatthā ava brāhmaṇassa brāhmaṇī hoti
translated: His brahmin wife is not for his gratification, enjoyment, and amusement, but only for procreation.

original: So methunaṁ uppādetvā kesamassuṁ ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajati.
analyzed: saḥ methunam uppādetvā kesa massum ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā agārasma anagāriyam pabbajati
translated: He begets a son in his wife and then shaves off his hair and beard, puts on the yellow robe, and goes forth from the home life into homelessness.

original: So evaṁ pabbajito samāno vivicceva kāmehi …pe… catutthaṁ jhānaṁ upasampajja viharati.
analyzed: saḥ evam pabbajitaḥ samānaḥ vivicca iva kāmehi pe catuttham jhānam upasampajja viharati
translated: When he has gone forth thus, secluded from sensual pleasures … he dwells … having entered upon the fourth jhāna.

original: So ime cattāro jhāne bhāvetvā kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā sugatiṁ saggaṁ lokaṁ upapajjati.
analyzed: saḥ ime cattāro jhāne bhāvetvā kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā sugatim saggam lokam upapajjati
translated: When he has developed these four jhānas, on the dissolution of the body, after death, he reappears in a happy destiny, in the heavenly world.

original: Evaṁ kho, doṇa, brāhmaṇo devasamo hoti.
analyzed: evam kho doṇa brāhmaṇaḥ deva samaḥ hoti
translated: That is how a brahmin is equal to the gods.

original: Kathañca, doṇa, brāhmaṇo mariyādo hoti?
analyzed: kathañca doṇa brāhmaṇaḥ
translated: “And how, Doṇa, is a brahmin a limit?

original: Idha, doṇa, brāhmaṇo ubhato sujāto hoti—
analyzed: brāhmaṇaḥ ubhatas su jātaḥ hoti
translated: Here, Doṇa, a brahmin is well born on both sides,

original: mātito ca pitito ca, saṁsuddhagahaṇiko, yāva sattamā pitāmahayugā akkhitto anupakkuṭṭho jātivādena.
analyzed: mātitaḥ ca pititaḥ ca sa suddha gahaṇikaḥ yāva sattamā pitāmaha yugā akkhittaḥ an upakkuṭṭhaḥ jāti vādena
translated: of pure maternal and paternal descent seven generations back, un reproached and impeccable in respect of birth.

original: So aṭṭhacattālīsavassāni komārabrahmacariyaṁ carati mante adhīyamāno.
analyzed: so aṭṭhacattālīsa vassāni komāra brahmacariyam carati mante adhīyamānaḥ
translated: for forty-eight years as a youth living the spiritual life and studying the scriptures.

original: Aṭṭhacattālīsavassāni komārabrahmacariyaṁ caritvā mante adhīyitvā ācariyassa ācariyadhanaṁ pariyesati dhammeneva, no adhammena.
analyzed: aṭṭha cattālīsa vassāni komāra brahmacariyam caritvā mante adhīyitvā ācariyassa ācariya dhanam pariyesati dhammena iva no adhammena
translated: After forty-eight years as a youth living the spiritual life and studying the scriptures, he seeks the fee for his teacher, by rightful means, not by wrongful means.

original: Tattha ca, doṇa, ko dhammo?
analyzed: tattha ca doṇa ko dhammo
translated: And what, Doṇa, is the right way?

original: Neva kasiyā na vaṇijjāya na gorakkhena na issatthena na rājaporisena na sippaññatarena, kevalaṁ bhikkhācariyāya kapālaṁ anatimaññamāno.
analyzed: na iva kasiyā na vaṇijjāya na gorakkhena na issatthena na rājaporisena na sippaññatarena kevalam bhikkhā cariyāya kapālam an atimaññamānaḥ
translated: Not by farming, trade, raising cattle, archery, statecraft, or a profession, but by living on alms and not despising anyone.

original: So ācariyassa ācariyadhanaṁ niyyādetvā dāraṁ pariyesati dhammeneva, no adhammena.
analyzed: saḥ ācariyassa ācariya dhanam niyyādetvā dāram pariyesati dhammena iva no adhammena
translated: He pays his teacher’s fee to his teacher and then seeks a wife by rightful means, not by wrongful means.

original: Tattha ca, doṇa, ko dhammo?
analyzed: tattha ca doṇa ko dhammo
translated: And what, Doṇa, is the right way?

original: Neva kayena na vikkayena, brāhmaṇiṁyeva udakūpassaṭṭhaṁ.🔽So brāhmaṇiṁyeva gacchati, na khattiyiṁ na vessiṁ na suddiṁ na caṇḍāliṁ na nesādiṁ
analyzed: na iva kayena na vikkayena brāhmaṇiyā iva  saḥ brāhmaṇiyā iva gacchati na khattiyim na vessim na suddim na caṇḍālim na nesādi
translated: Not by money or goods, but by taking a Brahmin girl with water poured over her.🔽He goes only to a Brahmin girl, not to a noble girl, a merchant girl, a worker girl, an outcaste girl, or a low-caste girl.

original: na veniṁ na rathakāriṁ na pukkusiṁ gacchati, na gabbhiniṁ gacchati, na pāyamānaṁ
analyzed: na venim na rathakārim na pukkusim gacchati na gabbhinim gacchati na
translated: He goes only to a girl who is not pregnant, not to a girl who is pregnant.

original: gacchati, na anutuniṁ gacchati.
analyzed: gacchati na anutunim gacchati
translated: he doesn’t go to one who is pregnant.

original: Kasmā ca, doṇa, brāhmaṇo na gabbhiniṁ gacchati?
analyzed: kasmā ca doṇa brāhmaṇaḥ na gabbhinim gacchati
translated: And why doesn’t the brahmin go to one who is pregnant?

original: Sace, doṇa, brāhmaṇo gabbhiniṁ gacchati, atimīḷhajo nāma so hoti māṇavako vā māṇavikā vā.
analyzed: sace doṇa brāhmaṇaḥ gabbhinim gacchati atimīḷhajaḥ nāma saḥ hoti māṇavakaḥ vā māṇavikā vā
translated: If the brahmin goes to one who is pregnant, the child born is called a ‘miscarriage’.

original: Tasmā, doṇa, brāhmaṇo na gabbhiniṁ gacchati.
analyzed: tasmai doṇa brāhmaṇaḥ na gabbhinim gacchati
translated: That’s why the brahmin doesn’t go to one who is pregnant.

original: Kasmā ca, doṇa, brāhmaṇo na pāyamānaṁ gacchati?
analyzed: kasmā ca brāhmaṇaḥ na pāyamānam gacchati
translated: And why doesn’t the brahmin go to one who is nursing?

original: Sace, doṇa, brāhmaṇo pāyamānaṁ gacchati, asucipaṭipīḷito nāma so hoti māṇavako vā māṇavikā vā.
analyzed: sace brāhmaṇaḥ pāyamānam gacchati asucipaṭipīḍitaḥ nāma saḥ hoti māṇavakaḥ vā māṇavikā vā
translated: If the brahmin goes to one who is nursing, the child born is called ‘oppressed by the breast’.

original: Tasmā, doṇa, brāhmaṇo na pāyamānaṁ gacchati.
analyzed: tasmai doṇa brāhmaṇaḥ na pāyamānam gacchati
translated: That’s why the brahmin doesn’t go to one who is nursing.

original: Tassa sā hoti brāhmaṇī neva kāmatthā na davatthā na ratatthā, pajatthāva brāhmaṇassa brāhmaṇī hoti.
analyzed: tassa sā hoti brāhmaṇī na iva kāmatthā na davatthā na ratatthā pajatthā ava brāhmaṇassa brāhmaṇī hoti
translated: His brahmin wife is not for his pleasure, enjoyment, and amusement, but only for procreation.

original: So methunaṁ uppādetvā tameva puttassādaṁ nikāmayamāno kuṭumbaṁ ajjhāvasati, na agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajati.
analyzed: saḥ methunam uppādetvā tam eva putta ssādam nikāmayamānaḥ kuṭumbam ajjhāvasati na agārasma anagāriyam pabbajati
translated: Having produced offspring, he lives the household life for the sake of the child, not going forth from the household life into homelessness.

original: Yāva porāṇānaṁ brāhmaṇānaṁ mariyādo tattha tiṭṭhati, taṁ na vītikkamati.
analyzed: yāva porāṇānam brāhmaṇānam mariyādaḥ tattha tiṭṭhati tam na vītikkamati
translated: He stays within the bounds set by the ancient brahmin seers and does not overstep them.

original: ‘Yāva porāṇānaṁ brāhmaṇānaṁ mariyādo tattha brāhmaṇo ṭhito taṁ na vītikkamatī’ti, kho, doṇa, tasmā brāhmaṇo mariyādoti vuccati.
analyzed: yāva porāṇānam brāhmaṇānam mariyādo tattha brāhmaṇaḥ ṭhitaḥ tam na vītikkamati iti kho doṇa tasmā brāhmaṇaḥ mariyādo ti vuccati
translated: ‘Because he does not overstep the bounds set by the ancient brahmin seers, therefore a brahmin is called “one who has bounds.”

original: Evaṁ kho, doṇa, brāhmaṇo mariyādo hoti.
analyzed: evam kho doṇa brāhmaṇaḥ mariyādaḥ hoti
translated: It is in this way that a brahmin has bounds.

original: Kathañca, doṇa, brāhmaṇo sambhinnamariyādo hoti?🔽Idha, doṇa, brāhmaṇo ubhato sujāto hoti—
analyzed: kathañca doṇa brāhmaṇaḥ sambhinna mariyādaḥ hoti  brāhmaṇaḥ ubhatas su jātaḥ hoti
translated: “And how, Doṇa, does a brahmin have bounds that are broken?

original: mātito ca pitito ca, saṁsuddhagahaṇiko, yāva sattamā pitāmahayugā akkhitto anupakkuṭṭho jātivādena.
analyzed: mātitaḥ ca pititaḥ ca sa suddha gahaṇikaḥ yāva sattamā pitāmaha yugā akkhittaḥ an upakkuṭṭhaḥ jāti vādena
translated: Here, Doṇa, a brahmin is well-born on both sides, of pure maternal and paternal descent seven generations back, unassailable and impeccable in respect of birth.

original: So aṭṭhacattālīsavassāni komārabrahmacariyaṁ carati mante adhīyamāno.
analyzed: so aṭṭhacattālīsa vassāni komāra brahmacariyam carati mante adhīyamānaḥ
translated: For forty-eight years he lives the life of a celibate student, learning the mantras.

original: Aṭṭhacattālīsavassāni komārabrahmacariyaṁ caritvā mante adhīyitvā ācariyassa ācariyadhanaṁ pariyesati dhammeneva, no adhammena.
analyzed: aṭṭha cattālīsa vassāni komāra brahmacariyam caritvā mante adhīyitvā ācariyassa ācariya dhanam pariyesati dhammena iva no adhammena
translated: Having completed the forty-eight years and learned the mantras, he seeks for his teacher’s fee an outstanding teacher’s fee, namely, a mother or a sister on the father’s side.

original: Tattha ca, doṇa, ko dhammo?
analyzed: tattha ca doṇa ko dhammo
translated: And what is the rule here, Doṇa?

original: Neva kasiyā na vaṇijjāya na gorakkhena na issatthena na rājaporisena na sippaññatarena, kevalaṁ bhikkhācariyāya kapālaṁ anatimaññamāno.🔽So ācariyassa ācariyadhanaṁ niyyādetvā dāraṁ pariyesati dhammenapi adhammenapi kayenapi vikkayenapi brāhmaṇimpi udakūpassaṭṭhaṁ.
analyzed: na iva kasiyā na vaṇijjāya na gorakkhena na issatthena na rājaporisena na sippaññatarena kevalam bhikkhā cariyāya kapālam an atimaññamānaḥ  saḥ ācariyassa ācariya dhanam niyyādetvā dāram pariyesati dhammena api adhammena api kayena api vikkayena api brāhmaṇim pi
translated: Not by farming, business, raising cattle, archery, government service, or a craft, but only by wandering for alms without slighting anyone.🔽He gives his teacher his teacher’s fee and then seeks a wife, legitimately and by proper means, not illegitimately or by improper means, not a wife who is the wife of another, not a wife who is protected by her mother, father, mother and father, brother, sister, or relatives, not a wife who is protected by her clan’s law.

original: So brāhmaṇimpi gacchati khattiyimpi gacchati vessimpi gacchati suddimpi gacchati🔽caṇḍālimpi gacchati nesādimpi gacchati venimpi gacchati rathakārimpi gacchati pukkusimpi
analyzed: saḥ brāhmaṇim pi gacchati khattiyim pi gacchati vessim pi gacchati suddim pi gacchati  caṇḍālimpi gacchati nesādimpi gacchati venimpi gacchati rathakārimpi gacchati pukkusimpi
translated: He goes with a Brahmin woman, a warrior woman, a merchant woman, or an artisan woman.🔽He goes with a barmaid, a female wanderer, a prostitute, a female messenger, a widow, or a woman who has recently died.

original: gacchati gabbhinimpi gacchati pāyamānampi gacchati utunimpi gacchati anutunimpi gacchati.
analyzed: gacchati gabbhinim gacchati pāyamānampi gacchati utunim gacchati anutunim gacchati
translated: He goes with a woman who is pregnant, who is nursing, who is menstruating, or who is engaged to another man.

original: Tassa sā hoti brāhmaṇī kāmatthāpi davatthāpi ratatthāpi pajatthāpi brāhmaṇassa brāhmaṇī hoti.
analyzed: tassa sā hoti brāhmaṇī davatthā api ratatthā api pajatthā api brāhmaṇassa brāhmaṇī hoti
translated: He has a Brahmin wife for the sake of pleasure, for the sake of enjoyment, for the sake of sensuality, for the sake of delight.

original: Yāva porāṇānaṁ brāhmaṇānaṁ mariyādo tattha na tiṭṭhati, taṁ vītikkamati.
analyzed: yāva porāṇānam brāhmaṇānam mariyādaḥ tattha na tiṭṭhati tam vītikkamati
translated: He does not observe the ancient boundaries of the Brahmins. He transgresses them.

original: ‘Yāva porāṇānaṁ brāhmaṇānaṁ mariyādo tattha brāhmaṇo na ṭhito taṁ vītikkamatī’ti kho, doṇa, tasmā brāhmaṇo sambhinnamariyādoti vuccati.
analyzed: yāva porāṇānam brāhmaṇānam mariyādo tattha brāhmaṇaḥ na ṭhitaḥ tam vītikkamati iti kho doṇa tasmā brāhmaṇaḥ sambhinna mariyādo ti vuccati
translated: ‘The brahmin has gone beyond the ancient brahmin practices that were laid down in ancient times by the ancient seers. That is why the brahmin is said to have transgressed the ancient boundaries.’

original: Evaṁ kho, doṇa, brāhmaṇo sambhinnamariyādo hoti.
analyzed: evam kho doṇa brāhmaṇaḥ sambhinna mariyādaḥ hoti
translated: That is how a brahmin has transgressed the ancient boundaries.

original: Kathañca, doṇa, brāhmaṇo brāhmaṇacaṇḍālo hoti?🔽Idha, doṇa, brāhmaṇo ubhato sujāto hoti—
analyzed: kathañca doṇa brāhmaṇaḥ brāhmaṇa caṇḍālaḥ hoti  brāhmaṇaḥ ubhatas su jātaḥ hoti
translated: “And how is a brahmin a brahmin-caṇḍāla?

original: mātito ca pitito ca, saṁsuddhagahaṇiko, yāva sattamā pitāmahayugā akkhitto anupakkuṭṭho jātivādena.
analyzed: mātitaḥ ca pititaḥ ca sa suddha gahaṇikaḥ yāva sattamā pitāmaha yugā akkhittaḥ an upakkuṭṭhaḥ jāti vādena
translated: Here, a brahmin is well-born on both sides, of pure maternal and paternal descent, unassailable and impeccable with respect to birth back to the seventh paternal generation.

original: So aṭṭhacattālīsavassāni komārabrahmacariyaṁ carati mante adhīyamāno.🔽Aṭṭhacattālīsavassāni komārabrahmacariyaṁ caritvā mante adhīyitvā ācariyassa ācariyadhanaṁ pariyesati dhammenapi adhammenapi
analyzed: so aṭṭhacattālīsa vassāni komāra brahmacariyam carati mante adhīyamānaḥ  aṭṭha cattālīsa vassāni komāra brahmacariyam caritvā mante adhīyitvā ācariyassa ācariya dhanam pariyesati dhammena pi adhammena pi
translated: He lives the life of an ascetic for forty-eight years, studying the Vedas.

original: kasiyāpi vaṇijjāyapi gorakkhenapi issatthenapi rājaporisenapi sippaññatarenapi, kevalampi bhikkhācariyāya, kapālaṁ anatimaññamāno.
analyzed: kasiyā api vaṇijjāya api gorakkhena api issatthena api rāja porisena api sippaññatarena api kevalam pi bhikkhā cariyāya kapālam an atimaññamāno
translated: Having studied the Vedas, he seeks the brahmin’s fee, by fair means or foul, by energy or by activity, by bending, bowing, and contortion, by slavish service, by not dropping the bowl, by not besmearing the face.

original: So ācariyassa ācariyadhanaṁ niyyādetvā dāraṁ pariyesati dhammenapi adhammenapi kayenapi vikkayenapi brāhmaṇimpi udakūpassaṭṭhaṁ.
analyzed: saḥ ācariyassa ācariya dhanam niyyādetvā dāram pariyesati dhammena api adhammena api kayena api vikkayena api brāhmaṇim pi
translated: He then gives his teacher his teacher’s fee and looks for a wife, by himself or through his parents or brothers or sisters or relatives or friends, either by means of a dowry or by taking another’s wife through force.

original: So brāhmaṇimpi gacchati khattiyimpi gacchati vessimpi gacchati suddimpi gacchati
analyzed: saḥ brāhmaṇim pi gacchati khattiyim pi gacchati vessim pi gacchati suddim pi gacchati
translated: He has intercourse with a brahmin woman, a noble woman, a merchant woman, or a worker woman.

original: caṇḍālimpi gacchati nesādimpi gacchati venimpi gacchati rathakārimpi gacchati pukkusimpi🔽gacchati gabbhinimpi gacchati pāyamānampi gacchati utunimpi gacchati anutunimpi gacchati.
analyzed: caṇḍālimpi gacchati nesādimpi gacchati venimpi gacchati rathakārimpi gacchati pukkusimpi  gacchati gabbhinim gacchati pāyamānampi gacchati utunim gacchati anutunim gacchati
translated: He has intercourse with a caṇḍāla woman, a pukkusa woman, a vessa woman, or a rathakāra woman.🔽He has intercourse with a woman who is pregnant or breastfeeding, and he has intercourse with his wife only during her season.

original: Tassa sā hoti brāhmaṇī kāmatthāpi davatthāpi ratatthāpi pajatthāpi brāhmaṇassa brāhmaṇī hoti.
analyzed: tassa sā hoti brāhmaṇī davatthā api ratatthā api pajatthā api brāhmaṇassa brāhmaṇī hoti
translated: His brahmin wife is for his enjoyment, for his pleasure, for his delight, and for the sake of tending the house.

original: So sabbakammehi jīvikaṁ kappeti.
analyzed: so sabba kammehi jīvikam kappeti
translated: He makes a living by all kinds of work.

original: Tamenaṁ brāhmaṇā evamāhaṁsu:
analyzed: tam enam brāhmaṇāḥ evam āhasu
translated: The brahmins say to him,

original: ‘kasmā bhavaṁ brāhmaṇo paṭijānamāno sabbakammehi jīvikaṁ kappetī’ti?
analyzed: kasmai bhavam brāhmaṇaḥ paṭijānamānaḥ sabba kammehi jīvikam kappeti iti
translated: ‘Why, sir, do you make a living by all kinds of work, though you claim to be a brahmin?’

original: So evamāha:
analyzed: sā u evam āha
translated: He says,

original: ‘seyyathāpi, bho, aggi sucimpi ḍahati asucimpi ḍahati, na ca tena aggi upalippati;
analyzed: seyyathā api bho aggi su cimpi ḍahati a su cimpi ḍahati na ca tena aggi upalippati
translated: ‘Just as a fire burns clean and unclean things without being stained by them,

original: evamevaṁ kho, bho, sabbakammehi cepi brāhmaṇo jīvikaṁ kappeti, na ca tena brāhmaṇo upalippati.
analyzed: evam evam kho bho sabba kammehi ce ipi brāhmaṇaḥ jīvikam kappeti na ca tena brāhmaṇaḥ upalippati
translated: so too, even if a brahmin makes his living by all sorts of work, he is not stained by it.

original: Sabbakammehi jīvikaṁ kappetī’ti kho, doṇa, tasmā brāhmaṇo brāhmaṇacaṇḍāloti vuccati.
analyzed: sabba kammehi jīvikam kappeti iti kho doṇa tasmā brāhmaṇaḥ brāhmaṇa caṇḍālo ti vuccati
translated: Because he makes his living by all sorts of work, he is called a brahmin outcast.

original: Evaṁ kho, doṇa, brāhmaṇo brāhmaṇacaṇḍālo hoti.🔽Ye kho te, doṇa, brāhmaṇānaṁ pubbakā isayo mantānaṁ kattāro mantānaṁ pavattāro yesamidaṁ🔽etarahi brāhmaṇā porāṇaṁ mantapadaṁ gītaṁ pavuttaṁ samīhitaṁ tadanugāyanti tadanubhāsanti
analyzed: evam kho doṇa brāhmaṇaḥ brāhmaṇa caṇḍālaḥ hoti  ye kho te doṇa brāhmaṇānam pubbakāḥ isayaḥ mantānam kattāraḥ mantānam pavattāraḥ yesam idam  etarahi brāhmaṇā porāṇam manta padam gītam pavuttam samīhitam tat anugāyanti tat anubhāsanti
translated: This is how a brahmin becomes a brahmin outcast.🔽Those ancient brahmin seers, the creators of the hymns, the composers of the hymns,

original: bhāsitamanubhāsanti sajjhāyitamanusajjhāyanti vācitamanuvācenti, seyyathidaṁ—aṭṭhako,🔽vāmako, vāmadevo, vessāmitto, yamadaggi, aṅgīraso, bhāradvājo, vāseṭṭho, kassapo, bhagu;🔽tyassume pañca brāhmaṇe paññāpenti—
analyzed: bhāsitam anubhāsanti sajjhāyitam anusajjhāyanti vācitam anuvācenti sā iyyathidam aṭṭhakaḥ 🔽vāmakaḥ vāmadevaḥ vessāmittaḥ yamadaggi aṅgīrasaḥ bhāradvājaḥ vāseṭṭhaḥ kassapaḥ bhagu 🔽tyassume pañca brāhmaṇe paññāpenti
translated: whose ancient hymns the brahmins nowadays still sing and chant and recite, repeating what was spoken and saying what was said,

original: brahmasamaṁ, devasamaṁ, mariyādaṁ, sambhinnamariyādaṁ, brāhmaṇacaṇḍālaṁyeva pañcamaṁ.
analyzed: brahma sama deva sama mariyāda sambhinnamariyāda brāhmaṇa caṇḍālayā iva pañcama
translated: equal to Brahmā, equal to the gods, the boundary, the boundary-crosser, and the brahmin outcast as the fifth.

original: Tesaṁ tvaṁ, doṇa, katamoti?
analyzed: tesam tva doṇa katamaḥ iti

original: Saṅgāravasutta
analyzed: saṅgāravasutta
translated: With Saṅgārava

original: Atha kho saṅgāravo brāhmaṇo yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavatā saddhiṁ sammodi.

original: Sammodanīyaṁ kathaṁ sāraṇīyaṁ vītisāretvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi. Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho saṅgāravo brāhmaṇo bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: sammodanīyam katham sāraṇīyam vītisāretvā ekamantam nisīdi ekamantam nisinnaḥ kho saṅgāravaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ bhagavantam etat avoca

original: “ko nu kho, bho gotama, hetu ko paccayo, yena kadāci dīgharattaṁ sajjhāyakatāpi mantā nappaṭibhanti, pageva asajjhāyakatā?

translated: “What is the cause, Master Gotama, what is the reason why sometimes even those hymns that have been recited over a long period do not recur to the mind, let alone those that have not been recited?

original: Ko pana, bho gotama, hetu ko paccayo, yena kadāci dīgharattaṁ asajjhāyakatāpi mantā paṭibhanti, pageva sajjhāyakatā”ti?
analyzed: kaḥ pana bho gotama hetu kaḥ paccayaḥ yena kadāci dīgharattam a sajjhāyaka tā api mantā paṭibhanti pagā iva sajjhāyaka tā ati
translated: And what, Master Gotama, is the reason why sometimes even those hymns that have been recited over a long period do not readily come to mind, let alone those that have not been recited?”

original: Yasmiṁ, brāhmaṇa, samaye kāmarāgapariyuṭṭhitena cetasā viharati kāmarāgaparetena,
analyzed: yasmin brāhmaṇa samaye kāma rāga pariyuṭṭhitena cetasā viharati kāma rāga paretena
translated: “Brahmin, there are times when one dwells with a mind obsessed by sensual lust, overwhelmed by sensual lust.

analyzed: uppannassa ca kāma rāgassa nissaraṇam yathābhūtam na pajānāti attattham pi tasmi  samaye yathābhūtam na pajānāti na passati parattham pi tasmin samaye yathābhūta
translated: And one does not understand as it really is the escape from arisen sensual lust.🔽One does not understand as it really is one’s own good,

original: Tattha cakkhumā puriso sakaṁ mukhanimittaṁ paccavekkhamāno yathābhūtaṁ nappajāneyya na passeyya.
analyzed: tattha cakkhumā puriso sakam mukha nimittam paccavekkhamānaḥ yathābhūtam na pajāneyya na passeyya

analyzed: evam evam kho brāhmaṇa yasmin samaye kāma rāga pariyuṭṭhitena cetasā viharati kāma rāga paretena
translated: “So too, brahmin, when one dwells with a mind obsessed by sensual lust, overwhelmed by sensual lust,

original: uppannassa ca kāmarāgassa nissaraṇaṁ yathābhūtaṁ nappajānāti, attatthampi tasmiṁ🔽samaye yathābhūtaṁ nappajānāti na passati, paratthampi …pe… ubhayatthampi tasmiṁ🔽samaye yathābhūtaṁ nappajānāti na passati, dīgharattaṁ sajjhāyakatāpi mantā nappaṭibhanti,
analyzed: uppannassa ca kāma rāgassa nissaraṇam yathābhūtam na pajānāti attattham pi tasmi  samaye yathābhūtam na pajānāti na passati parattham pi pe ubhayattham pi tasmi  samaye yathābhūtam na pajānāti na passati dīgharattam sajjhāyaka tā api mantāḥ na paṭibhanti
translated: and one does not understand as it really is the escape from arisen sensual lust, one does not understand as it really is: ‘There is profit here,’

original: pageva asajjhāyakatā.
analyzed: pagā iva a sajjhāyaka tā
translated: one does not understand as it really is: ‘There is profit here,’ one does not understand as it really is: ‘There is no profit here,’ one does not understand as it really is: ‘There is a higher escape,’ one does not understand as it really is: ‘There is no higher escape.’🔽Even though he may be a longtime practitioner, a longtime undertaker of things, a longtime erector of the dwelling, a longtime bull of a brahma, still his mind does not become malleable, workable, and radiant, prepared for the work of destruction.

original: Puna caparaṁ, brāhmaṇa, yasmiṁ samaye byāpādapariyuṭṭhitena cetasā viharati byāpādaparetena,
analyzed: puna capara brāhmaṇa yasmin samaye byāpāda pariyuṭṭhitena cetasā viharati byāpāda paretena
translated: “Again, brahmin, when one dwells with a mind obsessed by ill will, overwhelmed by ill will,

analyzed: yathābhūtam na pajānāti na passati parattham pi pe ubhayattham pi tasmin samaye
