analyzed: yathābhūtam na pajānāti na passati dīgharattam sajjhāyaka tā api mantāḥ na paṭibhanti
translated: At that time he does not understand it as it really is. He does not see it as it really is. Even those hymns that he has recited over a long period do not recur to his mind,

original: pageva asajjhāyakatā.
analyzed: pagā iva a sajjhāyaka tā
translated: let alone those he has not recited.

original: Seyyathāpi, brāhmaṇa, udapatto agginā santatto ukkudhito ussadakajāto.

original: Tattha cakkhumā puriso sakaṁ mukhanimittaṁ paccavekkhamāno yathābhūtaṁ nappajāneyya na passeyya.

analyzed: evam evam kho brāhmaṇa yasmin samaye byāpāda pariyuṭṭhitena cetasā viharati byāpāda paretena  uppannassa ca byāpādassa nissaraṇam yathābhūtam na pajānāti attattham pi tasmin samaye

analyzed: yathābhūtam na pajānāti na passati dīgharattam sajjhāyaka tā api mantāḥ na paṭibhanti
translated: At that time one does not understand it as it really is. One does not see it as it really is. Even those hymns that one has recited over a long period do not recur to one’s mind,🔽let alone those one has not recited.

analyzed: tattha cakkhumā puriso sakam mukha nimittam paccavekkhamānaḥ yathābhūtam na pajāneyya na passeyya  evam evam kho brāhmaṇa yasmin samaye uddhacca kukkucca pariyuṭṭhitena cetasā viharati

original: mantā paṭibhanti, pageva sajjhāyakatā.
analyzed: mantā paṭibhanti pagā iva sajjhāyaka tā
translated: Even those hymns that he has not recited over a long period recur to his mind, let alone those he has recited.

original: Seyyathāpi, brāhmaṇa, udapatto asaṁsaṭṭho lākhāya vā haliddiyā vā nīliyā vā mañjiṭṭhāya vā.
analyzed: sa iyyathā api brāhmaṇaḥ uda pattaḥ a sasaṭṭhaḥ lākhāya vā haliddiyā vā nīliyā vā mañjiṭṭhāya vā
translated: “Suppose, brahmin, there is a pond whose waters well up from below.

original: Tattha cakkhumā puriso sakaṁ mukhanimittaṁ paccavekkhamāno yathābhūtaṁ pajāneyya passeyya.
analyzed: tattha cakkhumā puriso sakam mukha nimittam paccavekkhamānaḥ yathābhūtam pajāneyya passeyya
translated: A man with good sight, seeing the reflection of his own face, would know and see it as it really is.

original: Evamevaṁ kho, brāhmaṇa, yasmiṁ samaye na kāmarāgapariyuṭṭhitena cetasā viharati …pe….
analyzed: evam evam kho brāhmaṇa yasmin samaye na kāma rāga pariyuṭṭhitena cetasā viharati pe
translated: In the same way, when his mind is not obsessed by sensual lust …

original: Puna caparaṁ, brāhmaṇa, yasmiṁ samaye na byāpādapariyuṭṭhitena cetasā viharati …pe…
analyzed: puna capara brāhmaṇa yasmin samaye na byāpāda pariyuṭṭhitena cetasā viharati pe
translated: Again, when his mind is not obsessed by ill will …

original: seyyathāpi, brāhmaṇa, udapatto agginā asantatto anukkudhito anussadakajāto.
analyzed: seyyathā api brāhmaṇaḥ uda pattaḥ agginā a santattaḥ an ukkudhitaḥ an ussadaka jātaḥ
translated: Suppose there were a bowl of water not mixed with lac,

original: Tattha cakkhumā puriso sakaṁ mukhanimittaṁ paccavekkhamāno yathābhūtaṁ pajāneyya passeyya.
analyzed: tattha cakkhumā puriso sakam mukha nimittam paccavekkhamānaḥ yathābhūtam pajāneyya passeyya
translated: A man with good sight, seeing the reflection of his own face, would know and see it as it really is.

original: Evamevaṁ kho, brāhmaṇa, yasmiṁ samaye na byāpādapariyuṭṭhitena cetasā viharati …pe….
analyzed: evam evam kho brāhmaṇa yasmin samaye na byāpāda pariyuṭṭhitena cetasā viharati pe
translated: In the same way, when his mind is not obsessed by ill will …

analyzed: puna capara brāhmaṇa yasmin samaye na thinam iddha pariyuṭṭhitena cetasā viharati pe
translated: Again, when his mind is not obsessed by stiffness and torpor …

original: seyyathāpi, brāhmaṇa, udapatto na sevālapaṇakapariyonaddho.
analyzed: seyyathā api brāhmaṇaḥ uda pattaḥ na sevā lapaṇaka pariyonaddhaḥ
translated: Suppose there were a bowl of water not covered over with water plants and algae,

original: Tattha cakkhumā puriso sakaṁ mukhanimittaṁ paccavekkhamāno yathābhūtaṁ pajāneyya passeyya.
analyzed: tattha cakkhumā puriso sakam mukha nimittam paccavekkhamānaḥ yathābhūtam pajāneyya passeyya
translated: A man with good sight, looking at his own face in a clear, clean, stainless, and spotless looking-glass or bowl of water, would know it as it really is.

original: Evamevaṁ kho, brāhmaṇa, yasmiṁ samaye na thinamiddhapariyuṭṭhitena cetasā viharati …pe….
analyzed: evam evam kho brāhmaṇa yasmin samaye na thinam iddha pariyuṭṭhitena cetasā viharati pe
translated: In the same way, when the mind is not overwhelmed by sloth and torpor…

original: Puna caparaṁ, brāhmaṇa, yasmiṁ samaye na uddhaccakukkuccapariyuṭṭhitena cetasā viharati …pe…
analyzed: puna capara brāhmaṇa yasmin samaye na uddhacca kukkucca pariyuṭṭhitena cetasā viharati pe
translated: Again, when the mind is not overwhelmed by restlessness and remorse…

original: seyyathāpi, brāhmaṇa, udapatto na vāterito na calito na bhanto na ūmijāto.
analyzed: seyyathā api brāhmaṇaḥ uda pattaḥ na vāta īritaḥ na calitaḥ na bhantaḥ na ūmi jātaḥ
translated: Suppose there is a pool of water that is not stirred, not disturbed, not in ripples, not in waves,

original: Tattha cakkhumā puriso sakaṁ mukhanimittaṁ paccavekkhamāno yathābhūtaṁ pajāneyya passeyya.
analyzed: tattha cakkhumā puriso sakam mukha nimittam paccavekkhamānaḥ yathābhūtam pajāneyya passeyya
translated: A man with good sight, looking at his own face in that water, would know it as it really is.

original: Evamevaṁ kho, brāhmaṇa, yasmiṁ samaye na uddhaccakukkuccapariyuṭṭhitena cetasā viharati …pe….
analyzed: evam evam kho brāhmaṇa yasmin samaye na uddhacca kukkucca pariyuṭṭhitena cetasā viharati pe
translated: In the same way, when the mind is not overwhelmed by restlessness and remorse…

original: Puna caparaṁ, brāhmaṇa, yasmiṁ samaye na vicikicchāpariyuṭṭhitena cetasā viharati
analyzed: puna capara brāhmaṇa yasmin samaye na vicikicchā pariyuṭṭhitena cetasā viharati
translated: Again, when the mind is not overwhelmed by doubt…

original: na vicikicchāparetena, uppannāya ca vicikicchāya nissaraṇaṁ yathābhūtaṁ pajānāti,
analyzed: na vicikicchā paretena uppannāya ca vicikicchāya nissaraṇam yathābhūtam pajānāti
translated: and he understands as it really is the escape from arisen doubt,

original: attatthampi tasmiṁ samaye yathābhūtaṁ pajānāti passati, paratthampi tasmiṁ samaye
analyzed: attattham pi tasmin samaye yathābhūtam pajānāti passati parattham pi tasmin samaye
translated: he understands and sees, as it really is, his own good,🔽he understands and sees, as it really is, the good of others,

original: yathābhūtaṁ pajānāti passati, ubhayatthampi tasmiṁ samaye yathābhūtaṁ pajānāti passati,
analyzed: yathābhūtam pajānāti passati ubhayattham pi tasmin samaye yathābhūtam pajānāti passati
translated: he understands and sees, as it really is, the good of both,

original: dīgharattaṁ asajjhāyakatāpi mantā paṭibhanti, pageva sajjhāyakatā.
analyzed: dīgharattam a sajjhāyaka tā api mantā paṭibhanti pagā iva sajjhāyaka tā
translated: even those hymns that have not been recited over a long period recur to the mind, let alone those that have been recited.

original: Seyyathāpi, brāhmaṇa, udapatto accho vippasanno anāvilo āloke nikkhitto.
analyzed: seyyathā api brāhmaṇaḥ uda pattaḥ acchas vippasannaḥ anāvilaḥ āloke nikkhitto
translated: “Suppose, brahmin, there were a pool of water that was clear, limpid, and undisturbed,

original: Tattha cakkhumā puriso sakaṁ mukhanimittaṁ paccavekkhamāno yathābhūtaṁ pajāneyya passeyya.🔽Evamevaṁ kho, brāhmaṇa, yasmiṁ samaye na vicikicchāpariyuṭṭhitena cetasā viharati
analyzed: tattha cakkhumā puriso sakam mukha nimittam paccavekkhamānaḥ yathābhūtam pajāneyya passeyya  evam evam kho brāhmaṇa yasmin samaye na vicikicchā pariyuṭṭhitena cetasā viharati
translated: and a man with good sight standing on the bank examining his own facial reflection would understand it as it really is thus: ‘This is just the reflection of my face; it has come into being dependent on this clear, limpid, undisturbed water and this my face.’

original: na vicikicchāparetena, uppannāya ca vicikicchāya nissaraṇaṁ yathābhūtaṁ pajānāti,
analyzed: na vicikicchā paretena uppannāya ca vicikicchāya nissaraṇam yathābhūtam pajānāti
translated: So too, brahmin, on an occasion when one dwells with a mind obsessed by doubt, not knowing as it really is (the meaning of) ‘This is wholesome, this is unwholesome, this is blamable, this is blameless, this is to be cultivated, this is not to be cultivated, this is the unwholesome root, this is the wholesome root,’🔽and on that occasion one does not understand as it really is (the meaning of) ‘This is wholesome, this is unwholesome, this is blamable, this is blameless, this is to be cultivated, this is not to be cultivated, this is the unwholesome root, this is the wholesome root,’🔽he understands and sees, as it really is, his own good,🔽he understands and sees, as it really is, the good of others,

original: attatthampi tasmiṁ samaye yathābhūtaṁ pajānāti passati, paratthampi …pe… ubhayatthampi
analyzed: attattham pi tasmin samaye yathābhūtam pajānāti passati parattham pi pe ubhayattham pi
translated: he understands and sees, as it really is, the good of both,

original: tasmiṁ samaye yathābhūtaṁ pajānāti passati, dīgharattaṁ asajjhāyakatāpi mantā paṭibhanti,
analyzed: tasmin samaye yathābhūtam pajānāti passati dīgharattam a sajjhāyaka tā api mantā paṭibhanti
translated: At that time he understands and sees things as they really are. Even those hymns that he hasn’t recited for a long time come back to his mind,

original: pageva sajjhāyakatā.
analyzed: pagā iva sajjhāyaka tā
translated: let alone those he has recited.

original: Ayaṁ kho, brāhmaṇa, hetu ayaṁ paccayo, yena kadāci dīgharattaṁ sajjhāyakatāpi mantā nappaṭibhanti, pageva asajjhāyakatā.
analyzed: ayam kho brāhmaṇa hetu ayam paccayaḥ yena kadāci dīgharattam sajjhāyaka tā api mantāḥ na paṭibhanti pagā iva a sajjhāyaka tā
translated: This is the reason why sometimes even those hymns that have been recited over a long period don’t come to mind, let alone those that haven’t been recited.

original: Ayaṁ pana, brāhmaṇa, hetu ayaṁ paccayo, yena kadāci dīgharattaṁ asajjhāyakatāpi mantā paṭibhanti, pageva sajjhāyakatā”ti.
analyzed: ayam pana brāhmaṇa hetu ayam paccayaḥ yena kadāci dīgharattam a sajjhāyaka tā api mantā paṭibhanti pagā iva sajjhāyaka tā ati
translated: But this is the reason why sometimes even those hymns that haven’t been recited over a long period come to mind, let alone those that have been recited.”

original: “Abhikkantaṁ, bho gotama …pe… upāsakaṁ maṁ bhavaṁ gotamo dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇupetaṁ saraṇaṁ gatan”ti.🔽Tatiyaṁ.
analyzed: abhikkanta bho gotama pe upāsakam mam bhavam gotamaḥ dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇupetam saraṇam gatanti  tatiya
translated: “Excellent, Master Gotama! … From this day forth, may Master Gotama remember me as a lay follower who has gone for refuge for life.”🔽The third section for recitation is finished.

original: Aṅguttara Nikāya 5.194
analyzed: aṅguttara nikāya
translated: The Book of the Fives

original: 20. Brāhmaṇavagga
analyzed: brāhmaṇa vagga
translated: The Brahmins

original: Kāraṇapālīsutta
analyzed: kāraṇapālīsutta
translated: With Karani

original: Ekaṁ samayaṁ bhagavā vesāliyaṁ viharati mahāvane kūṭāgārasālāyaṁ.
analyzed: ekam samayam bhagavā vesāliyam viharati mahā vane kūṭāgāra sālāya
translated: At one time the Buddha was staying at Vesālī, in the Great Wood, in the hall with the peaked roof.

original: Tena kho pana samayena kāraṇapālī brāhmaṇo licchavīnaṁ kammantaṁ kāreti.
analyzed: tena khalu pana samayena kāraṇapālī brāhmaṇaḥ licchavīnam kammantam kāreti
translated: On that occasion the brahmin Karani was performing a sacrifice for the Licchavis.

original: Addasā kho kāraṇapālī brāhmaṇo piṅgiyāniṁ brāhmaṇaṁ dūratova āgacchantaṁ;🔽disvā piṅgiyāniṁ brāhmaṇaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: addasā kho kāraṇapālī brāhmaṇaḥ piṅgiyānim brāhmaṇam dūratas uva āgacchanta  disvā piṅgiyānim brāhmaṇam etat avoca
translated: The brahmin saw Piṅgiyānī coming in the distance

original: “Handa kuto nu bhavaṁ piṅgiyānī āgacchati divā divassā”ti?
analyzed: handa kutas nu bhavam piṅgiyānī āgacchati divā divassāti
translated: and said to him, “Where is Master Piṅgiyānī coming from in the middle of the day?”

original: “Itohaṁ, bho, āgacchāmi samaṇassa gotamassa santikā”ti.
analyzed: itas ha bho āgacchāmi samaṇassa gotamassa santikā ati
translated: “I am coming from the presence of the recluse Gotama, Master Kāraṇapālī.”

original: “Taṁ kiṁ maññati bhavaṁ piṅgiyānī samaṇassa gotamassa paññāveyyattiyaṁ? Paṇḍito maññe”ti?
analyzed: tam kim maññati bhavam piṅgiyānī samaṇassa gotamassa paṇḍitaḥ maññeti
translated: “What do you think of the recluse Gotama’s lucidity of wisdom? He seems to be wise.”

original: “Ko cāhaṁ, bho, ko ca samaṇassa gotamassa paññāveyyattiyaṁ jānissāmi.
analyzed: kaḥ ca āha bho kaḥ ca samaṇassa gotamassa paññāveyyattiyam jānissāmi
translated: “Master Kāraṇapālī, who am I to know about the recluse Gotama’s lucidity of wisdom?

original: Sopi nūnassa tādisova yo samaṇassa gotamassa paññāveyyattiyaṁ jāneyyā”ti.
analyzed: saḥ api nūna ssa tādisaḥ uva yaḥ samaṇassa gotamassa jāneyya ati
translated: Only someone like him could know about his lucidity of wisdom.”

original: “Uḷārāya khalu bhavaṁ piṅgiyānī samaṇaṁ gotamaṁ pasaṁsāya pasaṁsatī”ti.
analyzed: uḷārāya khalu bhavam piṅgiyānī samaṇam gotamam pasasāya pasasati iti
translated: “Master Piṅgiyānī praises the recluse Gotama with high praise indeed.”

original: “Ko cāhaṁ, bho, ko ca samaṇaṁ gotamaṁ pasaṁsissāmi.
analyzed: kaḥ ca āha bho kaḥ ca samaṇam gotamam pasasissāmi
translated: “Master Kāraṇapālī, who am I to praise the recluse Gotama?

original: Pasatthappasatthova so bhavaṁ gotamo seṭṭho devamanussānan”ti.
analyzed: pasattha ppasatthaḥ uva so bhavam gotamo seṭṭhaḥ deva manussānam ti
translated: The Master Gotama is praised by the praised as best among gods and humans.”

original: “Kiṁ pana bhavaṁ piṅgiyānī atthavasaṁ sampassamāno samaṇe gotame evaṁ abhippasanno”ti?
analyzed: kim pana bhavam piṅgiyānī atthavasam sampassamāno samaṇe gotame evam abhippasanno ti
translated: “But what reason do you see for having such confidence in the Buddha?”

original: “Seyyathāpi, bho, puriso aggarasaparititto na aññesaṁ hīnānaṁ rasānaṁ piheti;
analyzed: seyyathā api bho purisaḥ agga rasa paritittaḥ na aññesam hīnānam rasānam piheti
translated: “Just as a person tormented by hunger would not enjoy anything else if given the choice,

original: evamevaṁ kho, bho, yato yato tassa bhoto gotamassa dhammaṁ suṇāti—
analyzed: evam evam kho bho yatas yatas tassa bhotaḥ gotamassa dhammam suṇāti
translated: in the same way, when I hear the Dhamma from the Buddha—

original: yadi suttaso, yadi geyyaso, yadi veyyākaraṇaso, yadi abbhutadhammaso—
analyzed: yadi sutta so yadi geyya so yadi veyyākaraṇa so yadi abbhuta dhamma so
translated: whether a discourse, a chant, a proof-text, or a description of extrasensory powers—

original: tato tato na aññesaṁ puthusamaṇabrāhmaṇappavādānaṁ piheti.🔽Seyyathāpi, bho, puriso jighacchādubbalyapareto madhupiṇḍikaṁ adhigaccheyya.
analyzed: tatas tatas na aññesam puthu samaṇa brāhmaṇa ppavādānam piha iti  sa iyyathā api bho purisaḥ jighacchā dubbalya paretaḥ madhu piṇḍikam adhigaccheyya
translated: I don’t enjoy anything else if given the choice.

original: So yato yato sāyetha, labhateva sādurasaṁ asecanakaṁ;
analyzed: saḥ yatas yatas labhatā iva sādurasam asecanaka
translated: Just as a person weakened by hunger would find any sweet and delicious food satisfying,

original: evamevaṁ kho, bho, yato yato tassa bhoto gotamassa dhammaṁ suṇāti—
analyzed: evam evam kho bho yatas yatas tassa bhotaḥ gotamassa dhammam suṇāti
translated: in the same way, when I hear the Dhamma from the Buddha—

original: yadi suttaso, yadi geyyaso, yadi veyyākaraṇaso, yadi abbhutadhammaso—
analyzed: yadi sutta so yadi geyya so yadi veyyākaraṇa so yadi abbhuta dhamma so
translated: whether a discourse, a chant, a proof-text, or a description of extrasensory powers—

original: tato tato labhateva attamanataṁ, labhati cetaso pasādaṁ.
analyzed: tatas tatas labhatā iva labhati cetasaḥ pasāda
translated: I find it satisfying and refreshing.

original: Seyyathāpi, bho, puriso candanaghaṭikaṁ adhigaccheyya—🔽haricandanassa vā lohitacandanassa vā.🔽So yato yato ghāyetha—
analyzed: sa iyyathā api bho purisaḥ candana ghaṭikam adhigaccheyya  haricandanassa vā lohitacandanassa vā  saḥ yatas yatas ghāyetha
translated: Just as if a man were to find a piece of sandalwood—🔽fragrant sandalwood—🔽whether he were to burn it in a charcoal pit,

original: yadi mūlato, yadi majjhato, yadi aggato—
analyzed: yadi mūlataḥ yadi majjhataḥ yadi aggataḥ
translated: or use it for his bedding,

original: adhigacchateva surabhigandhaṁ asecanakaṁ;
analyzed: adhigacchata iva surabhi gandham asecanaka
translated: he would still get a pleasant fragrance;

original: evamevaṁ kho, bho, yato yato tassa bhoto gotamassa dhammaṁ suṇāti—
analyzed: evam evam kho bho yatas yatas tassa bhotaḥ gotamassa dhammam suṇāti
translated: in the same way, whatever I hear about Master Gotama’s Dhamma—

original: yadi suttaso, yadi geyyaso, yadi veyyākaraṇaso, yadi abbhutadhammaso—
analyzed: yadi sutta so yadi geyya so yadi veyyākaraṇa so yadi abbhuta dhamma so
translated: whether it is a discourse in prose, or a verse, or a phrase by phrase explanation, or a recitation of the scriptures—

original: tato tato adhigacchati pāmojjaṁ adhigacchati somanassaṁ.
analyzed: tatas tatas adhigacchati pāmojjam adhigacchati somanassa
translated: I get joy and happiness from it.

original: Seyyathāpi, bho, puriso ābādhiko dukkhito bāḷhagilāno.
analyzed: seyyathā api bho purisaḥ ābādhikaḥ dukkhitaḥ bāḷha gilānaḥ
translated: Just as if a sick person were to get what he wanted,

original: Tassa kusalo bhisakko ṭhānaso ābādhaṁ nīhareyya;
analyzed: tassa kusalaḥ bhisakkaḥ ṭhānasaḥ ābādham nīhareyya
translated: what was suitable for him, and a skilled physician,

original: evamevaṁ kho, bho, yato yato tassa bhoto gotamassa dhammaṁ suṇāti—
analyzed: evam evam kho bho yatas yatas tassa bhotaḥ gotamassa dhammam suṇāti
translated: in the same way, whatever I hear about Master Gotama’s Dhamma—

original: yadi suttaso, yadi geyyaso, yadi veyyākaraṇaso, yadi abbhutadhammaso—
analyzed: yadi sutta so yadi geyya so yadi veyyākaraṇa so yadi abbhuta dhamma so
translated: whether it is a discourse in prose, or a verse, or a phrase by phrase explanation, or a recitation of the scriptures—

original: tato tato sokaparidevadukkhadomanassupāyāsā abbhatthaṁ gacchanti.
analyzed: tatas tatas soka parideva dukkha domanassa upāyāsāḥ abbhattham gacchanti
translated: Then sorrow, lamentation, pain, displeasure, and despair cease.

original: Seyyathāpi, bho, pokkharaṇī acchodakā sātodakā sītodakā setakā supatitthā ramaṇīyā.🔽Atha puriso āgaccheyya ghammābhitatto ghammapareto kilanto tasito pipāsito.
analyzed: seyyathā api bho pokkharaṇī acchodakā sātodakā sītodakā setakā supatitthā ramaṇīyā  atha purisaḥ āgaccheyya ghamma abhitattaḥ ghamma paretaḥ kilantaḥ tasitaḥ pipāsitaḥ
translated: Suppose there were a lotus pond with clear, cool, sweet, pellucid water, peaceful and undisturbed, with smooth banks, a delightful place.🔽Then a man scorched and exhausted by a hot wind in the last month of the hot season would come there.

original: So taṁ pokkharaṇiṁ ogāhetvā nhātvā ca pivitvā ca sabbadarathakilamathapariḷāhaṁ paṭippassambheyya.
analyzed: saḥ tam pokkharaṇim ogāhetvā nhātvā ca pivitvā ca sabba daratha kilamatha pariḷāham paṭippassambheyya
translated: He would bathe in the lotus pond and drink the water, and then continue on his way.

original: Evamevaṁ kho, bho, yato yato tassa bhoto gotamassa dhammaṁ suṇāti—
analyzed: evam evam kho bho yatas yatas tassa bhotaḥ gotamassa dhammam suṇāti
translated: In the same way, whenever I hear the Dhamma from the Buddha—

original: yadi suttaso, yadi geyyaso, yadi veyyākaraṇaso, yadi abbhutadhammaso—
analyzed: yadi sutta so yadi geyya so yadi veyyākaraṇa so yadi abbhuta dhamma so
translated: whether a discourse, a chant, a verse, a spontaneous utterance, a brief explanation, a tale, a birth story, a vast narration, or a detailed description—🔽then all my distress, discomfort, and fever of the mind is completely removed.”

original: tato tato sabbadarathakilamathapariḷāhā paṭippassambhantī”ti.
analyzed: tatas tatas sabbada ratha kilamatha pariḷāhā paṭippassambhanti iti
translated: and then the fatigue, weariness, and distress of the whole kingdom were allayed.”

original: Evaṁ vutte, kāraṇapālī brāhmaṇo uṭṭhāyāsanā ekaṁsaṁ uttarāsaṅgaṁ karitvā dakkhiṇaṁ jāṇumaṇḍalaṁ pathaviyaṁ nihantvā yena bhagavā tenañjaliṁ paṇāmetvā tikkhattuṁ udānaṁ udānesi:🔽“Namo tassa bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa.

original: Katamā pañca?🔽Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno kāmaṁ manasikaroto kāmesu cittaṁ na pakkhandati nappasīdati na santiṭṭhati na vimuccati.🔽Nekkhammaṁ kho panassa manasikaroto nekkhamme cittaṁ pakkhandati pasīdati santiṭṭhati vimuccati.
analyzed: katamā pañca  idha bhikkhave bhikkhuno kāmam manasikarotaḥ kāmesu cittam na pakkhandati na pasīdati na santiṭṭhati na vimuccati  nekkhammam kho panassa manasikarotaḥ nekkhamme cittam pakkhandati pasīdati santiṭṭhati vimuccati
translated: What five?🔽Here, when a monk gives attention to sensual desire, his mind does not launch out upon them and settle internally, and he is not confirmed in the knowledge and vision that they are insubstantial.

original: Tassa taṁ cittaṁ sugataṁ subhāvitaṁ suvuṭṭhitaṁ suvimuttaṁ suvisaṁyuttaṁ kāmehi;
analyzed: tassa tam cittam sugatam su bhāvitam su vuṭṭhitam su vimuttam su visayuttam kāmehi
translated: But when he gives attention to renunciation, his mind launches out upon it and settles internally, and he is confirmed in the knowledge and vision that it is insubstantial.🔽His mind is well developed, well-proclaimed, and well-liberated in that it is unattached to sensual pleasures.

translated: and the taints, fevers, and troubles that arise because of sensual desires, he is free from them, and he does not experience those feelings.

translated: This is the escape from sensual desires.

translated: “Again, when a bhikkhu gives attention to ill will, his mind does not launch out upon it, does not launch into it, does not plunge into it, and does not rest in it.🔽But when he gives attention to non-ill will, his mind launches out upon it, launches into it, plunges into it, and rests in it.

original: Tassa taṁ cittaṁ sugataṁ subhāvitaṁ suvuṭṭhitaṁ suvimuttaṁ suvisaṁyuttaṁ byāpādena;

translated: His mind is well developed, well advanced, well liberated, and well detached from ill will.

original: ye ca byāpādapaccayā uppajjanti āsavā vighātapariḷāhā, mutto so tehi, na so taṁ vedanaṁ vediyati.
analyzed: ye ca byāpāda paccayāḥ uppajjanti āsavāḥ vighāta pariḷāhāḥ muttaḥ saḥ tehi na saḥ tam vedanam

original: Idamakkhātaṁ byāpādassa nissaraṇaṁ.

translated: This is the escape from ill will.

original: Puna caparaṁ, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno vihesaṁ manasikaroto vihesāya cittaṁ na pakkhandati nappasīdati na santiṭṭhati na vimuccati.

analyzed: a vihesam kho panassa manasikarotaḥ a vihesāya cittam pakkhandati pasīdati santiṭṭhati vimuccati

original: Idamakkhātaṁ vihesāya nissaraṇaṁ.

translated: “Again, bhikkhus, when a bhikkhu brings form to mind, his mind does not enter into form, place confidence in form, steady on form, and become free in form.🔽When he brings formless to mind, his mind enters into formless, places confidence in formless, steadies on formless, and becomes free in formless.

original: Tassa taṁ cittaṁ sugataṁ subhāvitaṁ suvuṭṭhitaṁ suvimuttaṁ suvisaṁyuttaṁ rūpehi;
analyzed: tassa tam cittam sugatam su bhāvitam su vuṭṭhitam su vimuttam su visayuttam rūpehi
translated: His mind is well-restrained, well-released, well-purified, well-transcended, and well-separated from forms;

original: ye ca rūpapaccayā uppajjanti āsavā vighātapariḷāhā, mutto so tehi, na so taṁ vedanaṁ vediyati.

original: Katamehi pañcahi?
analyzed: katamehi pañcahi

original: Sīlavā hoti, pātimokkhasaṁvarasaṁvuto viharati ācāragocarasampanno aṇumattesu vajjesu bhayadassāvī, samādāya sikkhati sikkhāpadesu;

translated: He is virtuous, and dwells restrained with the restraint of the Patimokkha, and is endowed with (good) conduct and resort, seeing danger in the slightest faults, and having undertaken them, trains in the training rules.

original: bahussuto hoti sutadharo sutasannicayo, ye te dhammā ādikalyāṇā majjhekalyāṇā pariyosānakalyāṇā🔽sātthaṁ sabyañjanaṁ kevalaparipuṇṇaṁ parisuddhaṁ brahmacariyaṁ abhivadanti, tathārūpāssa

translated: He is learned, and remembers and keeps what he has learned. Those teachings that are good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end,🔽that, having good meaning, have good syllables, and reveal the holy life (that is) utterly perfect and pure,

original: dhammā bahussutā honti dhātā vacasā paricitā manasānupekkhitā diṭṭhiyā suppaṭividdhā;

original: kalyāṇavāco hoti kalyāṇavākkaraṇo poriyā vācāya samannāgato vissaṭṭhāya anelagalāya atthassa viññāpaniyā;🔽catunnaṁ jhānānaṁ ābhicetasikānaṁ diṭṭhadhammasukhavihārānaṁ nikāmalābhī hoti akicchalābhī akasiralābhī;

translated: He is a good speaker with a good voice, one who communicates well, is gifted with speech that is polished, clear, reasoned, and expresses the meaning.🔽He is one who obtains at will, without trouble or difficulty, the four jhānas that constitute the higher mind and are pleasant dwellings in this very life.

original: āsavānaṁ khayā anāsavaṁ cetovimuttiṁ paññāvimuttiṁ diṭṭheva dhamme sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharati.

original: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahi dhammehi samannāgato āvāsiko bhikkhu sabrahmacārīnaṁ piyo ca hoti manāpo ca garu ca bhāvanīyo cā”ti.🔽Dutiyaṁ.🔽Aṅguttara Nikāya 5.233

translated: When a resident monk has these five qualities, he’s cast down to hell as if he were carried there.

analyzed: asuci duggandhā sa paṭibhayā vāḷānam amanussānam āvāsaḥ bahuno janassa ārodanā

analyzed: ime kho bhikkhave pañca ādīnavāḥ sivathikāya

original: Katame pañca?

original: Idamassa duggandhatāya vadāmi.

original: tathūpamāhaṁ, bhikkhave, imaṁ puggalaṁ vadāmi.

analyzed: tathūpamā āha bhikkhave imam puggalam vadāmi
translated: I say that this person is just like that.

original: So asucinā kāyakammena samannāgato, asucinā vacīkammena samannāgato, asucinā manokammena samannāgato sabhāgehi puggalehi saddhiṁ saṁvasati.

original: Idamassa vāḷāvāsasmiṁ vadāmi.
analyzed: idam assa vadāmi

original: Seyyathāpi sā, bhikkhave, sivathikā vāḷānaṁ amanussānaṁ āvāso;

original: tathūpamāhaṁ, bhikkhave, imaṁ puggalaṁ vadāmi.
analyzed: tathūpamā āha bhikkhave imam puggalam vadāmi
translated: I say that this person is just like that.

analyzed: tam enam asucinā kāya kammena samannāgata asucinā vacī kammena samannāgata asucinā manaḥ kammena samannāgatam pesalā sabrahmacārī disvā khīya dhammaṃ āpajjanti

original: Idamassa ārodanāya vadāmi.

original: Seyyathāpi sā, bhikkhave, sivathikā bahuno janassa ārodanā;

original: Tassa evaṁ hoti:

original: Tassa evaṁ hoti:

original: Bhikkhūsu appasādabahulo hoti.
analyzed: bhikkhūsu appasāda bahulaḥ hoti
translated: He has little confidence in the monks.

original: Bhikkhūsu appasādabahulo samāno aññe bhikkhū na bhajati.🔽Aññe bhikkhū abhajanto saddhammaṁ na suṇāti.
analyzed: bhikkhūsu appasāda bahulo samāno aññe bhikkhū na bhajati  aññe bhikkhū a bhajanto saddhammam na suṇāti
translated: Because he has little confidence in the monks, he doesn’t associate with them.🔽Because he doesn’t associate with them, he doesn’t hear the Teaching.

original: Saddhammaṁ asuṇanto saddhammā parihāyati.
analyzed: saddhammam a suṇantaḥ saddhammā
translated: Because he doesn’t hear the Teaching, he falls back, wasting away in knowledge and vision.

original: Ayaṁ, bhikkhave, dutiyo ādīnavo puggalappasāde.
analyzed: bhikkhave dutiyaḥ ādīnavaḥ puggala ppasāde
translated: This is the second danger in placing faith in a person.

original: Puna caparaṁ, bhikkhave, yasmiṁ puggale puggalo abhippasanno hoti, so disāpakkanto hoti …pe… so vibbhanto hoti …pe… so kālaṅkato hoti.
analyzed: puna capara bhikkhave yasmin puggale puggalaḥ abhippasannaḥ hoti saḥ disā pakkantaḥ hoti pe saḥ vibbhantaḥ hoti pe saḥ kālaṅkataḥ hoti
translated: “There is another case where a person has faith in a person, but that person has gone away … has died.

original: Tassa evaṁ hoti:
analyzed: tassa evam hoti
translated: He thinks,

original: ‘yo kho myāyaṁ puggalo piyo manāpo so kālaṅkato’ti.

translated: ‘The person I have faith in, who is dear and beloved to me, has died.’

original: Aññe bhikkhū na bhajati.
analyzed: aññe bhikkhū na bhajati
translated: Because he has little confidence in the monks, he doesn’t associate with them.

original: Aññe bhikkhū abhajanto saddhammaṁ na suṇāti.
analyzed: aññe bhikkhū a bhajanto saddhammam na suṇāti
translated: He doesn’t listen to the true Teaching.

original: Saddhammaṁ asuṇanto saddhammā parihāyati.
analyzed: saddhammam a suṇantaḥ saddhammā

original: Ayaṁ, bhikkhave, pañcamo ādīnavo puggalappasāde.
analyzed: bhikkhave pañcamaḥ ādīnavaḥ puggala ppasāde
translated: This is the fifth danger in placing confidence in people.

original: Ime kho, bhikkhave, pañca ādīnavā puggalappasāde”ti.
analyzed: ime kho bhikkhave pañca ādīnavā puggala ppasāde ti

original: Tassuddānaṁ🔽Duccaritaṁ kāyaduccaritaṁ,

original: Vacīduccaritaṁ manoduccaritaṁ;

original: Catūhi pare dve sivathikā,
analyzed: catūhi pare dve sivathikā

analyzed: puggala ppasādena ca ati  pañcamaḥ paṇṇāsakaḥ samatto
translated: And placing confidence in people.🔽The fifth section is finished.
